story:
Tanzania Village Water Project

The volunteers of HELP International have discovered an incredibly critical need for access to clean drinking water in Northern Tanzania. Using our time and effort and your help, we will be able to drill a well that will bring clean drinking water to a village of nearly 3,000 people!

Water is LIFE. We need it to DRINK. We need it to WASH. We need it to live. Only 54% of the Tanzania population has access to improved water supplies and 24% have access to adequate sanitation. The current water source for these villagers is an infected water hole. Since this is the only available source of water, it is often contaminated from washing, human and animal waste, garbage, and even dead animals. Drinking unsafe water leads to illness by water-borne diseases. Each year, 20,000 children die before the age of five in Tanzania due to diarrheal diseases.  

Because the available water source is a long distance from the village, women and children spend over two hours a day collecting water and sometimes up to seven hours for villagers in remote areas. These hours could be spent at a job, in school, or doing other things at home. Lives would be saved and quality of life would improve with an accessible well in this village.

Our Project Plan

HELP International has been coordinating the Village Water Project with the organization WHOlives and the Village Drill. The village Drill is a well drilling unit that was designed in the United States as a cheaper alternative to commercial well drilling available in Tanzania. Because this drill is completely man-powered and is easily transported, the entire operation is far more affordable and effective way to bring clean water to people around the world.

We want to involve the village as much as possible. They will help to drill the well, install the pipes and pump, and learn how to manage and maintain the drill in the future. This is their village project to learn to work together and help each other; we are just here to guide them along.

Project Budget

  • Cost to drill the well: $3,200
  • Water Pump: $1,100
  • Transportation to Village Site: $1,000
  • Misc Supplies: $150

This budget includes all costs associated with creating a fully functional water-giving well. Transportation cost includes the transportation of the drill, supplies, volunteers, and drilling guide to the site. Drilling cost includes the cost to pay workers to operate the drill with us, the pay for drilling guide, the necessary pipes needed for the well walls, the concrete pad for the top. Cost for the Indian Mark 2 Water Pump is the quoted price from the company. Miscellaneous supplies include water tests and instructional materials for the pump. 

 Please see the project flyer under the gallery tab for more information!

We need your HELP!

If you can not donate money, please share our story with family and friends! Water is LIFE! Help us bring clean water to the people of Tanzania! Thank you so much for all the amazing support!

If you have questions, please email us at

tanzania@www.help-international.org or find us on facebook

story:
Who We Are & What We're Doing

  • We are a group of researchers interested in how doulas, childbirth educators, and labor & delivery nurses in the US and Canada view recent trends in childbirth practices and outcomes, and each other.

  • We knew we could do better research as a group than we could individually, so we have been meeting for the past two years via conference call; contributing equally to the survey development and are about ready to launch!

  • Several membership organizations for doulas, childbirth educators, and labor & delivery nurses in the US and Canada have agreed to help us recruit participants to our survey by sending emails to their members.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are on a bare bones research budget - the graduate students will use the data for their dissertation research; and we need $3000 to cover our immediate costs for the online survey, our website domain registration, and organizational fees to access members. 

  • Depending on the level of support, you'll get our most sincere thanks, acknowledgement on our website, advance copy of research summary, teleconference with research team or written acknowledgement on all publications.

  • If we EXCEED our goal, we can afford to pay our grad students for data analysis.  If we don't meet our goal, we can still use funds to cover our expenses.

The Impact

  • We care about maternity outcomes and believe our research will contribute to our understanding of how maternity support workers can help improve care to women and newborns.
  • The co-investigators have successfully conducted research projects on maternity topics.  Louise Roth is also doing research on how malpractice and the health insurance system influence maternity care, including the rate of cesarean delivery. Christine Morton is interviewing women, their partners and providers on traumatic childbirth experiences.
  • The graduate students are doing dissertation work on emotional burnout, doula work as a career, breastfeeding support and documentation routines.  This project will make huge contributions to the nursing and childbirth literature.

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope those of you doing maternity support work, or who have benefitted from having a great doula, childbirth educator or labor & delivery nurse will consider supporting much needed research on these critical, yet overlooked roles in maternity care.

If you can't afford to help us with a monetary contribution, please share this link far and wide among your social networks, and using the Indiegogo share tools is a great way to do this.

Thank you so much.

Louise Roth, PhD, U Arizona, Sociology

Christine Morton, PhD, Stanford, CMQCC

Megan Henley, U Arizona, Sociology PhD student

Nicole Heidbreder, Georgetown, Nursing student

Miriam Sessions, Florida State U, Sociology PhD student

Jennifer Torres, U Michigan, Sociology PhD student

 and Katie Pine, U California Irvine, Social Ecology PhD student

 

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=  

MUSIC ON VIDEO: Julia (Jahzzar) / CC BY-SA 3.0

story:
Hi my name is Kristy Lockhart and I work in a retirement home as a cook. My best friend has been diagnosed with Lyme Disease and I wish to do everything I can to help her. This is a desperate plea to everybody to please help me financially get her the treatment she requires in the U.S.A. In Canada testing and treatment are not available. The majority of people with Lyme disease are misdiagnosed for years and by the time it is discovered it is almost too late. Treatment for this disease is extremely expensive. Not including gas and car rental it is $1,000 for the first time meet up with a Lyme doctor.

4 years ago she had a gym membership, walked 5 miles a day, hiked, spent time in nature, and constantly doing photoshoots. Now, she can't walk more than 20 minutes, has to ride a handicap bus, has difficulty breathing, chest pains, migraines, her joints swell up so bad she can't write or type, difficulty folding laundry, doing dishes and playing with her cat. Something in her body is malfunctioning as her entire body is covered in edema and this year she had to go on heart medication as this disease is affecting her heart now.

This woman means everything to me.  I can't put into words how much I love her. She is an amazing artist/photographer (www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl) and a genuine pure soul and there's nothing I won't do for her. Meeting someone like this only happens once in a lifetime, and I fear her lifetime will be over soon if no medical treatment is begun.

Donating to this compain will ensure proper medical care and treatment and lodging while undergoing this care. It doesn't matter if it's $1 or $1000 every little bit helps. Even if you have no $ to donate, please will you post this on various social networking tools to spread the word?

Even while ill, both she and I helped out with other fundraisers (Rideau Valley Wildlife Sanctuary) by donating hundreds of dollars worth of her art to be sold to help treat injured wildlife. She went to college to learn how to take care of the disabled, now she is disabled.

She has no one who can help her but me and she hasn't worked for the last 2 years due to being so ill. I am a single woman and the ONLY person who has been helping her for years, please can you help me help her.

There is a serious gap in Canada for testing and treatment of this horrible disease. Recently Elizabeth May (MP) introduced a new bill into parliament detailing how this disease should be dealt with.  This is good for the future, but my friend needs help IMMEDIATELY.
My best friend, Heather, has seen 50 doctors in the last 4 years (including 3 neurosurgeons) which she was left with no definitive answers as to the root cause of all her symptoms, until now. Lyme disease, if not detected in the early stages becomes chronic lyme and ends up attacking the heart, kidneys and liver.
 
We are givers and this is very hard to ask for help. To prove this, for certain denomonations I will print and mail to you your choices from Heather's photography gallery. If you love wildlife and nature or creative works combining the beautiful female form with nature, you are sure to love Heather King's artwork. Side note: there are some pieces on her site which have a filter on them. Please know that nothing was done for shock value. Heather did darker work in her past as a release from brutal physical and sexual abuse.
Please do not place an order through RedBubble as you will be charged for the prints and you have already generously donated to this campaign. Please use Redbubble as a gallery and email me directly what prints you would like.  Any questions or for a list of the prints you would like, please email me here lockhart_ottawa@hotmail.com
 

I promise you if you were to meet Heather you would love her almost as much as I do.  I have never met another soul with such an enormous loving heart as hers.
Please helps us
love
Kristy

story:
NEW GOAL: $6800

---------------------------------

Callie can come home from the hospital as early as January 31st, but she needs $6800 to support her at home with the proper medical supplies. Help us show God's love by providing this for her. We set the goal low, in case we didn't make it, but now we need to make a push for $6800.

 

Short Summary

As many of you know, Callie Lopez came down with West Nile virus this past September. She's been in the hospital ever since. Through this site, we want to raise money to help Callie and her family pay for medical expenses incurred during her illness.

 

Her Impact

She's been a wonderful wife and mother, but also a servant of Christ to the children at Faith Community Church, so we want to help support them through this time.

 

What you can do to help

DONATE TODAY because health care is expensive and we can show the love of Christ by caring for our neighbors.
 
Pay through Paypal, you don't even need an account to do it!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this link and ask other people to donate
  • Prayer for her continued recovery

 

1 John 3:17-18 (NLT)

17If someone has enough money to live well and sees a brother or sister in need but shows no compassion—how can God’s love be in that person?

18 Dear children, let’s not merely say that we love each other; let us show the truth by our actions.

 

Please Donate Today!

story:
Short Summary

We, Nick Coats and Gianluca Paparo, are very excited to share an experience and a journey with all of you. The “Just Cause We Walk” team are journeying across the country on foot to bring a broader understanding and support for the cure of this disease that claimed the lives of over half a million people in the United States last year.

Our journey will take us through over a dozen of our country's beautiful states. We will be taking pictures and documenting online as we are able. This adventure has become possible with the support of our friends and families but with your support, and our support of your organization, together we can make this much more than a long walk, but a march for life, love, and hope.

What We Need & What You Get

We are respectfully requesting monetary contributions, or even just spreading the word, to make this happen. Your support will make this cause a worthy one. Any form of sponsorship will allow us to bring not only awareness but also help keep us alive on this mission. We hope you can utilize some of your resources to help a couple of individuals that want to make a more substantial difference. Anyone that donates will surely get a personalized thank you from us!    

The Impact

People give blood, sweat, and tears as they suffer from this disease. If we wish to make a difference, if we wish to change the suffering they endure, can we endure any less? We can't. We are prepared to give our own blood, sweat, and tears to show people that those who suffer are no different than any of us. We are tired of standing by; we are tired of watching. We want to start doing. As such we have chosen the hardest route to walk, and have forgone a lot of amenities others have employed. We will have no follow car, no drop point of food or water every few miles, and absolutely no mile traveled that is not on foot. We will carry all our food and water and resupply in the cities we stop in. We will have our phones for emergencies along with our willingness and determination.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate anything you contribute, whether it is just sharing this on Facebook, following us on our site, or contributing any funds you can. All we need is some will power to get us through this winter and onto spreading the word about breast cancer.

story:
We are a family that works together and plays together.  Probably a lot like yours.  When one of our family members has a problem, we all try to help in any way we can.  We have done all we can do to fix this problem and have fallen short. 

Now we are turning to you to help our paraplegic son live near us because of his many medical needs, but allow him to have the independence any man of his age needs from his parents.  (His doctor recommends that he live near family because in 2010 when his first replacement valve failed, he almost did not get to the hospital in time because no one checked on him daily.)  We don't want something like that to happen again!

Todd is a natural mechanic and has an engineering mind.  He is very generous with his time and energy when he is not in the hospital or recuperating from surgery.  He has many friends and is an asset to everyone who knows him because he fixes things for them.  If they have something that is broken (exception of computorized things) he finds a way to fix it.  He is thoughtful and is always coming up with ways to brighten others lives.  He may mow their lawns, plow snow from their sidewalks and driveways, give them produce or flowers he has grown, or grilled, smoked, or jerkeyed meats he has made. 

Because we all love him and have watched him go through so much trauma and dissapointment, we cannot help wanting to give back to him.  Most of his friends are in the construction trades and want to donate their time and skills to build him an apartment and a garage to house his truck in with room to keep busy doing what he loves best, fixing things. 

We need your contribution to buy the materials.  Whatever you can do to help is greatly appreciated.  Without your help, we cannot build a house for this deserving man.  If we do not reach our total goal, hopefully, we can at least build him a place to live and add the garage later.  Please help us help our son!  He never stops helping others! 

If you cannot help us at this time, please share this story with others who may be able to.   Thank you!

story:
Fin is a small, wearable vibrator designed to feel like a part of you, so you can be a part of something amazing.

Unlike most vibrators, Fin is worn between your fingers like a natural extension of your body. It seamlessly adds vibration to foreplay and sex, without spoiling the mood.

Founded in 2014 by two smart women, Dame Products develop our products in-house using intuitive design, safe materials, and rigorous user testing. With these principles in mind, we made Fin small, simple, and powerful, using medical-grade silicone.

 

 Watch the following video to learn a little about who we are, and what Fin's all about:

 

 

Small & Mighty

Fin was designed to optimize power in the most compact package possible. Fin won’t feel in the way, but you will certainly feel Fin. 

Three Speeds 

Low, Medium and High. We believe in keeping it simple! Too many modes means too much time finding the one you really want — and too much frustration in turning it off.

Medical-Grade Silicone

Like all our products, Fin is made with medical-grade silicone. The material is USP Class IV, not just "body safe"... whatever that means.

USB Rechargeable 

Fin can be recharged for use after use after use! The included USB charging cable lets you charge Fin across the globe.

Quiet

Keep your earplugs on the nightstand. We designed Fin to deliver a lot of power without a lot of commotion.

 

 

 

     

The overwhelming response to that first campaign proved the need for well-engineered products that fit the needs of real people's sex lives. We hope that these principles will bring us the same success with Fin.

 

Research shows women are four times more likely than men to call recent sex "unpleasurable." We call this the Pleasure Gap, and it's our mission to close it.

For most people with vulvas, physical intimacy is key to arousal, and clitoral stimulation is necessary for orgasm. As a vibrator company, we’re pretty good at stimulating clitorises. But you can’t create intimacy by just pressing a button. We knew we couldn’t reinvent the natural connection people feel when touching each other, so we decided to enhance it. 

 

 

Having designed consumer goods and 3D printers at a number of firms, Janet noticed a conspicuous lack of quality in the world of sex toys. Alex's education in clinical psychology and sexual wellness gave her a keen awareness of the disparity in sexual pleasure between women and their partners. Fate brought them together in the NYC startup scene, and they immediately joined forces.

In October 2014, the duo made sex toy history with their first product, Eva — a hands-free vibrator held by the labia during penetrative sex. Headquartered in Brooklyn, NY, Dame Products has enjoyed incredible success. Eva is now available in stores across the globe, and the team has grown beyond its two founders.

Our continuing mission: to design well-engineered sex toys, to heighten intimacy, and to openly empower the sexual experiences of womankind. Supporting us and Fin will help us make better products at better prices.

Learn a little more about Alex and Janet, and their approach to the next generation of toys for sex:

 

Our whiteboard is full of ideas for great sex toys, but we thought a vibrator that augmented touch would be the best fit as our second product. After launching Eva, we’d heard from some couples that while a hands-free vibrator is great, sometimes they wanted a hands-on experience, too. Vibrators worn on the hand have the potential to be great toys for first-time users, sex toy pros, couples or individuals. However, the market didn't have a standout finger vibrator that balanced quality and ease of use with a reasonable price.

We started by talking to stores and surveying the Dame Products community to learn about the features people look for in a finger vibrator, and how they use them. We tried to come up with as many ways as possible to attach a vibrator to a hand, and used our 3D printers to make sketch prototypes of each concept. We took that research and those prototypes and narrowed down what basic forms met the needs our users were most interested in.

By March 2016, we had selected Fin as the product concept. One of the main tradeoffs we identified was dexterity vs. power. If the product isn’t powerful enough, it isn’t worth using; if you can’t maintain dexterity, your movements don’t feel intuitive. Fin’s shape and placement between the fingers prevented the motor from interfering with testers' natural movements.

By June 2016, we had begun Alpha testing with prototypes integrating months of ergonomic, aesthetic, and engineering development into a single design. By the time the product ships, we will have incorporated feedback from over 100 Alpha and Beta testers into our design.

We always test with women and couples from all different ages and backgrounds. If it doesn’t bring additional value to the sex lives of real people, we don’t put it on the market.

Fin won’t feel in the way, but you will certainly feel Fin. Three Speeds Low, Medium and High. We believe in keeping it simple! Too many modes means too much time finding the one you really want — and too much frustration in turning it off.Medical-Grade SiliconeLike all our products, Fin is made with medical-grade silicone. The material is USP Class IV, not just "body safe"... whatever that means.USB Rechargeable Fin can be recharged for use after use after use! The included USB charging cable lets you charge Fin across the globe.QuietKeep your earplugs on the nightstand. We designed Fin to deliver a lot of power without a lot of commotion.         The overwhelming response to that first campaign proved the need for well-engineered products that fit the needs of real people's sex lives. We hope that these principles will bring us the same success with Fin.  Research shows women are four times more likely than men to call recent sex "unpleasurable." We call this the Pleasure Gap, and it's our mission to close it.For most people with vulvas, physical intimacy is key to arousal, and clitoral stimulation is necessary for orgasm. As a vibrator company, we’re pretty good at stimulating clitorises. But you can’t create intimacy by just pressing a button. We knew we couldn’t reinvent the natural connection people feel when touching each other, so we decided to enhance it.   Alex Fine + Janet Lieberman

story:
Un concept unique en France !

BAM Freesports ouvrait la 1ère salle freestyle de France en 2014. Forte du succès de cette première structure, BAM Freesports renouvelle l'expérience en ouvrant une seconde salle à Eybens, tout près de Grenoble, en septembre 2016.
Ces salles freestyle sont apparues il y a un peu plus de 10 ans aux USA. L'idée est d'utiliser et de détourner les équipements de gymnastique pour apprendre de nouvelles figures et s'adapter aux nouvelles disciplines (slope style, half pipe...). Trampolines, bac à mousse, big air, tumbling ... sont ici utilisés pour s’entraîner et progresser en toute sécurité.
Bam2 c'est :
  • 700 m² de trampolines
  • 1 zone débutant et 1 zone pro
  • 1 bac à mousse
  • 1 super tramp 
  • 1 big air + 1 air bag (accessibles en vélo, skate, roller)
Mais aussi :
  • 1 bar
  • 1 espace chill
  • Des cours et stages ouverts à tous
  • 1 système de vidéo (ReBam)


Nos besoins & vos récompenses

L'objectif de cette campagne est de nous permettre de financer le big air, accessible en vélo, skateboard, roller et trottinette, le plus tôt possible !

Ces 8 500€ nous permettront de lancer la construction et l'installation de cette rampe puis de finaliser l'ensemble des travaux cet l'été. Malgré notre rapide développement, nous restons une petite entreprise. Toute participation est donc la bienvenue !

Cette salle, on la fait pour vous, avec vous ! Prenez part au projet !

Nous vous proposons plusieurs contreparties, à des tarifs promotionnels, rien que pour vous :

  • Votre nom sur le mur des remerciements
  • 1 tshirt "édition spéciale" + nom sur mur 
  • 1 entrée + 1 t-shirt "édition spéciale" + nom sur mur 
  • Carte 5 entrées + tshirt + nom sur mur
  • Carte 10 entrées + tshirt + nom sur mur 
  • Abonnement 3 mois + 1 cours coaché + tshirt + nom sur mur 
  • Abonnement 1 an + 1 cours coaché + tshirt + nom sur mur 

TShirt édition limitée pour l'ouverture de Bam2.
Certains packs sont en nombre limité, et proposés à prix "d'amis". Pour vous permettre de comparer, voici les prix des entrées et cartes applicables en septembre 2016 : 
  • Entrée plein tarif (session de 1h30) : 16 €
  • Carte de 5 entrées : 75 €
  • Carte de 10 entrées : 144 €
  • Abonnement 3 mois : 192 €
  • Abonnement 1 an : 448 €

A chaque fois que la limite d'un pack sera atteinte, nous en créerons un nouveau, mais avec une réduction plus faible (-20% de réduction au départ, puis -17,5 %, -15%, ...) . Les premiers packs sont donc les plus intéressants ! Et y'en aura pas pour tout le monde ! Be ready !

 

Bam2 - Le projet

Le projet est simple. Une salle freestyle de 1000 m² au total, composée de trampolines, d'un bac à mousse, d'un super tramp, d'un big air et de son air bag.
Véritable terrain de jeux pour petits et grands, débutants ou expérimentés, cette salle est LA solution pour tous ceux qui souhaitent progresser en toute sécurité. Evolutive, l'infrastructure contient au total 4 zones, permettant à chacun de progresser à son rythme. Notre concept, différent des salles de trampoline traditionnelles, est à l'heure actuelle unique en France.

Risques et défis

Chez BAM Freesports. Nous savons que la réussite de cette salle dépendra essentiellement de la qualité du matériel. 

C'est pourquoi, on vous prépare une structure aux petits oignons !
On prête une attention particulière à la qualité des matériaux choisis, aux techniques de fabrication et à nos fournisseurs. A titre d'exemple, le big air est construit par un fabricant de rampes de skatepark (la bifurk, Grenoble), notre super tramp vient des USA (yeah !), l'air bag est différent des air bag traditionnels (Travis Pastrana et Nitro Circus utilisent le même) et nous suivons rigoureusement la fabrication de nos trampolines.


D'autres façons d'aider

En plus de participer à cette campagne, vous pouvez également nous aider en parlant de nous. Rendez vous sur la page Facebook et l'Instagram de BAM Freesports,  et partagez au maximum nos vidéos, photos, et toutes autres publications. 
Ensemble, agrandissons la Bam community !

story:
SkyFloat is the world's first revolutionary, hands free, mid-air, ceiling mount for your phone or tablet.
SkyFloat LLC is hoping to make SkyFloat a household name synonymous with convenience and fun.

 

 

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My Story

 

My name is Zuzi and I'm Reiki Master healer based in NYC.  Ever since I was a little child, my passion were animals of any kind. I have been volunteering in various animal shelters in Brooklyn and giving Reiki to those who need it for more than 2 years now. It has been a wonderful  journey to see the great changes right in front of my eyes - senior cats finding warm homes again and families finding new loving companions. This time, I have been given an amazing opportunity to go with non-profit organization Healer2Healer and give Reiki to the indigenous people in Zaculpa, Guatemala. I love to travel for a reason….

 

The Impact

 

The general vicinity of Quiche has been much affected by a 36-year armed conflict, which ended barely 16 years ago. Emotional traumas from that time still reverberate in these Maya towns and communities. Reiki would help to restore once again their peace of mind and find calmness in their daily lifes. At the end, we all will learn from each other. :)

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

Healer2Healer is a young organization and has not yet cultivated corporate or private funding, therefore all cost of the trips are up to the individual members. With your help, I'm able to give others. Any amount of your energy is welcome. 

 

My financial goal will cover 10 days expenses - April 18-28th (accommodation, meal, inland transportation) + round air ticket. 

To meet the requirements, I need to make the full payment by 31st of March 2011. 

 

Contributing $50 and more I will send you (or your pet) 20 min of distant Reiki, however any support is highly appreciated. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you, for some reason, can't make any donation, please share these words with others that possibly can. Thank you :)

Here are links to the organizations which mean a lot to me and need a little extra appreciation  + deserve light of attention: 

www.healer2healer.com - they are an international organization that brings volunteer alternative medicine practitioners to rural indigenous communities.

www.hopevet.com - provides comprehensive, client centered treatment to enhance the health and wellbeing of animals and to promote the human-animal bond. (I've got in touch with Hope and on side adoption center Infinite Hope a year ago, and keep giving Reiki to cats in need still.)
story_txt:
My Story
 
My name is Zuzi and I'm Reiki Master healer based in NYC.  Ever since I was a little child, my passion were animals of any kind. I have been volunteering in various animal shelters in Brooklyn and giving Reiki to those who need it for more than 2 years now. It has been a wonderful  journey to see the great changes right in front of my eyes - senior cats finding warm homes again and families finding new loving companions. This time, I have been given an amazing opportunity to go with non-profit organization Healer2Healer and give Reiki to the indigenous people in Zaculpa, Guatemala. I love to travel for a reason….
 
The Impact
 


The general vicinity of Quiche has been much affected by a 36-year armed conflict, which ended barely 16 years ago. Emotional traumas from that time still reverberate in these Maya towns and communities. Reiki would help to restore once again their peace of mind and find calmness in their daily lifes. At the end, we all will learn from each other. :)
 


What I Need & What You Get
 
Healer2Healer is a young organization and has not yet cultivated corporate or private funding, therefore all cost of the trips are up to the individual members. With your help, I'm able to give others. Any amount of your energy is welcome. 
 
My financial goal will cover 10 days expenses - April 18-28th (accommodation, meal, inland transportation) + round air ticket. 
To meet the requirements, I need to make the full payment by 31st of March 2011. 
 
Contributing $50 and more I will send you (or your pet) 20 min of distant Reiki, however any support is highly appreciated. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you, for some reason, can't make any donation, please share these words with others that possibly can. Thank you :)


Here are links to the organizations which mean a lot to me and need a little extra appreciation  + deserve light of attention: 
www.healer2healer.com - they are an international organization that brings volunteer alternative medicine practitioners to rural indigenous communities.
www.hopevet.com - provides comprehensive, client centered treatment to enhance the health and wellbeing of animals and to promote the human-animal bond. (I've got in touch with Hope and on side adoption center Infinite Hope a year ago, and keep giving Reiki to cats in need still.)

story:
My name is Kaleb Hill and I'm 27 years old.  I have always had a special place in my heart for children that suffer with cancer.  I am in the Army National Guard and I'm only able to grow a beard in between monthly drills.  September 21st will be my last day in the Army (my contract is up), which means I will be able to grow a nice, big beard finally.  However, as I was frollicking in the joy of being able to grow a nice majestic beard, my heart turned soft and I wanted to do something really nice for someone in need, or pain, or suffering.  So I came up with a wonderful plan which is to grow my beard out (to about the length of my beard in the picture below) starting with a clean face on 9/22/12.  My goal is to raise $5000 by Christmas Day 2012.  I will then cut my beard off and present the money I raised to a random child with cancer.  They can do whatever they want to with this money.  It's a means to ease their pain and suffering but for a moment and to bring joy and happiness to their life

 

If I don't reach the $5000 goal, I will still give what funds I was able to raise to a child with cancer.

 

If you are unable to donate at this time, please help me spread the word and share this with your friends on all your social networks!

story:
About Randy:

Randy is an active member within the La Crosse Community. As a personal trainer he crosses paths with so many, always aiming to make a difference in the lives of others. He is constantly trying to better himself in order to make the world around him a more positive place. Anyone who knows Randy knows he has a huge heart and values all aspects of health! However, Randy struggles with finding a health insurance plan that will cover him in times of need. When this unexpected but serious bacterial infection hospitalized him and stumped the doctors, it became clear that his health insurance was not going to be enough to help him cover his expenses. He was in the hospital for over a week and had numerous tests and procedures done to try and find the infection. You're donation goes a long way in helping Randy get back to life as normal. 100% of the funds raised here will go to help Randy cover his medical expenses! This will allow him to recover without the constant worry of how he is going to pay for it all! With your help he can get back to his active, healthy lifestyle with less stress and the knowledge that he lives within a community that supports and loves him! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! And get involved. If you are in the La Crosse area and would like to make a donation using a check instead of this website you may write one out to Randy Erickson and turn it into Lindsey Purl or Danni Neher. Look for information on the Run for Randy 5K Run/Walk (information coming soon!).

You're positive thoughts and energy also make a tremendous difference.  :)

If you would like to contact Randy personally feel free to message him on Facebook (Randy Erickson) or email him at Randy_g5@hotmail.com

Thank you!

story:
Hi. Meredith (AKA Mebo) is my friend and she is truly a person worthy of your love & support. 

We must help the woman that had a huge tumor cut out of her head and still cannot live a regular life. She has been diligent with her therapies and recovery while showing the utmost kindness to everyone she comes in contact. She has one more hurdle and a way to recover. The Mayo Clinic. Help cover her cost of this trip to the Mayo where she will hopefully find a treatment that will make everyday more bearable.

We all benefit from having Meredith healthy, happy, and in the world.

The brightness that Meredith brings to the world is invaluable. She loves children and has never met a stranger. Every time I see her I get to hear a story of someone she meets. She observes the joy of children. She feels the challenges of daily life for anyone she meets. I think that she can truly empathise with anyone. She can walk out of the ladies room with a story about a person that she bonded with while drying her hands. And I love that about her. 

The problem. 

MeBo does not currently have a tumor in her head, thanks to a specialized surgery. She does, however, have a lot of unintended challenges (side effects?) from the tumor removal. These include double vision, dizziness, challenges because of her shunt (a tube that still drains fluid from her brain into her abdomen), fatigue, and chronic pain. 

The chronic pain is the one we are currently working on. Chronic pain. Doctors have been baffled. She has seen several people to try and diagnose the problem. There has been no answer to this one so far. The only solace that anyone could offer was pain killers. This is no way to live. Mebo would rather find a better alternative. Besides, taking pain killers, create further uninended consequences like not being able to drive or eat normal foods, bacically further cutting her off from everyday living. 

There is a ray of sunlight. 

There is a program at the Mayo Clinic in Minnesota that has decided to take Mererdith to go through a 3-week inpatient diagnostic testing and treatment regimen. It takes 3 weeks and will cost $3000 dollars to get up there and pay for a room in that time. It is worth it for a pain-free life. 

Why ask for this much?

The goal is $3,330 because it covers the bare bones cost of this trip to the Mayo plus a small cushion to take care of the indiegogo fees. If I could waive a wand, I would take all of the burden off of my friends (I don't even know what it is, but brain surgery is not cheap). Ideally we could push the boundaries and have more to help pay off some of the medical burden that has plagued her since the doctor said "brain tumor".

The financial strain is a level of stress that causes just as much trouble as anything else she has faced, but there is little hope of getting out from under this debt burden. I am taking this to all of you her friends, family, and other great people she has touched (or still could) because A little help can go a long way and I think we can helpher usher in a new era.

I ask the world to help my kind and loving friend.

I get to see mer about once a month when she is feeling well and we can get together. Often out visits are short because of her fatigue and pain. Lets band together and help her to have more full days.

story:
Hi, my name is Dominique Warfield and I love life. I am an Expressive and Healing Artist in Gainesville Florida. I graduated from Prescott  Liberal Arts College and The Florida School of Massage and received my degree in Expressive and Healing Arts. I am now teaching Yoga in my community at the downtown gym and Grooveshark, facilitating ecstatic dance for the youth, as well as offering integrative massage therapy with the inspiration of Shamanic and Indigenous healing practices.

   The last 2.5 years I have been increasingly passionate about personal transformation and growth, as I deeply aspire to be HEARTcentered and Authentic in all of my actions. I believe the inward journey towards personal awareness and empowerment is an honorable path to explore, allowing one to connect with their own understanding.  My intention to have inner awareness is to create the ability to feel clear in my actions so that when I am connecting with others and my environment I am aligned and present in the moment.

 

The intention of this campaign is to help me raise funds to be able to participate in "Off the Mat, Into the World," (OTM) a leadership training in California.

“OTM uses the power of yoga to inspire conscious, sustainable activism and ignite grassroots social change. We do this by facilitating personal empowerment through leadership trainings, fostering community collaboration, and initiating local and global service projects. We see yogis everywhere taking their yoga off the mat and into the world.”

                                         -(http://www offthemattintotheword.org)

 

With this training I will be provided with a safe space to grow, learn, relate, and  transform into my fullness with fellow peers and leaders in the field of Expressive and Healing Arts. I know there are strong qualities, talents and gifts that are present in my being that I want to offer and share to the world as well as qualities in myself that I have not developed or matured into that I are foundational in order to be an authentic LEADER. With the tools that I will learn and acquire, I aspire that I will be able to utilize the training as a way to engage with my community and world at large with new perspectives and eyes into becoming a LEADER with fierce compassion.

   

By donating to my campaign you are helping me to expand and ground into my role as a LEADER!

 

  I foresee this training as the first step into a bigger vision and dream to reconnect with my roots by bringing expressive and healing arts to the PHILIPPINES.

 

FAMILY, FRIENDS, FRIENDS OF FRIENDS, STRANGERS, VISIONARIES, DREAMERS and ANGELS, I ask that you please donate to help me towards my DREAMS. I also want to extend my warm gratitude and appreciation to my GROOVESHARK family for helping me through this campaign. THANK YOU all for your support!

 

Namaste, Aho, Blessings, and much Love to you all!

story:
Let's cure EB

You probably haven’t heard of EB. Nor had we. After our son Jackson was born in 2007, he had a routine heel prick and the nurse placed a band-aid on his heel. When the band-aid was removed, all of the skin on his tiny foot tore off with it. Jackson was soon diagnosed with a severe form of Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB) - he lacks a critical protein that binds the layers of his skin together. In practical terms, the skin across his entire body is fragile and can blister easily.  Like all kids with EB, pain is a part of his daily life as are bleach bath bandage changes. When things are bad, he cannot swallow as his esophagus blisters and tears just like his skin.  Many normal activities – such as the sports kids like to play – are out of the question. The damage from EB is cumulative.  At his young age, it has already left its indelible mark.

Jackson is not alone. In fact, there are thousands of children in the world who suffer from this terrible disease. You can find more information about the disease and Jackson at www.JGSF.org. 

Jamie & Alex Silver (co-founders of JGSF)

 

How can I help?

We are in a brutally fast race against time to find a cure for EB and to give Jackson and all the children like him pain-free lives. We started the Jackson Gabriel Silver Foundation (JGSF), a non-profit organization, in 2007 to raise funds for EB research. We have almost no administration costs and all of our staff volunteers. We aim to give as close as possible to 100% of the money we receive to fund research to cure the disease and have dedicated our lives to finding and funding the most promising research into EB cures and to date, we have raised almost $1 million and given grants to support advanced therapies at leading institutions including Stanford University, the University of Minnesota, the University of Southern California and others. Researchers have made significant progress since Jackson was born and we genuinely believe that if we can continue to fund this cutting edge research, we can find a cure for EB soon.

 

Why give money now?

We are currently funding the work of Dr. Jakub Tolar and his team at the University of Minnesota. His work is groundbreaking and we believe can save the lives of children with EB as well as those who suffer from many other genetic illnesses. We plan to raise $225,000 to help fund Dr Tolar’s research and would love your help - our goal is to raise $25,000 from Indiegogo users to help fund this research to change childrens’ lives. We are part of a campaign that has agreed to match the university dollar for dollar- in practice this means that every dollar you give will be matched and every dollar will be worth $2 to fund research.

At JGSF, we are committed to ending this terrible disease- please join us in our fight.

story:
Please take the time to read this and watch my video thanks,

 I am a hard working and spent over 25 years working to provide for myself and my family as a company owner and security contractor.

I am doing everything I can to get back on my feet including current efforts and getting projects going to produce income.

In February 2010 the VA Hospital in Houston performed a Subclavian By-pass operation on me to repair an artery.  The  Surgeon telling me that I would be able to return to normal workload in as little as three to four weeks.  Not to worry etc.

I woke up to find that I could not speak above a whisper for  a year and worse yet my left lung would never function again.  This is due to damage to my Phrenic Nerve and Laryngeal nerve.

Under federal law 38 USC 1152: a veteran who recieves treatment at a VA facility and has damages that were not the intended outcome of their proceedure are entitled to compensation and disability same as service connected.

There is no question with the VA administration that I am  disabled permanently.

However unless I can show a breach in the Standard of Care they will not give me those benefits -  even though their own  Examiner states that the injury was more likely caused by the VA Surgeon's inadvertent (negligent) action during the surgery damaging my Phrenic nerve.

They are requiring me to produce evidence in the form of an Expert Medical witness to support my claim. Which I can, but.

They do this in order to not have to pay out the claim knowing that few can afford to hire such a witness at  over $10,000.

I have sold, had forclosed on, and pawned everything I own except my clothes to this point just to get by.  I have not even owned a vehicle since 2011 when it was reposessed. 

All I want is for them to do the right thing, and I need help to get my benefits that I am entitled to.  Otherwise this may leave me permanently unable to make a living.

Anything you can do will be greatly appreciated, I have a final appeal coming up, with your help and an expert witness I will be able to get the benefits.

I will post on here the progress as things go along and the funds will be for obtaining this expert witness and related fees.

I truly appreciate every single dime of help I can get, and I know the value of the dollar and the work put in to make it. 

There was no one on my surgical team who was board certified at the time to perform this surgery and vitually the entire team was student (physician in training) status without supervision at the time of the surgery, or at least this is what we have found out and they have refused to disprove or discuss.   

The success of this campaign will assure that I will get the benefits I am entitled to and replace the stability I had by providing a source of support so that I can return to as normal a life as possible.

Thank you for what you can do, even if it is only to pass this on to some one via twitter,FB etc.  I appreciate it.

Dennis Fitzgerald

story:
Short Summary

 

No Mo-Stache is a portable hair removal kit for busy women who may not always have the time to handle problem hair. The packaging has a sleek and small design to ensure convenience. The wax heats up while rubbing the strip in between your hands. By pulling the adhesive apart, and directly applying it to the face, you ensure a clean and easy waxing experience. The hypo-allergenic formula is gentle on all skin types and we offer hydrocortisone for after care to relieve irritation.  

Facial hair grows very quickly for women and we don't always have the time or money to keep it maintained.  No Mo-Stache eliminates high maintenance cost and eliminates one more chore added to the list.  Women have enough to think about on the daily, don't let a mustache be on your mind or on your face. Use No Mo-Stache for every stache, every time!

We strongly believe No Mo-Stache is a product every woman should have. We are raising funds to help grow this product on a national level.     We are looking for funding to make this concept successfully marketable and to publicize on a national level. 

Helping women prevent embarrassing moments one mustache at a time. 

Thank you for your support!

Jennifer & Gita

 
 
What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 in order to appropriately market No Mo-Stache.  We also need the funds for publicity which will take this product nationwide.  

You have the opportunity to make women free of facial hair in a cost effective way.  Lets work together! 

We are prepared to overcome many risks and challenges in our efforts to bring No Mo-Stache on public level. From thought to conception we have used our networks in both the fashion and beauty industries to create a product that would appeal to both markets. We believe that No Mo-Stache will be successful using our backgrounds in Sales and Beauty industries.
story_txt:
Short Summary
 

No Mo-Stache is a portable hair removal kit for busy women who may not always have the time to handle problem hair. The packaging has a sleek and small design to ensure convenience. The wax heats up while rubbing the strip in between your hands. By pulling the adhesive apart, and directly applying it to the face, you ensure a clean and easy waxing experience. The hypo-allergenic formula is gentle on all skin types and we offer hydrocortisone for after care to relieve irritation.  
Facial hair grows very quickly for women and we don't always have the time or money to keep it maintained.  No Mo-Stache eliminates high maintenance cost and eliminates one more chore added to the list.  Women have enough to think about on the daily, don't let a mustache be on your mind or on your face. Use No Mo-Stache for every stache, every time!
We strongly believe No Mo-Stache is a product every woman should have. We are raising funds to help grow this product on a national level.     We are looking for funding to make this concept successfully marketable and to publicize on a national level. 
Helping women prevent embarrassing moments one mustache at a time. 
Thank you for your support!
Jennifer & Gita
 

 
What We Need & What You Get


We need $5,000 in order to appropriately market No Mo-Stache.  We also need the funds for publicity which will take this product nationwide.  
You have the opportunity to make women free of facial hair in a cost effective way.  Lets work together! 


We are prepared to overcome many risks and challenges in our efforts to bring No Mo-Stache on public level. From thought to conception we have used our networks in both the fashion and beauty industries to create a product that would appeal to both markets. We believe that No Mo-Stache will be successful using our backgrounds in Sales and Beauty industries.

story:
Welcome to Box Jump, the one and only reality TV series of its kind! My name is T. Shaun Russell, and I am the creator of Box Jump. I’ve been active in the fitness industry almost all of my life, and I have also been involved in the film industry for over 14 years. I have a passion for both, and one day it finally hit me... why not try to merge the two and give the people what they want! I approached Zach Siglow, a fellow athlete and successful television director, about the idea and its possibilities. He loved it and Box Jump was born. After months of planning and acquiring the resources we needed, we successfully shot our first episode. My team and I have received a lot of great feedback and with the pilot in post production, we are now ready to shoot our second episode with your help!


NEW PERK JUST ADDED!! Box Jump Water Bottle and Wrist Wraps!!




Our Campaign

Over the past decade, the health and wellness industry has been on a rapid incline. Plain Jane and Average Joe are finally fed up with spending countless hours at impersonal “globo-gyms” in fruitless attempts to get fit. They have spent days, weeks, months, and years in a gym with no sense of community, where they workout and leave without a “Hello” or “Have a great day” from the staff. It is no surprise that people are flocking in droves to boutique gyms  (commonly known as boxes) around the world. In these boxes, they achieve health and wellness goals above and beyond what they ever imagined. They are finding community, friendship, and healthy competition. They are not only getting in shape, but many of them are becoming true competitive athletes.

We want to focus on highlighting the competitive aspect of the athletes that train in these boxes. Who doesn’t like a good local competition? They are all over the place, yet if you are unable to  physically go see them, wouldn’t it be great to have another means of seeing them? We have collectively spent years attending competitions of this nature and have personally seen some amazing feats of courage, determination, community and sportsmanship; where by the nature of this fitness community,  the last person to finish organically gets the loudest cheers from the fans and all the while, fellow competitors coach them to finish strong. We want to capture this VERY essence on camera for everyone around the world to experience from the comforts of your own home. Stay at home moms, lawyers, students, neighbors and the like compete on the same teams as former Division 1 middle linebackers. Every athlete is cheered on and encouraged to strive for the indomitable will of the human spirit. We want you cheering for your favorite box and your fellow athletes who are out there fighting for their chance to take it all.. the grand prize and bragging rights to be the King of All Boxes!

The majority of us do not do what those elite athletes can do, but 100% of us love the sport of fitness, love the challenge, and most of all, we are all passionate about our communities and the culture naturally embedded in our boxes. We would love the opportunity to be able to bring all of this to every single one of you.

Our teams from the Pilot episode.

How the show works

The show is structured with a 16-team elimination series for a total of 13 episodes. They are competing for a $60,000 grand prize. At the end, we will crown one box the King of All Boxes. In every weekly hour episode of Box Jump, one box “jumps” another box. Each box will have a team of 6 athletes (3 women and 3 men). The teams will compete in two pre-programmed 4-person team workouts and two 2- person events. Each event will be given point values leading up to the final event. The point system will be set up to help give the losing team an opportunity to steal the win in the final event.

Our Interactive Website: 

The show is only one part of what we are putting into place. We will be setting up an extremely interactive website. On the website, people will be able to read about their favorite athletes, read blogs with tips and advice by the athletes, and shop for products. We are setting up an individual athlete tournament as well, so if the viewer’s team is not doing well, they can continue to cheer for and follow their favorite athletes. We will have biographies set up so people can see that many of these competitive athletes are Average Joe’s and Jane’s just like them. The website will have a discussion board, videos on how to do exercises properly, links to websites, sponsors, and companies we recommend. There will be plenty of places to advertise sponsors throughout the site. The site is in the Beta form, part of the fund raiser will be to get the the site up to full speed. (www.theboxjump.com)

This is going to be are very special project and the possibilities are endless. This is a strong community that is growing at a rapid pace. We believe we are in the perfect place to jump on board and enjoy the ride.

Athlete cards from our pilot episode.

How you can help!

We already shot the pilot episode and it is currently in post production. The first part of our funds raised will go towards finishing post on the pilot. We are now looking to shoot our second episode! We are asking for $10k for equipment; camera, lighting, grip as well as the crew who will be operating all this equipment. Then we’ll need to feed them. We will also need locations and any special permits that may come our way as well as everything else that will go into the planning of this second episode. If we reach our goal, any extra funds will go towards our next episode. If we don’t reach our goal however, the funds we get will absolutely still be used to finish our pilot and start the second episode and from there we will look towards sponsorship to finish up the funding. (If you know of some one interested in sponsoring the show. Have them send us an email.) But episode two WILL get shot by the end of this year!

Check out our perks for your generous donations and we can’t wait to show our community what we’ve created with all of your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, we could still use your help! Please share our campaign on your own websites, blogs and social media pages! Email anyone you think would be interested! We could use all the support we can get, so please spread the word! Thank you!

RIGOR GEAR PROMOTIONAL CODE: RG20POFF


We would like to thank the Sponsors from our pilot episode!

story:
The hippo killed two of his cousins while they were fishing near Bumi Hills during July 2015.

Edson is from Musampa Fishing Camp, near the Ume river mouth and is one of the subsistance fisherman who operate from there, using small boats that they paddle out into the lake. Their nets are the approved cotton type, and the fishing camp works in co-operation with National Parks, and the Bumi Hills Anti poaching unit. Edson was transported to Kariba hospital initially, further stabilized, and referred to Harare general hospital for orthopedic treatment under Dr A.S.Makoni, a specialist Orthopedic Surgeon.

Edson now needs to have his compound fracture of the tibia and fibula plated, and his fractured head of femur pinned to ensure he makes a good recovery and is able to return to fishing to support his family.

Dr Makoni is carrying out a further assessment of Edsons condition, and is going to provide a list of the required plates and pins, and other surgical sundries that will be required to complete the procedure.

As many of you appreciate the state of hospitals in Zimbabwe do their best to carry out effective treatments, but in cases such as this, as in many countries, the patient has to find the funds for the specialized surgical implants.

If this procedure is not carried out, a risk of the limb having to be amputated does exist. We are appealing to suppliers of surgical and medical equipment and any other well wishers to contact us on conservation@bumihills.com with any assistance they may be able to provide to ensure Edson keeps his leg and returns to his home. and fishes again.

story:
I would like to  share a story with you about a  mother that we met for the first time last Saturday (May 30,2015) in Redding  in the parking lot of Target with her makeshift car wash. We were told that the car wash was a fundraiser for cancer. Little did we know that one of the 3 people washing the cars had cancer. Annie Burruss was washing cars to help pay for her treatment and medications. She was thin, had dark circle, and she was in a lot of pain. It was heart wrenching to know that we let this woman wash our car in so much pain.

Annie Burruss, 40 years old mother of six, was diagnosed with breast cancer last year. In the first month of breast feeding her baby she thought that she had mastitis (infection of the breast tissue). When the pain continued she decided to have it checked out. She was told that there was a 1% chance that it was cancer. It was cancer and she was advised to stop breast feeding her baby. She had a mastectomy and has been told she has 6 months to 1 year to live. She is struggling to pay for her medications and day to day house hold expenses. She has had to stop working as a hair dresser due to the severe pain. Her hope is to raise enough money to get treatments so she can be able to raise her young family and get through these hard times. Her children’s ages range from 16 years old to the youngest 10 months old. 

Thank you in advance for your help,

Joel and Heather Kneale

story:
Alfonso Perez has been released from the Henderson Detention Center!  Thanks to all your love and support, he has returned home to his beloved daughter and wife.  Yet, his journey to stay in the United States with his family has just begun.  He is currently in deportation proceedings and is fighting his case in immigration court.  Please contribute to his legal fund today and help our family stay together. 

 

BACKGROUND

Alfonso Perez was brought to the United States by his grandmother at four years of age (when his parents abandoned him in Mexico).  After twenty years of living in this country, he was detained by I.C.E. on Thursday, July 26th, 2012 at 6:00 a.m. when he walked outside of his apartment to go to work. 

He was detained at the Henderson Detention Center and was not provided shoes, nor was our family allowed to provide any for him.  He was denied access to sunlight and was locked up in his cell for 18-20 hours a day.  We need your help to release him, reunite our family, apply for Obama’s DREAM deferred action, and fulfill his dream of attending college.

His lifetime calling is to become a Registered Nurse or Doctor and help heal his community. In fact, he has a track record of working with elderly and disabled people since the age of sixteen. He DREAMs of finishing college and dedicate his life to provide for his family and care for those people who are most in need.

Alfonso is a dedicated father to his fourteen month old baby and a loving partner to his wife.   He is the sole financial provider for his family and works 10 hours a day, 6 days a week as a landscaper in Las Vegas, Nevada.  His family was distraught by his incarceration and his baby missed him a lot.  His family will face extreme emotional and financial hardship if he is deported.

story:
Short Summary

Carol Barnette was diagnosed with lung cancer in June 2014 and has undergone a radical surgery, from which she is still recovering.  She has medical bills pending from her surgery as well as prescription and other related costs of treatment for this devastating disease. Even though Carol has Medicare, there are still co-payments and extra fees for treatments, medicines, and doctor visits. Carol must also drive a substantial distance to and from chemotherapy, as well as hire any outside help for some personal and household needs. Because she has been unable to work at her freelance job, she has no way to finance these extra costs herself. 

Carol needs our help and we are reaching out to our community of friends and family with the hope of raising enough money to ameliorate her financial needs. The last thing a person with cancer needs is the stress of unpaid bills or of running out of money before the end of the month.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please do not worry if you are unable to contribute financially to this campaign. We would be very grateful if you would share this fundraising page with your friends and contacts to get the word out for Carol. Thank you!

story:
On September 23rd, I was walking in Centennial Park and my knee decided to clock out mid-shift. Turns out an injury I had from high-school had gone untreated and a small tear became a big tear. After all of the X-Rays showed nothing wrong, an MRI showed a lateral meniscus tear. The doctor scheduled Surgery for the Monday before Thanksgiving.

Now that I've had the surgery, the doctor has ordered physical Therapy. My insurance co-pay for Physical therapy is $35/visit and he has ordered 3 visits per week for 4-6 weeks. That comes to $420- $630, depending on how quickly I make progress. I do not like asking for money, but I know this is necessary. So following a push from one of my lovely feral friends, I'm here...asking for assistance. I have already informed my family that Christmas may have to be light, and I have already written the check for my first week of appointments. So if you have anything you can give to this cause, I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you for your time!

story:
The Young Guns are going to Nationals

 The Lake County Young Guns is a 4H shooting sports club started 3 years ago.  Our goal is to provide our youth with opportunities to explore shooting sports, develop leadership skills and compete in one of the fastest growing sports.  We are the first 4h shooting sports club in Lake County Ohio and in just 3 years we are able to send some of our best to compete in the 4H national championships in Grande Isle Nebraska as part of the Ohio 4H team.

In order to make this happen, we need to raise funds to help pay for transportation costs, registration fees, travel expenses, and required equipment.

Our kids will be representing Ohio 4H shooting sports competing against teams from other states around the country.  This will be an opportunity for the kids to gain valuable knowledge, competitive experience, and develop new friendships.  We hope that this will pave the way for more kids from our area to participate in competitive shooting.

story:
We are House #oldballz, a six-piece pub trivia team hailing from Salt Lake City, UT!

We are currently ranked #1 in the region and #2 in the country, and we'be been invited to compete in Denver on August 10th, 2013.

We will be competing against teams from the Rockies down to Texas.

Half of our team will be flying to Denver, and the other half will be driving, on August 9th, 2013. We're working on getting sponsored locally, but as nothing is set in stone, this is where you come in!

All funds raised will be split up among our team members to help with travel expenses (airfare, gas, etc) as well as hotel accommodations, ground transportation, meals and (if we're lucky) some sight-seeing.

Every dollar contributed gets us a step closer to our dream, so please tell your friends and spread the link!

Peace & Love,

#oldballz
