story:
Visit our website: www.hrwproject.com

 


UPDATE: 2013 October 03

Hi everyone 10 days left to go, already we raised 42%. We get many questions about what happens if we did not reach a goal. You get anyway working device if we reach a goal or not. However, first prototype version will work only on windows platforms. We will come back to SmartPhone app later but now priority is to improve hardware, firmware and software algorithm.

Delivery deadline is not changed and remains the same, it is 2014 February as mentioned in the perk. So we ship no earlier than January 2014. If you forgot to add shipping costs we remind you by sending email to you. Some of you forgot to add shipping address as well we write an email to ask you to do this.

see updates...




Medical diagnostic systems such as personal health assistants, designed for the home care environment would be economically, and socially beneficial. As the result, early disease treatment by detection of abnormalities could reduce hospitalization costs, doctor visits, health care labor force and improve the quality of life. 

Continuing the previous research, we build the multi-functional device, developed for home surroundings, with similar methodologies found in hospitals.

Heart Risk Warner is unique as it employs multiple medical methods and assesses the risk of your heart. It is rather small and lightweight so you can have it in your pocket.

Using this device you can benefit of knowing about possible heart risk existence and prevent future heart risk. Risk of possible heart disease or heart problems like stroke, coronary artery disease, hypertension, heart failure or heart attack, they are main disorders of the heart and blood vessels.

Main features of Heart Risk Warner or what it can do:



After university project, it took a long time to build this device, which can finally give reliable readings of vital signs. However, to increase accuracy of algorithm and create more sophisticated software we started looking for funding. That is how we came to Indiegogo. Your funding can help a lot. We can continue work on practical tests and algorithm improvements. With enough funding, we can move our software from a desktop to a Smartphone application. In exchange for your contribution, we offer you the best our prototype version.

Our perks for Indiegogo contributors


 

Why is it important? 

Today in world the heart disease is one of the major cause of death. For example, risk of having a stroke doubles every decade and after the age of 55 the risk grows advancing in age (WHO). Several studies showed that many people are unaware about their health condition and are not diagnosed until their deaths. It is projected that in the next half of this century elderly population will be growing more rapid than ever before. This indicates that heart problems will be more and more topical than today.

Cardiovascular diseases are the one of the largest worldwide killer among men, woman and not dependent on the race (see figure bellow). 

Hypertension (or high blood pressure), coronary artery disease, arrhythmias are consequences, which will later can evolve to serious health injuries such as heart attack, stroke or sudden death. At the early stages sometimes it is difficult to measure and diagnose health state, because it is not easy observable. For instance hypertension sometimes called “silent killer”, symptoms are not appreciable in early stages until it develops to serious health risk. Likewise arrhythmias sometimes are difficult to measure, if they occur in short time of periods. Therefore, leading causes of chronic diseases often bring enormous harm to state of health, as well as economically it is disadvantageous.


When you get sick, most likely that the first thing you are doing is checking your body temperature. Temperature measurements sometimes are not informative and can be limited to some aspects. Therefore, Heart Risk Warner extends functionality and allows you to get more information such as heart rate, arrhythmia detection, heart rate variability, blood pressure, stiffness index. Thus, you are given extensive information focused on your heart, i.e. the function of the heart and prediction of future heart risk.


For continuous vascular system estimation we selected photoplethysmography, electrocardiography, accelerometers and others technologies. Combination of different technologies allows us to apply more medical methods. That gives important vital signs what are key elements for the heart risk estimation. 

How does it work

During research there wasn't found a single heart risk assessment algorithm, comprised of multiple medical methods. We found the most relevant methods and connected them together. We created simple rule based algorithm structure as a voting system, with separate nodes and defined coefficient values expressed as a risk weight. Coefficient values selected with significance order, and total heart risk calculated by the sum of all coefficients. 

With existing sensors we connected medical methods into a single algorithm. Major methods shown below:

1) Electrocardiography. It is the significant mean for the proper heart diagnosis such as myocardial infarction, ischemia, and, etc. Heart disease or heart deterioration could be referred to particular type of arrhythmia. However, ECG interpretation and diagnosis requires experienced knowledge. However existing software algorithms referring to the problem can work with accuracy up to 98 or 99%. Making to believe that machines can do a really good job for us. 


                                    

2) Continuous blood pressure estimation using novel techniques. We selected combination of few techniques to do this job. One of them is a well know blood pressure estimation from a pulse transit time. Measurements performed from peripheral PPG wave and ECG R wave.

Blood pressure acts an important role to track your health state. According to American Heart Association (AHA) or Yale University School of medicine heart book, resting blood pressure can be classified into cardiovascular risk groups with recommended activities. Correct blood pressure  estimation can be significant cardiovascular risk prevention.

      

3) Heart rate and heart rate variability. We check your every heart beat and calculate  your  heart rate giving you information is it normal or not. Framingham study showed that increased resting heart rate has an significant correlation with cardiovascular diseases and coronary heart diseases, which are leading cause to the increased mortality rates. Maximal physical capacity can be expressed with maximal heart rate, which is important in a proper rehabilitation, physical activity and disease prevention programs. For instance, in some clinical settings, physical activity is stopped when the subject reaches 85% of his maximal heart rate. More about read here >

                                       

4) Stiffness index. Using second sensor we get more data and we are trying to do more analysis about your heart. Stiffen arteries usually is the consequence of age or atherosclerosis, which is the cause to develop myocardial infarction or stroke; therefore, arterial stiffness index is a good myocardial infarction or stroke predictor. Derived data from pulse wave analysis can detect a patient who has coronary artery disease or hypertension.

                             

5) Activity and temperature sensors also are an important algorithm elements that help to improve overall risk estimation but as well it is important to those who are classified to NYHA and want to know and limit their physical activities.

Risk assessment

To get the risk assessment and other parameters, you need to place one or two sensors and wait for 15 - 25 seconds. To more extensive information we recommend to use device for a longer period of times. For example, if you want to catch arrhythmias which are sometimes difficult to observe. 

You can track the risk using our software. To make it more friendly many complex things are hidden. However, if you want you find more details using graphical view (advanced button). 

                           


PPG/ECG feature extraction

Bellow are video showing feature extraction algorithm of PPG/ECG waves. Signals were first recorded into microSD card. Features are marked with blue and red dots. 



Some samples

Currently we are still developing software algorithm and trying to make it more easy to use. Here we are showing how device is working in a real time. You can see that it is connected over USB and gives real time readings. However it also has Bluetooth and micro SD. What allows to store data internally or send it wirelessly. 

First subject is a healthy male, aged 27 with before never known heart problems. Vital signs such as heart beats, blood pressure, stiffness index, etc are shown in a risk assessment report (picture bellow). Heart risk is not detected normal.


                                                             

  

 

Another subject is a young healthy female without previously known heart problems. The single case that she has was a high blood pressure during pregnancy. During experiment she felt good. Heart risk haven't been detected. 

                  

Rita is 73 female with previously known heart problems. Her diagnosed ischemic heart disease and sometimes she experiences tachycardia (while pulse increases over 100 bpm). During experiment software detected some arrhythmic beats that’s why she was classified to MID-HIGH risk group. At the moment she feels normal. However, for more extensive information we suggest her to have device for a longer period of time.

                         

Algis is 71 years old male without previously known serious heart problems. During experiment he was classified into MID risk group due high systolic blood pressure and increased stiffness index. Sometime he experiences high blood pressure.

Sensor placement

Pictures bellow shows how to place ECG electrodes to the chest (left picture). Place PPG sensor to your left hand finger (middle picture). And then plug sensors into device (right picture).

Design

Instead of plastic materials, we have chosen natural wood. A handmade wooden case design makes every Heart Risk Warner unique. We believe wood is something warm and beautiful. Size is approx 28 x 55 x 78 mm (or 1.1 x 2.2 x 3.1 inch.), and weight is approx 182 grams (0.401 lbs). As it is small and lightweight, you will be able to take it everywhere and you even will not feel that you have it.

  


Physical deployment diagram


Development

You can re-use the board for your own project. It is up to you what tools you prefer to use. At the beginning we used several boards that can work for this project. We used LPCXpresso  board and tools developed by Embedded Artists, they are easy to start and use. LPC-Link is an extensible, stand-alone debug adapter that can be configured to support various development tools and IDEs by downloadable firmwares, it  allows easily to re-program and debug Heart Risk Warner device. We are planning to give you firmware drivers ready to write your own application. 

Manufacture





How does it cost to make a single Heart Risk Warner Device?

We roughly estimated costs during the project and what is rough cost of single device.

1) Manufacture includes two main parts (total $47.8)

a) Board manufacture: tooling cost $134, and approx. $100 for 30 boards.  Single board manufacture price $7.8 (ordering more price goes down), assembly and testing approx.$20.  

Total costs $27.8/device

b) Handmade wooden box manufacture. It includes: cutting, milling, drilling, grinding, laser engraving, varnishing, sealing, plus inside build 3.6V 800mAh Li-ion battery.

Total costs  $20/device

2) IC parts and other tools (total $52.83)

IC parts: 53 resistors 0603 ($3.71); ceramic and tantalum capacitors ($5.96); diodes, inductors, quartz, transistors, led's, ($3.24); connectors, sockets, tact-buttons ($ 2.16);

Chips: accelerometer MMA7660 ($1.3), ADS11xx single channel PGA amplifier (approx. $4.6), micro-controller LPC1343 (approx. $4.22), op-amp TL072 ($0.44), temperature sensor TMP100 (approx. $2), voltage regulators (approx. $4), Bluetooth board ($5.2).

Total costs $36.83/device

Sensor cables (ECG, PPG),plus micro USB cable and electrodes. Total price approx. $16/device

3) Instruments and other tools

Some instruments we already have as we work in this area, however others we bought. Here are main instruments and tools we are used: soldering station, reflow oven, chemicals, SMT stencil, multimeters, milling blades, magnifying glasses, pincers, thermometers, etc..

4) Development.  It is hard to estimate while we are doing this due to dream to make it first heart risk assessment tool rather than to make it commercial.

5) Other costs. Costs charged by Indiegogo, 4% if campaign is successful and 9% if it is not. Plus, bank transaction costs, approx. ~3%.  Shipping costs with registered air mail to your home. During the project we get also some unexpected import taxes, and VAT taxes (25%).

Therefore to make it happen at least we need to raise $10000 what is approx.100 supporters. With that amount we can manage to build 100 devices  at the time with much lower price than we previously built. Saved money goes to algorithm improvements and Smartphone application development.


We are trying to do something good

And your contribution can help a lot. If you like it and you believe in us, you can help by putting a good word, or by getting a Heart Risk Warner home. Thank you!

                    

 

FAQ

HAVE A QUESTION?

Contact us: info@hrwproject.com

WHAT OPERATING SYSTEMS SUPPORTED?

It works on windows platforms. We tested it on WinXP / Win7 / Win8. 

IS THE DEVICE WATER RESISTANT?

No. It is not watter resistant. Don't go swimming with your device.

SHIPPING COSTS?

Please add on top 25 USD amount of your perk for international shipping costs and $20 for EU. To those who already supported and are from EU countries we add you an extra gifts, either on your request we will refund you $5.

HOW DEVICE IS CHARGED?

Device is charged over standard micro USB cable in the same way as many popular Smartphones found in the market. In every package we enclose one micro USB cable.

WHAT TECHNOLOGY USED BEHIND HRW DEVICE

Device uses accelerometer, IR sensors, thermometers, and electrodes to collect the data.

CAN I USE HRW FOR MY OWN PROJECTS?

Yes. We are preparing source code samples and libraries. So you on top can build your own software.

IS IT SAFE TO USE?

Device is not authorized to be used neither for life supporting nor for any diagnostic or medical applications. However, all reasonable precautions were used during design and manufacture of this device. We believe it is fully safe to use.

HOW ARE DATA SEND?

Device can be used in two ways off-line or on-line. In off-line mode data are stored internally into micro SD card and later data are used to assess your health state. However, in the on-line mode data are sent over USB or Bluetooth.

Visit our website: www.hrwproject.com
 

UPDATE: 2013 October 03
Hi everyone 10 days left to go, already we raised 42%. We get many questions about what happens if we did not reach a goal. You get anyway working device if we reach a goal or not. However, first prototype version will work only on windows platforms. We will come back to SmartPhone app later but now priority is to improve hardware, firmware and software algorithm.
Delivery deadline is not changed and remains the same, it is 2014 February as mentioned in the perk. So we ship no earlier than January 2014. If you forgot to add shipping costs we remind you by sending email to you. Some of you forgot to add shipping address as well we write an email to ask you to do this.
see updates...

story:
The NOURISH Story

NOURISH was created by Victor and Jocelyn Dubin in 2009. Prior to the creation of NOURISH, Victor owned a yoga studio on the Westside of Santa Cruz and Jocelyn owned a nutrition private practice on the Eastside of Santa Cruz. While people were finding inklings of health and wellness via these two businesses, no one was getting comprehensively well. So in the throws of a national recession, Victor and Jocelyn merged their two businesses into one comprehensive wellness center offering yoga classes, nutrition consultations, massage therapy, and wellness products, all under one roof. Former clients and new ones finally had a wellness home in which to learn how to eat right, reduce stress, and exercise.By opening NOURISH, the care team quintupled the population of community members served, increase the frequency with which each member utilized wellness services, and increased business revenue by 78% in the first year alone. 

What NOURISH Needs

People all over America are sick. They need an infrastructure and affordable place in which to get well. NOURISH provides that infrastructure and affordability. In order to create NOURISH facilities throughout the United States, NOURISH needs funding. 

Each location’s total capital investment is $389,000. Your donation will support the first of many NOURISH locations throughout the country. Funds raised here will go toward:

·  $50,000 Leasehold Improvements

·  $35,000 Equipment, Furniture, and Fixtures

·  $10,000 Location Scouting

·  $15,000 Legal Fees, Permits, Licensing, and Insurance

·  $10,000 Recruiting and Training

·  $50,000 Marketing

The remaining $219,000 will be used as working capital for the first 12 months to take this additional NOURISH wellness center from loss to profit. 

The Impact of Your Donation

By making a donation, you become an active participant in changing the way in which Americans take care of their health. Your donation is a vote for proactive healthcare in a country that, so far, only has a national system for reactive disease management. You and others like you can create a wellness home, reduce the risks of chronic disease development, and encourage communities of people who propel themselves toward healthy, vital living. 

Your donation will be used by a team of wellness professionals with the following 5-year NOURISH performance history:

319% increase in memberships

292% increase in gross revenue over the previous business incarnations

252% increase in wellness product sales

233% increase in stable jobs created

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word. The more people you tell, the more people get well!

story:
I am trying to raise money to help my friend. She needs work done to her home to accommodate a wheelchair. I looked into raising money through my job but was told that she was not an employee, so she did not qualify. A friend told me about this.

I learned a lot about the struggles of the disabled. I was shocked by my own ignorance and that of so many others.

Did you ever take a handicap parking spot? Have you ever used the handicap bathroom stall? Have you ever noticed how heavy some public doors are? There are so many things that impact the ability of the handicap to move within our community and there are so many of us that are blind to these struggles. 

The cost to accommodate this fraction of society is overwhelming to small businesses. Imagine being disabled and having to remodel your home. Now THATS overwhelming.

I hope you can find it in your heart to help me make a difference in the life of a wonderful person. I promise you the money will be put to good use. Her struggles are many and if I can help her to have just one less it would mean everything.

If you can't help monetarily, and I do know times are hard, then send a prayer her way. Every little bit helps.
story_txt: I am trying to raise money to help my friend. She needs work done to her home to accommodate a wheelchair. I looked into raising money through my job but was told that she was not an employee, so she did not qualify. A friend told me about this.I learned a lot about the struggles of the disabled. I was shocked by my own ignorance and that of so many others.Did you ever take a handicap parking spot? Have you ever used the handicap bathroom stall? Have you ever noticed how heavy some public doors are? There are so many things that impact the ability of the handicap to move within our community and there are so many of us that are blind to these struggles. The cost to accommodate this fraction of society is overwhelming to small businesses. Imagine being disabled and having to remodel your home. Now THATS overwhelming.I hope you can find it in your heart to help me make a difference in the life of a wonderful person. I promise you the money will be put to good use. Her struggles are many and if I can help her to have just one less it would mean everything.If you can't help monetarily, and I do know times are hard, then send a prayer her way. Every little bit helps.

story:
A short summary of why I need your help!

Hello my name is Justin Labadie. I'm 26 years old and self employed. I work very hard to make ends meet each month but love what I do. This last year I have been suffering for a while now constantly having an irrated throat. Two weeks ago I broke into one of my random but semi-usual fevers and my throat began to swell. I could barely swallow. (Only one of many times it happened but I kept ignoring it due to the fact it would only happen every few weeks. It recently has been more frequent and intollerable. I finally broke down and went to an ENT doctor (Ear, Nose and Throat). He told me I have been suffering Chronic Cryptic Tonsilitis. (meaning the tonsilitis comes and goes. It also means it is deep in my tonsils not on the surface like "strep") He told me "Don't take this lightly. I know you don't have health insurance but you need to find a way to get the money. If you don't this can turn into throat cancer." Scared, I told him I wanted to set up a time for surgery. He told me he would have the office assistant call me within 24-48 hours to go over the details. She called me the next morning explaining that the surgery is going to cost me $4,000 and that if I wanted to do it they wanted ALL of the money up front. I asked if they could do payment plans with me. She said "No, I have spoken with the doctor and we cannot do that. (They must have decided this because I am Self-Employed I believe.) Recently I have been catching up on all my bills trying to pull ahead for times like these. I am following my dreams right now. I am a passionate and creative web developer. I do not want to give this up. I have looked into getting insurance but it is really expensive to get it for myself. I cannot get it for this situation even if I wanted to now being that I have seen a doctor. I have been told insurance companies will now claim this as a pre-existing condition. I'm really tired of suffering. Please help me get my tonsils removed by making a small donation or spreading the word to people who may help. Thanks so much for understanding my situation!

The other part of me this is effecting.

The other bad part of Chronic Cryptic Tonsilitis is that when I have a fever/swelling it makes it harder for me to sing. I have taken note that flare ups do not occur if I sing BUT if I am having swelling during practice or a show it makes it definetly makes it more challenging to do so. 

What I Need.

$1,000 for the doctor's part of the bill to do the surgery.

$3,000 for the anesthesiologist to put me to sleep for operation. 

The Impact on my Life.

I will be so grateful. You will be helping me through a rough time of self-employment. I work so hard to get ahead and this would keep me from falling back to far to recover for months. If I achieve this goal I will finally be able to start saving money for times like these. You will also help me continue to follow my dreams of being a self-employed web developer and musician.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute money to my campaign DO NOT feel bad! You can help in other ways that only may only take a minute or two.

  • Share on Facebook with someone that you may feel might be able to help me.
  • Talk to others and see if they will contribute.

Thanks Everyone for your love and support! I could never thank you enough.

story:
"Thanks"

It has been an amazing journey so far and now that we have reached this therapy goal I'm excited about the prospect of getting Q even more care than we had hoped. Going over our goal amount means we can easily afford another meeting with his homeopathic doctor and additional treatments that we were unable to pursue previously. Q says thanks. 

Quinan Benaiah Paraiso

His name means strength, from it's Gaelic roots, and Benaiah was a leader of mighty men in the time of kings.  Little did we know how incredibly strong he would be.  Even before he was conceived, I dreamed of talking with my little man and the funny kid things he would say.  Along with the silly kid questions and comments little ones make, talking was the thing about being a mom that I most looked forward to. Quinan is 4, and he has barely ever called me "Mama". His language is more like a 2-year-old. There's certain words he can say, but he is not processing words or communicating effectively.  When all is said and done, all I really want is for my baby to call me Mama... and Daddy too. Yet this therapy will accomplish much more!

Q's Delays

Quinan has had delays from the start. He has a slew of loose diagnosis, such as - global developmental delay, gross motor delay, fine motor delay, ocular motor apraxia, speech delay, learning disorder, hormonal imbalance, language processing issues, sensory problems, and the list goes on.  Suffice it to say that he is way behind, although he's not mentally disabled. He just has to jump over high hurdles that most 4 year olds don't. He is unique.  His speech is at around 2 year old level. Here's an example: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZfMyDg6RtCQ 

What we've done

We have been through many doctors, and have enjoyed many therapies beginning around 5 months old. Since age 2 we have had Quinan enrolled in Sevick School, a special education school that has been wonderful!  We also have him on natural homeopathic medicine to balance his body and gave him sessions in a hyperbaric chamber to help him grow nuerologically. Alas, the growth of his language is still very stunted, more obvious than any other area of growth. It seems that he has AUDIO PROCESSING DISORDER, it's like Quinan hears us and it sounds like gibberish with some real words mixed in.

Where we're going

The GOOD NEWS - We have found Geni King through the wonderful relationship we have with a holistic health doctor, Dr. Kemyar Hedayat. Geni King works with sound therapy and specializes in audio processing disorder.  She uses the Tomatis Method (described in her website). With one meeting and a few hearing tests, Geni knows that she can help Quinan communicate and more!  It's a therapy that has worked on kids like Quinan many many times over! It's a miracle to me that I have finally found someone who KNOWS exactly what I'm dealing with.  There is so much hopelessness involved when you can't talk to your little boy and he can't talk to you.  Geni has given us new hope.  Here is her website and some testimonies:

http://www.kingsvm.com/news.html

Geni King says, "It is very common for kids to literally get pieces of information and they themselves become very clever at trying to fill in the blanks of the chunks of information that they do not get..this too is exhausting, discouraging, and depending on the age, frustrating because THEY know they are not getting the full message.  This is not a hearing issue either, rather a listening one." 

What we Need

Geni King needs to see him for 30 sessions and her office is over 4 hours round trip from my house.  We are sure this therapy will help Quinan exponentially, but it is way more than we can afford.  With medical bills already taking a toll over the years, my husband being out of work for three months, plus a new baby, our resources are tapped out.  We need your help.  I've included all the session costs, the cost of gas, and cost of indiegogo fees in the funding goal. Being a stay at home mom I can drive Quinan to and from his appointments, but I also have my sister in town to help drive. If I don't reach the entire goal, or if we go over the goal, the funds will still go towards Quinan's medical expenses and therapies.  Please, help give Quinan a voice!

What we'll accomplish

This therapy should help Quinan with all of his delays, in some capacity.  The sooner we can start therapy the sooner Quinan will reap the benefits! I wish we could start IMMEDIATELY, but we don't have the money.  We even found out during our first appointment with Geni, that Quinan IS getting input from his left ear! That is an amazing discovery as all prior tests from other sources showed profound hearing loss in that ear (laymans terms: he was considered deaf in his left ear, but he's not!) Your donation will contribute to these likely outcomes:

  • Quinan will be hearing out of his Left ear, that was considered deaf.
  • Quinan will be able to communicate with us in a 4-year-old manner
  • Quinan will have improved balance and coordination
  • He will have an easier time distiguishing sounds and processing them
  • His capability to learn will grow
  • His attention and behavior issues will improve
  • The frustration and stress for Mama and Daddy will greatly reduce
  • Quinan will be safer 
  • We will all be a happier family
  • I can imagine the miracle of Quinan responding to his name!
  • I can imagine him responding when people say, "What is your name?" "How old are you?" or even "Please, don't ..."
  • I hope he will be able to communicate original thoughts and be more connected with us in that way. 

I would love to hear from you, a supportive note is as valuable to me as gold these days.  Thank you, generous masses, for your support even in a thought or a prayer.

 Nikki

Quinan will be able to communicate with us in a 4-year-old manner

His capability to learn will grow
His attention and behavior issues will improve
The frustration and stress for Mama and Daddy will greatly reduce
Quinan will be safer

I can imagine him responding when people say, "What is your name?" "How old are you?" or even "Please, don't ..."

I would love to hear from you, a supportive note is as valuable to me as gold these days.  Thank you, generous masses, for your support even in a thought or a prayer.
 Nikki

story:
1002 NIGHTS



*****  UPDATE AS OF OCTOBER 26, 2011  ***** 


Dear Friends and Loved Ones,

It was nearly 5 months ago when doctors advised me that I had stomach cancer and less than four weeks to live.   They were wrong in part of their diagnosis.  My doctors did not take into account the power of prayers and the power of love from the thousands of my friends, fans and family.  It is because of your love, your prayers and your generosity that I am still alive today.

 

After nearly three months of intensive and sometimes painful treatment in Germany the cancer seems to be under control.  However there remains the possibility that the cancer may return and as such I am continuing to receive treatment, both traditional and holistic - alternative here in San Francisco.  If all goes well, I may spend the winter months in India to continue receiving cost effective alternative treatments while staying close to friends and families. 

 

You all donated nearly $75,000 to fund my medical treatment.  Live fundraising concerts were held to raise additional monies.

In a month, with the help of my record label Six Degrees Records, we will be releasing a downloadable compilation that features original, new, never published tracks from artist friends such as Ustad Zakir Hussain, Pandit G.S. Sachdev, Natacha Atlas, Karsh Kale, Nitin Sawhney, Midival Punditz, Kailash Kher, Azam Ali, Simon Shaheen, Bombay Dub Orchestra, Cheb Mami, Steve Shehan, Amina, Mercan Dede, Transglobal Underground, Freq Nasty & David Starfire, Emam, Jai Uttal, Riffat Sultana, Janaka Selekta, Opium, Watcha Clan. All proceeds from this compilation shall be donated to fund my continued medical treatment.

For those of you who would like to donate through PayPal, you may do so to my email address: chebisabbah@chebisabbah.com

 

I don't think I can adequately express my thanks and love to you all.  I lived long enough to come back to my home and favorite city: San Francisco. I lived long enough to see the birth of my granddaughter, Rachel and with your continued love, prayers and support I will live long enough to share new music with you and to see you all on the dancefloor.

 

I thank you all from the bottom of my heart.

 

Love & Light

 

Cheb i Sabbah


-------   UPDATE AS OF JUNE 29, 2011 ------


Chebiji is currently undergoing  treatment and posted a message in the "updates" section of this campaign.  


Thank you for your love and blessings.



 -------   UPDATE AS OF JUNE 20, 2011 ------


With your incredible support we achieved our initial goal of raising $25,000  for Chebiji's Cancer Treatment Fund.   PLEASE keep donating to help us defray the massive costs of Chebiji's on going medical treatment.  The campaign will remain active until August 15, 2011.  


On behalf of Chebiji, we thank you all for your blessings, generosity and kindness. 


------------------


OUR STORY

 

Musical pioneer Cheb i Sabbah was recently diagnosed with Stage 4 stomach cancer.  He was advised that the cancer was spreading to his liver and left lung and that time was not on his side.    Like many Americans, “Chebiji” - as he is affectionately known – does not have health insurance.  Due to his weak health condition, Chebiji found himself having to cancel live shows, meaning his income stream has come to a complete halt, with mounting medical bills and future medical costs ahead. 

 

Upon learning of his condition, a few close friends and artists have come together to rally around Chebiji and assist him with his fight.  Devastated by the news and outraged that an artist of Chebiji’s caliber cannot afford to care for himself and receive the proper urgent medical treatment needed, we have set up a fund to help.

THE IMPACT

 

Sabbah’s influence on the global electronic music and DJ scene cannot be over estimated. He has shown two entire generations that classical world traditions can blend beautifully and respectfully with DJ Culture.  Thousands have experienced his music and artistic vision through his many albums and on his dance floors – whether in Goa, Essaouira, Moscow or at Nickie’s, where he ran an eighteen year San Francisco weekly residence, we know what a beautiful gift Chebiji has been to the world at large. This is our opportunity to give something back to Cheb i Sabbah in his time of need    

 

WHAT WE NEED

We have identified a cancer clinic in Germany that is ideally suited for Chebiji’s condition and age.  We estimate a treatment and recovery period of one year during which time Chebiji will be unable to work.  Our conservative projected costs for his treatment and household expenses during the treatment and recovery period is at least $45,000 but in all likelihood, considerably more. We hope to raise monies through private donations, benefit shows and benefit albums/remix albums.  In addition, we turn Chebiji's friends and fans to help us raise at least $25,000.   The breakdown of monies needed is as follows:

1.             Cancer Treatment inclusive of airfare and lodging:   Minimum: $27,000

2.             One Year of Fixed Expenses (Rent/Storage/Electric ): $18,000



Please note that our estimated cost of $45,000 only the minimum projected cost of Chebiji's cancer treatment.  There may be unanticipated costs incurred during his treatment so please donate generously.


HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

We ask all of Chebij’s friends and fans to help spread the word about his condition via all social media platforms (Twitter, Facebook). 

www.chebisabbah.org

story:
Hello and Good Day,

   SIMPLY PUT: I, URGENTLY NEED YOUR HELP !!

 I am Cherie (USMC), I spent many, many years serving this Great United States of America as a member of thee United States Marine Corps. While serving over seas, My left leg was "severely damaged" requiring re-construction and multiple surgeries resulting in, but not limited to, severed nerves, loss of use and the leg is 3 inches shorter. Shortly thereafter (as My health was declining), I was diagnosed with Relapsing Remitting Multiple Sclerosis (I am required to self-inject Interferon and take Morphine for pain) both extremely expensive medications. I began losing the use of My fingers, hands, good leg and foot. 

                              ** I am NO longer able to work** 

    A new medical device came along and I volunteered to participate and a "SPINAL CORD IMPLANT" which wires are connected from the spinal cord to the brain  and wires that attach to a control device that is under the skin just above My left butt cheek. Approximately 8 months or so ago I was diagnosed with Pharyngeal Cancer, which was recently "confirmed" and treatment implemented . Needless to say, I have had to endure many surgeries, doctor appointments, hospital stays, recovery, therapy and the like.

 

I just had to ask: How and why has this happened ? I truly believe that, "God only brings to You the things He knows You can handle." Also, "There is a reason for Everything."

 

    After I was diagnosed with Cancer, I was scheduled for an an appointment  in San Fransisco (400 miles from where I live) and ended up staying. I returned to My house and discovered My truck and bike were not there and upon entering, discovered the house ransacked and the back door wide open.

    All - in - all, My bank account was drained, a check was written for $2954.00 (there were NO funds to cover it and an arrest warrant was issued to Me). Because ALL of My bills are on "auto-pay" NONE of them were paid I accumulated $827.00 in "overdraft fees" and last but not least, I was given notification to vacate My home and pay $3300.00 in back payments and an additional $1700.00 in legal fees. This was accompanied by a notice "REQUEST IMMEDIATE ENTRANCE TO DWELLING FOR ABANDONMENT INVESTIGATION" all of My utilities were shut off.

    My doctors called last week to advise Me that I am getting sick "QUITE RAPIDLY". I now have no vehicle (appointments 2 or 3 times a week being missed) and have no where to put any of My belongings as of 01OCT13 - I will be homeless (by order) My vehicles were found and placed in impound @ $386.00 tow and $40.00 per day at a total of $1700.00 just to get them released $30.00 for the Police reports. I have tried the Military, VA, several Banks, even people that owe Me money to ABSOLUTELY no avail !! My bank has frozen My account until AFTER the investigation has been completed.

    Bottom line: I am getting getting sicker and I AM NOT A QUITTER !! I have managed to "get by" on $130.00 for the past month and ALL I want to do is eliminate the stress attached with My situation (which above all "stress is one of the worst attributes that contribute to Relapsing/Remitting MS") I want My HOME, vehicle (s), savings, jewelry, weapons, coins and collectibles back. I want to live out the rest of My life with the things "I WORKED SO HARD, FOR MANY YEARS, TO HAVE and DESERVE".

 I am definitely:

 "A DISABLED United States Marine - Determined & REACHING OUT - PLEASE HELP"

**If it is not possible to donate, please pass the word and post this to Your social-media sights. Have a GREAT DAY be BLESSED and Thank You Very Much for taking the time to read this. Your concern, care and generosity are far above and beyond Appreciated**    OOH RAH....

 "Saepae Expertus and Semper Fidelis,"

 Meaning:

 "Truly Tested and Always Faithful,"
story_txt:
Hello and Good Day,

   SIMPLY PUT: I, URGENTLY NEED YOUR HELP !!

 I am Cherie (USMC), I spent many, many years serving this Great United States of America as a member of thee United States Marine Corps. While serving over seas, My left leg was "severely damaged" requiring re-construction and multiple surgeries resulting in, but not limited to, severed nerves, loss of use and the leg is 3 inches shorter. Shortly thereafter (as My health was declining), I was diagnosed with Relapsing Remitting Multiple Sclerosis (I am required to self-inject Interferon and take Morphine for pain) both extremely expensive medications. I began losing the use of My fingers, hands, good leg and foot. 

                              ** I am NO longer able to work** 

    A new medical device came along and I volunteered to participate and a "SPINAL CORD IMPLANT" which wires are connected from the spinal cord to the brain  and wires that attach to a control device that is under the skin just above My left butt cheek. Approximately 8 months or so ago I was diagnosed with Pharyngeal Cancer, which was recently "confirmed" and treatment implemented . Needless to say, I have had to endure many surgeries, doctor appointments, hospital stays, recovery, therapy and the like.

 

I just had to ask: How and why has this happened ? I truly believe that, "God only brings to You the things He knows You can handle." Also, "There is a reason for Everything."

I want to live out the rest of My life with the things "I WORKED SO HARD, FOR MANY YEARS, TO HAVE and DESERVE".

 I am definitely:

 "A DISABLED United States Marine - Determined & REACHING OUT - PLEASE HELP"

**If it is not possible to donate, please pass the word and post this to Your social-media sights. Have a GREAT DAY be BLESSED and Thank You Very Much for taking the time to read this. Your concern, care and generosity are far above and beyond Appreciated**    OOH RAH....

 Meaning:

 "Truly Tested and Always Faithful,"

story:
Hello my friends,

For some of you who may not know us, my name is Jennifier and my husband’s name is Kevin. We have been together for 18 years, and have 2 beautiful daughters, Malani age 8 and Aysia age 3. We would like to ask for your help. 3 ½ years ago Kevin’s kidneys were functing at 3% and he started dialysis 3 days a week, 4 hours each day.

We immediately started the process of getting on the transplant list at Oschners Medical Center in New Orleans, Louisiana. The average wait time for a kidney in the United States is 4-6 years.

 We have been waiting over 3 years for that one phone call from Oschners  that says, “Come now, we have a kidney for you”. But that has not happened yet.

However, we did get a phone call from Kevin’s nephew, David, who said, “Uncle Kevin, I would like to try and give you a kidney”.

That phone call was 4 months ago and we have found out that David is a perfect match.  Having waited so long for a match with no prospects, it was truly a blessing to discover that not only was David willing to give Kevin a kidney but by God’s grace, that he is a perfect match.  This kidney will allow Kevin the life he had before dialysis

And now, a date has been set.

Surgery is scheduled for June 17th, 2013.

Kevin and I need your help.

There are 3 expenses we are raising money for. Housing in New Orleans for 5 weeks, 1 antifungal medication that insurance does not cover, and for me to take as much time off work as needed to be with my husband while he recovers from the surgery.

1. We need to stay in New Orleans up to 5 weeks after the surgery so Kevin can go back and forth to the hospital every day/ several times a day for lab work. This is to monitor his new kidney and how it is functioning.

2. The antifungal medication is priced at $1100 per month. (Unfortunately the insurance does not cover this medication, although it is necessary.) Kevin needs to take this medication for 3-12 months after the surgery. Oschners has informed us that we can get financial assistance for up to 75% of the cost, but that still leaves us with at least $275 per month for 3-12 months. And this is on top of all other co-pays for the other medication he will need to take.

3. In a perfect world I would like to take all 5 weeks off from work, but I only have 5 days of vacation. So I will definitely have to take time off with out pay. I am thankful that my job is willing to work with me during this time and with help from our family and friends, I will be able to be with my husband during his recovery.

We are so grateful and blessed to have so many friends and family to help us to raise the money needed for these expenses not covered by insurance.  Those of you closest to us know how difficult it has been for Kevin these past three years on dialysis.  He has been prayerful and God has given him the strength to endure this cross.  He has never given up hope and has worked hard to be positive and to still give back when he can.  He continues to work with our kids in the Acadiana area and the athletes he has given his time to train, have becomevery successful.

Please share our story with all family and friends. Together we can do it!

We love you all and thank you so much for helping us.  Keep us in your prayers.

Sincerely, Jennifier and Kevin

Leaf in the Press:

Trend Monitor - Crowdfunding Spotlight: Leaf – The Cleverly Innovative Tea Maker

Ayudos - Keyway Innovations Introduces Leaf Tea Maker on Indiegogo

SBWire - Keyway Innovations Introduces Leaf Tea Maker on Indiegogo

 

Don't forget to visit our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter for more information about the Leaf Tea Maker!
 
    
 
Enjoy Our Cleverly Innovative Brewing Experience!
 
Making tea seems easy, but making good tea is not!
 
The core technology in our Leaf Tea Maker is a unique circulative brewing system that can optimally control all 4 of the key brewing elements.

 

Here is the brief product spec for the Leaf Tea Maker:

Leaf Tea Maker comes in Standard and Full-Featured Versions, each equipped with many convenient features to greatly enhance your brewing experience.

 
 


So no matter what type of tea you want to make, you will enjoy great tasting tea and unique brewing experience EVERY TIME with our Leaf Tea Maker!

 

Secret Behind Our Innovative Brewing Mechanism

Our Leaf Tea Maker is based on our innovative brewing mechanism we invented and is patent pending. This unique circulative brewing mechanism directs heated water at the right temperature over the tea leaves to let them fully expand and release the tea essence at the optimal brewing settings.

The beauty of our innovation is that it does not use a water pump or mechanical agitator to create the necessary water flow. Also, all parts coming in contact with water are fully accessible and washable.

Not only does our innovation drastically improve product reliability, but it also enhances cleanibility and overall hygiene.

Our Leaf Tea Maker is also able to brew tea more efficiently and extract more tea essence out of tea leaves under the same water temperature and brewing time settings in comparison with traditional brewing methods (i.e. water kettle and tea pot).   

 

Like having delicious Hong Kong style milk tea or Taiwanese bubble tea? Want to try making it yourself? But it is just too much of a hassle to make it at home and doesn't taste good anyway because traditional brewing methods can't produce strong enough tasting tea to blend well with the milk. 

On the other hand, buying them from a shop or in pre-mixed form leaves you no control on (God knows!) what ingredients they put in your drink.

But with our Leaf Tea Maker and its innovative brewing mechanism, making your own favourite milk tea at home would be a breeze. We treat ourselves with making our own HK-style milk tea and other delicious tea drinks using our working prototypes every day and we just can't get enough of them!!!

 

Besides traditional Chinese tea types and various kinds of milk tea, the brewing settings are fully customizable according to your preference. So feel free to experiment with your favourite recipes using our Leaf Tea Maker!

 

While the core technical aspects are protected by worldwide patent applications, we would like to wait and reveal the full secrets of our innovative brewing mechanism to you only when we approach actual market launch. We are sure you will be surprised at the simplicity and hidden gems of our innovation then!

 

Project Background and Outlook

Our journey began in 2010 as an internal research project at a Fortune 500 company.  After over 2 years of market research and technology development, our team has successfully developed a truly innovative tea maker, first of its kind in the world.

To further realize our invention's business potential, our team founded Keyway Innovations in 2012 and secured a licensing arrangement to bring this innovative tea maker to market with our own added innovations.

We are currently based in both Hong Kong and Shanghai, and our team consists of dedicated multinational professionals who are passionate about tea.

Our core team (from left) Karen, Rick, Macho and Nicolas.
 
The key enabling technologies and product architecture are ready and have been successfully implemented in the latest product prototypes.  We are working hard to launch it on the market within 1 year.
 

Funding Arrangement & Perks

Our current funding target is USD $300,000, which would cover the costs for:

  • End product design (mechanical, electronics, industrial, software)
  • Prototyping & tooling
  • Testing & safety certification (e.g. IEC, CCC, CE, UL)
  • Material and components 
  • Manufacturing & quality control

We are currently collaborating closely with established manufacturers and component suppliers to jointly develop and commercialize our Leaf Tea Maker.

Being the first product of its kind in the world, the startup and associated costs for our Leaf Tea Maker are relatively high. And we need to pass all the necessary household appliance safety tests and approbation procedures to ensure the utmost product safety for you (and us as well!). 

But our hard work combined with your support will together make the launch of the Leaf Tea Maker on the market a reality!!!

From now to the final end product design, we estimate it would take 2 to 3 rounds of intermediate prototype design and refinement process, each lasting about 2-3 months. Then it would take about 6-8 months to go through the mass production stage. Therefore we aim to complete the entire product commercialization process within 1 year.

Your contribution will help us put together our final end product with an attractive look and global user experience. Your support will also allow us to take care of every design detail so that you will truly enjoy the brewing process with our Leaf Tea Maker.
 

To show our gratitude towards your generous support and contributions, we would like to offer a wide range of perks:

  • Sincere digital thanks
  • First 100 supporters: Save $70 on preordering your own Leaf Tea Maker! (Pre-Launch & Standard) 
  • Other supporters, be the first ones in the world to preorder Leaf Tea Maker! (Pre-Launch, Standard, and Full-Featured versions)

 

Help Us Spread the Word for the Chance to Win a Leaf Tea Maker!

If you like our Leaf Tea Maker and what we are doing, great! We look forward to your support. Even if you may not be much of a tea drinker or are extremely satisfied with your current ways of brewing tea, you can still help us by telling your friends and family about our great Leaf Tea Maker and spread the word on Facebook, Twitter and other social networks of your liking!

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign for the chance to win a Leaf Tea Maker (see below)
  • Like us and follow us on our Facebook page
  • Follow us on Twitter or Sina Weibo新浪微博
  • Visit us at our Keyway Innovations website for updates 

In appreciation of your support, we are holding a referral contest and we award the following prizes to the top 3 referrers of our campaign that resulted in the highest USD contributions as accounted at the end of our funding period (excluding all of us in the Keyway team):

  • Top referrer - 1 Full-Featured Leaf Tea Maker, or 1 Standard Leaf Tea Makers plus 1 free perk of your choice under USD100
  • 2nd place - 1 Standard Leaf Tea Maker
  • 3rd place - 1 free perk of your choice under USD100 

To take part in our referral contest, first sign up for or log into your Indiegogo account, or first contribute to our campaign, then use one of the Share Tools to share our campaign:

  • Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code.
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo

For details, please check out the articles on How to Share Your Campaign and How to Run a Referral Contest from Indiegogo or contact us. 

 

There's More! Share Our Campaign for the Chance for Free Shipping and Handling!

For our campaign contributors, if your referrals resulted in USD contribution of any amount, we will pay your applicable shipping and handling of your paid perk! To participate, please follow these guidelines:

  • Select your perk and pay using Paypal (sorry, direct credit card payments cannot participate)
  • Share our campaign (see above)
  • Notify us through email of your intention to participate 
  • For every referred contributor, you will receive free shipping and handling per paid perk item as refund to your Paypal account

For details, please contact us.

 

We can't wait to share our great Leaf Tea Maker with you and we really look forward to your support to make this happen!

Cheers!

 

*If you have further questions, please visit our FAQ page or contact us.

 

Acknowledgements

Dosee Media Production Inc.

Jumpstart Offices 

Soundtrack "Working Together" by Alec Makinson. Licensed through www.stockmusicsite.com

story:
Grace was born in Ghana ,West Africa in June 2003, and came home to live with us in 2008. We were told then that she had suffered a serious illness as a baby and had the will and strength to overcome it, therefore her African name Adom, meaning Grace was more than fitting. Our wonderful doctor listened to Mariama tell the story of her sickness and noting a twenty percent hearing loss in her right ear deduced that she had probably suffered from cerebral malaria as a baby. According to Mariama she was a fat little baby but came to us as a twenty five pound five year old with knobby knees and a crooked little walk. Now she is a 4'5" of solid muscle and pure joy to all who know her.

When we put Grace in gymnastics two years ago, she started in a weekly recreational class. Two months later she had advanced all the way to team and costs as one might assume, escalated. Being a photographer I love to barter when I can and one was put into place with Grace's gym.  I was able to shoot rec pictures  for them and defer some of the cost over the past two years, but the big barter wasn't to take place until this September. In late July, Shawn and I discussed it and decided that it was time to change gyms. We realized that Grace had a gift for gymnastics and now was the time to put all efforts toward the big picture and place her in a gym that would help her move toward winning a college scholarship or maybe  achieve every little gymnast's dream, to one day compete in the Olympics. So we drained the savings and found money under the couch and sold items in the basement, to settle up with her gym. 

We did our research and found a good match for Grace, but we are coming in right at the beginning of competition season with registration fees, uniform costs, USAG fees, higher monthly fees because of a new level etc. and even though this gym fundraises for it's competition fees (which we love )we have missed the first fundraiser. So we plan on doing the monthly selling  of Krispy Kreme doughnuts and smart cards and lemonade stands all things that grandparents and friends  and neighborhoods get hit up to buy! We are so grateful to have that for the future, but this fundraiser will allow Grace to compete this season and not miss out on a much needed year of competition. All the funds raised will go directly to her new gym to get us headed in the right direction.

I can't tell you how exciting it is to watch her train this past week and learn new skills and just get that fresh start. 

Being able to offer photography perks and packages at this price is very exciting! www.robindoddphotography.com

I love to put art on the wall of people's homes. That is a fact and I have long ago taken digital packages out of my photography business.  This gives you guys the opportunity to have a mini shoot and also receive  10 digitals. For all the creative types we know, actors, musicians, or families who haven't had a big budget for photography but would love to have photos. In the Yurchenko perk, buy a session and give a friend a chance to receive a free one is a way to pay it forward. If you were thinking of getting photos anyway, nows the time! 

 

The Impact

In 2012-13 Grace was the state champ for her age group on floor, beam and bars, she also was all-around champ with just those three events.

Keeping Grace moving forward without a break in training means everything to her success. We have faith in her! and most importantly she loves it and is having a great time!

"The future belongs to those who believe in their dreams."

                              -Eleanor Roosevelt

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing with your friends who may have a heart for adoption and kids would be awesome.
story_txt:
Grace was born in Ghana ,West Africa in June 2003, and came home to live with us in 2008. We were told then that she had suffered a serious illness as a baby and had the will and strength to overcome it, therefore her African name Adom, meaning Grace was more than fitting. Our wonderful doctor listened to Mariama tell the story of her sickness and noting a twenty percent hearing loss in her right ear deduced that she had probably suffered from cerebral malaria as a baby. According to Mariama she was a fat little baby but came to us as a twenty five pound five year old with knobby knees and a crooked little walk. Now she is a 4'5" of solid muscle and pure joy to all who know her.
When we put Grace in gymnastics two years ago, she started in a weekly recreational class. Two months later she had advanced all the way to team and costs as one might assume, escalated. Being a photographer I love to barter when I can and one was put into place with Grace's gym.  I was able to shoot rec pictures  for them and defer some of the cost over the past two years, but the big barter wasn't to take place until this September. In late July, Shawn and I discussed it and decided that it was time to change gyms. We realized that Grace had a gift for gymnastics and now was the time to put all efforts toward the big picture and place her in a gym that would help her move toward winning a college scholarship or maybe  achieve every little gymnast's dream, to one day compete in the Olympics. So we drained the savings and found money under the couch and sold items in the basement, to settle up with her gym. 
We did our research and found a good match for Grace, but we are coming in right at the beginning of competition season with registration fees, uniform costs, USAG fees, higher monthly fees because of a new level etc. and even though this gym fundraises for it's competition fees (which we love )we have missed the first fundraiser. So we plan on doing the monthly selling  of Krispy Kreme doughnuts and smart cards and lemonade stands all things that grandparents and friends  and neighborhoods get hit up to buy! We are so grateful to have that for the future, but this fundraiser will allow Grace to compete this season and not miss out on a much needed year of competition. All the funds raised will go directly to her new gym to get us headed in the right direction.
I can't tell you how exciting it is to watch her train this past week and learn new skills and just get that fresh start. 
Being able to offer photography perks and packages at this price is very exciting! www.robindoddphotography.com
I love to put art on the wall of people's homes. That is a fact and I have long ago taken digital packages out of my photography business.  This gives you guys the opportunity to have a mini shoot and also receive  10 digitals. For all the creative types we know, actors, musicians, or families who haven't had a big budget for photography but would love to have photos. In the Yurchenko perk, buy a session and give a friend a chance to receive a free one is a way to pay it forward. If you were thinking of getting photos anyway, nows the time! 
 



The Impact
In 2012-13 Grace was the state champ for her age group on floor, beam and bars, she also was all-around champ with just those three events.
Keeping Grace moving forward without a break in training means everything to her success. We have faith in her! and most importantly she loves it and is having a great time!
"The future belongs to those who believe in their dreams."
                              -Eleanor Roosevelt

Sharing with your friends who may have a heart for adoption and kids would be awesome.

story:
The number of incidents relating to of research chemicals being sold as recreational drugs in recent years has increased dramatically, resulting in a demand for a chemical reagent test kit. Research chemicals, also known as ‘synthetic designer drugs’, have become increasingly popular in teens and young adults.

         On September 16, 2013, “DEA Special Agent in Charge Brian R. Crowell stated, ‘There has been a 300% increase in poison centers nationwide responding to calls related to synthetic drugs and 60 percent of the cases involved patients 25 years old and younger. Our youth are the targets of drug trafficking organizations distributing synthetic drugs like Methylone under the guise of it being molly or ecstasy. Today’s arrests are of members of a molly distribution crew responsible for spreading this dangerous poison throughout the northeast. Kids need to know they are not taking ecstasy. We are seeing street dealers selling something with a catchy name such as molly, and in fact it’s poisonous synthetic chemicals made in labs in China. Overdoses from ingesting these types of chemicals are extremely dangerous and unforgiving."

        Detect-Kit informs the individual of the possible presence of a substance. Detect-kit will offer the same type of preliminary Identification kit used by the U.S. Department of Justice, but as harm reduction tool. Our ultimate goal is that Detect-Kit be offered at various retail locations nationwide. Each kit will have 30 to 50 uses. We will have an app that corresponds will the physical test kit’s reactions. This app will provide a more in-depth explanation of the test results. The app will contain a drug database that includes the effects of the drugs on the body.

This is the Marquis reagent reaction sheet that will be provided with the of the kit and the app.


This is the Mandelin reagent reaction sheet that will be provided with the of the kit and the app.




What We Need & What You Get

       Our project is way past the prototype phase, so the funds donated will go directly to the manufacturing process for the kits. We need funds for mass manufacturing and packaging so that we can have a worthy product capable of being sold in stores nationwide. The funds will also allow for a professionally developed website and thorough apps for Android and iOS devices. The $10,000 we need will expedite the production of Detect-Kit for consumer use.


Perks:

$2- A tweet from our Twitter account thanking you for your donation.

$5- An email from our gmail account thanking you for your donation.. You are required to email us at detectkit14@gmail.com

$10- You get a black Ink on white vinyl detect-kit logo sticker.

$20 - Donor slot on website: You will have your name on our website's donor page.

$40- Receive an exclusively designed donor T-Shirt. (Shipping not included in price) & logo sticker.

$50- Get both kits: Marquis Kit and Mandelin Kit

$75- T-shirt exclusively designed for donors and both test kits

$100- Contributor package:
All of the perks listed above

$625- Distributor Pack :
50 count Detect- Kit package
25 of each Detect-Kit type (25 Marquis Kits, 25 Mandelin kits)

$1,000-  Deluxe Distributor Pack
100 count Detect-Kit package
50 of each Detect-Kit type (50 Marquis Kits, 50 Mandelin Kits)

$5,000 VIP Sponsor- The VIP sponsor will get his/her name printed on the all of the Detect-Kit packages and on the Detect-Kit homepage (if so desired). The package will say "Sponsored by: (Your Name)". The VIP Sponsor will also receive the Contributor Package.

The Impact

      Detect-Kit will allow the product's purchasers to gain valuable insight into the substances they encounter, which will broaden the public's knowledge. Detect-Kit customers will be able to inform themselves on unknown substances and henceforth, make the proper decisions based on their findings. Detect-Kit allows any citizen to be an informed citizen. Detect kit will provide a successful path to harm reduction when an individual comes into contact with potentially harmful substances. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Twitter and like our Facebook page for news about the project. Help us spread the word about Detect-Kit!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Steve Mervau.  I grew up riding and racing motorcycles with two time WORCS Champion Nathan Woods.   Nathan had some struggles finding motorcycles to race when we were in our teens.   Quiet simply, the funding wasn't there for Nathan. However, Nathan never let that stop him from riding.  I vividly remember after turning Pro sometime in 93' Nathan Woods had to ride his uncles clapped out 1986 YZ 490.  And this was in 1993!  My goal is to honor Nathan Woods memory (RIP #54) by helping Brandon Ray not suffer the same setbacks.  

B-Ray will be a champion with the right bike, and we the Motocross community are going to make it happen for him.  John, Brandon's father, is on disability/fixed income, and I can tell you he spends every dime and then some on this kid getting to the track. Quick story, first time I met John, he had me in tears about how badly Brandon wanted it and the sacrifices they make to get to the track.  As I was talking to John, I noticed his belt... or say lack thereof.  He was wearing a bungee cord for a belt...  There is only one thing on this dad's mind - get this kid to the races!  Now lets help these guys out and get him on some good equipment!

What We Need & What You Get

We need a 2011-2013 85cc Motocross bike in great condition for the 2014 Season. Brandon expects to qualify for Loretta Lynn's this year on the 85cc machine!  

The funding will go into Steve Mervau and/or Crytal Kelly's paypal accounts.  When we reach our goal of $3000, Brandon, his father, and I will go purchase the motorcycle together - on video!   I will then do a nice little video about our journey here and also follow Brandon around on the track and get some good footage of him on his new machine!  

There are many levels of donation and they all help to the goal.   It feels great to give.  So please bring the gift of giving and holiday cheer to this young motocross racer! 

If we don't reach our goal, we will continue to push locally.  Ultimately, the money will go to Brandon's racing in some form.  Weather it be entries, gear, or a new bike.  The money WILL be spent on motocross and motocross only.

The Impact

The Impact of giving a young boy a motorcycle is unparalleled.  This tangible item gives a child so many intangible things!  Responsibility, courage, and mostly self esteem and pride that today's youth lacks.  Motocross teaches you more about simply riding.  It teaches you about mechanics and life.  So many times kids miss the boat on how a simple thing like tire pressure or an oil change can affect their lives.  It may sound silly, but think for a second.  How many men out there can't change their own oil?  Motocross teaches real life, real world lessons that kids can use today and tomorrow.  Your child will use motocross (and all accompanying lessons that come with it) more than math in the real world.

I have had recent success in a similar situation where a young boy needed to upgrade his motorcycle to his skill level.  We raised $500 in 3 days!  See it on youtube:  Search "Little Rodney's New Kx 60 Donated by Nor/Cal MX and Friends"

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean you can’t help!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about B-Ray and his talent!
  • Share this campaign on Face Book and at the track!
  • Ask friends and family for donations!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

YOU can make a difference NOW!

story:
Thanks for helping us reach our goal people, we are forever thankful. But remember that it is still time to top it off way past 100%. Please help by giving a few dollars, and sharing the campaign by using the sharing tools.

What is this campaign all about?:

In Norway people with Marita´s neck injury atlantoaxial instability (AAI) do NOT get medical help or even a diagnosis. 

Norway does not recognize AAI as an actual injury even though the World Health Organization (WHO) and many other countries do. The Norwegian healthcare system claim that this injury does not exist... and they refuse to give a diagnosis and any help to patients suffering from this injury. 
This means that hundreds of people in Norway is suffering without getting help!

You can help Marita to get better by contributing to her operation, and we will help the others suffering by getting our documentary made about this cause! 

We will not stop fighting for the suffering people! 

---------------------------------------------------------

THE BACKSTORY:

In 2005 Marita was on a school trip to Finland, while there she was in a snowmobile accident that left her momentarily paralyzed in her lower body and with severe pain in her back and neck. She was immediately taken to the local hospital in Finland. There they found a broken disk in her back (L5), but told her there was nothing serious about it. It would eventually heal itself…

Two days later they carried her to her plane, and sent her home. Her neck was never checked!

Marita has not been able to work since then, and now has a life where she spend most of her time in severe pain in her bed and on the sofa.

WHY WAS MARITA IN PAIN?:

One year ago a private doctor in Norway found Maritas neck injury. She has atlantoaxial instability (AAI) also known as cervical instability.

He used an ordinary x-ray machine, so the injury should have been found many years ago. This could finally explain Maritas deteriorating health and the troubles she has with her central nerve system.

Before this Marita had desperately tried everything to get better, but nothing helped since the real problem was her neck. 

In October 2013 we had saved up 7200 US dollars so that we could travel to München, Germany to get more detailed pictures of her neck and back in an Upright MRI. Here they found three breaks in her back, one so severe that it should have been operated in 2005, but now it is to late as the bone pieces have grown in the wrong places.

You may ask yourself: Doesn’t Norway have the best healthcare system in the world…?

We thought so to until we knew the truth about Maritas neck injury...

Norway is way behind in the medical development of cervical instability. Cervical Instability due to accidents is not recognized in the health system in Norway, even though the World Health Organization (WHO) and many countries recognize it and sees the danger it leads to.

Marita does not get help because they cannot discover atlantoaxial instability (AAI) by the X-ray methods they use here in Norway. In many other countries they discover this injury because they use dynamic X-ray instead, this is what WHO recommends. *More info in links below. 
The Norwegian government has decided in parliamentary decision #484, that Norway should follow WHO´s guidelines. In reality this guideline is not followed when it comes to patients suffering from cervical instability.

THE OPERATION COST:

Marita has fallen out of the system and must pay everything herself. We must pay 26.000 US Dollars just for the operation. This does not include travel expenses, rehabilitation and medication after the operation.

All we want is for Marita to get rid of the nerve pains in her jaw, eyes, teeth, ears, arms and neck. Right now her body shuts down because the nerves in her neck is under constant pressure so she suffers from unbelivable pain and fatigue.

THE DOCUMENTARY:

We are currently making a documentary about the way thousands of people with neck injuries in Norway don´t get the help they need!

I am a film producer with a degree in film producing from the Norwegian National Filmschool and I have been filming Marita on her journey to a better health the last year. Shocking facts have come our way.

We are making this film to help others get a diagnosis and get medical help in Norway. Because it´s hard to believe that the Norwegian healthcare system that is listed as the 5th best in the world, actually refuse to accept an injury that is real!

Thanks for your help, and God bless,

Klaus & Marita


---------------------------------------------------------

You can read more about atlantoaxial instability here:
http://emedicine.medscape.com

* More info in these links:

  1. Dynamic Weight Bearing Cervical MRI
  2. Role of Dynamic Flexion-Extension MRI Scan in the Management of Degenerative Cervical Spine Disease
  3. The Role of Dynamic MRI in Cervicothoracic Junction Disorders Report of Case

story:
Summary

Penn AC Gold is a 5 week long summer rowing program, at the University of Pennsylvania, designed to turn really good rowers into great rowers.  I recently was accepted to join their team this summer and I would love to go. 

The organization has a history of excellence and routinely wins club nationals (which will be held in Tennessee this year).

Penn AC has produced many rowers who have been recruited into the nation's top universities.

I am one of the 18 boys accepted to this year's team. I really hope to go and improve my rowing so Ivy League schools will recruit me.

The total basic cost is $6600 for 5 weeks, which my family cannot afford. Please consider to help my chances of attending.

The cost covers living in the campus dorms, travel expenses throughout the 5 weeks, food, and all other living costs. I would also be practicing twice a day and training under elite level olympic athletes and coaches. 


What I Need

Any donation will help. It's a pretty expensive program that lasts five weeks and I would really appreciate any donation no matter how large or small.
