story:
I am a self-employed dog trainer and last January I was diagnosed with an aggressive uterine cancer. I had surgery, 6 rounds of chemo and 5 weeks of daily radiation treatments. The great news is I'm in remission! The other news is that because my course of treatment was adjusted part way through and extended considerably, my financial resources and my energy have been depleted.

Cancer treatments are the miracle that saved my life, but they have taken a toll on my body, for instance temporarily decreasing blood count and appetite, resulting in extreme fatigue. The drugs take awhile to be eliminated from the body, which adds to the length of recovery time.

Although I grow stronger each day, it will be awhile before I regain my former strength and stamina. What this means is I don't have the strength to stand longer than 5 minutes, for instance, to get the dishes done, take a shower, or walk my dog. Simple tasks take a very long time to complete.

I miss working with the dogs, and am eager to get back to training and teaching. I am so fortunate to have connected with a personal trainer through the Cancer Survivorship program at the Moncrief Cancer Institute as well as a massage therapist, both of whom will become integral members of Team Sarah in helping me get stronger as I heal.

I can see the light at the end of the tunnel, but during this final phase of recovery I'm looking for help with expenses for another couple of months, by which time I plan to be able to work at least part time.

No contribution is too small. Thank you for taking the time to read my story.

With gratitude,

Sarah
story_txt: I am a self-employed dog trainer and last January I was diagnosed with an aggressive uterine cancer. I had surgery, 6 rounds of chemo and 5 weeks of daily radiation treatments. The great news is I'm in remission! The other news is that because my course of treatment was adjusted part way through and extended considerably, my financial resources and my energy have been depleted. Cancer treatments are the miracle that saved my life, but they have taken a toll on my body, for instance temporarily decreasing blood count and appetite, resulting in extreme fatigue. The drugs take awhile to be eliminated from the body, which adds to the length of recovery time. Although I grow stronger each day,  it will be awhile before I regain my former strength and stamina.  What this means is I don't have the strength to stand longer than 5 minutes, for instance, to get the dishes done, take a shower, or walk my dog. Simple tasks take a very long time to complete.I miss working with the dogs, and am eager to get back to training and teaching. I am so fortunate to have connected with a personal trainer through the Cancer Survivorship program at the Moncrief Cancer Institute as well as a massage therapist, both of whom will become integral members of Team Sarah in helping me get stronger as I heal.  I can see the light at the end of the tunnel, but during this final phase of recovery I'm looking for help with expenses for another couple of months, by which time I plan to be able to work at least part time.   No contribution is too small. Thank you for taking the time to read my story.With gratitude,Sarah

story:
Short Summary

Opening scheduled for February 1st, 2016!

Mission 

Northside Center for Emotional Wellness will strive to promote healing for children and families by providing integrative mental health care. By offering individual, group, and family therapy as well as the complementary interventions of yoga and mindfulness.

In my 15 years of working in the field of mental health as a child psychologist, I am struck by the "blank stares" I receive when I ask parents if they are taking care of themselves, or engaging in their own self-care.  When families have a child with mental health needs, their lives often become consumed  by appointments with professionals. They end up spending much of their week sitting in waiting room after waiting room. At home, they may struggle to manage symptoms related to their child's diagnoses such as aggression, tantrums and sleep disturbances which often leave parents with little time or energy to engage in their own self-care. 

Parents can become exhausted and demoralized caring for a child with mental health issues. We want to provide them with a healing/peaceful space where they can care for themselves as well as their child, and hopefully have at least a moment of respite. 

We are hoping to support children and families by providing exceptional individual and family therapy at the clinic. As well as yoga and meditation in the studio that will be attached. We also plan to have biofeedback programs and massage available to parents while their child is in session. We are excited to provide this new model for care in a beautiful and welcoming space in North Minneapolis. Thank you so much for your support so that we in turn, can support children and families.


What We Need

Funds raised will cover the following:
  • Funds to cover the start up costs such as the lease for the first 4-5 months.
  • Build out costs to help create a beautiful space where children and families can come to heal, grow and learn to manage their mental health conditions.
  • Bamboo floors in both the mental health offices and yoga studio.
  • Offices large enough for play therapy and family sessions. 
  • Furniture, toys and computers.
If we exceed our goals (which I hope we do) funds will go toward a progressive and healing experience, so we will need a unique list of supplies such as:
  • Biofeedback software and hardware
  • Weighted blankets
  • Bungee chairs
  • Thera-putty and other sensory equipment

The Impact
Our center will be in an economically and culturally diverse area of Minneapolis with higher than average rates of socioeconomic stressors. Consequently, we want to create a unique space where children and families can seek healing in an environment that will merge traditional therapy with holistic approaches to healing  such as yoga and massage. 


Risks & Challenges

Opening a clinic and yoga studio will be lots of work and the initial costs are quite high, but we are passionate about bringing this innovative clinic to North Minneapolis and we are willing to put in the hard work and take the risk.
  • I have over 15 years of experience working with children and families in the metro area and we will have a therapeutic team rich in experience in treating  autism spectrum disorders, anxiety, depression and other mental health diagnoses.
  • We are learning and being trained more and more about how body-based interventions such as yoga and meditation help decrease anxiety and help individuals manage symptoms of PTSD, so we are very excited to make it available at our center.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo  campaign with others!
Follow the progress on our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/northsideemotionalwell...
We are accepting donations of the following items if you are unable to donate monetarily: 
  • Toys for children 3-14 years of age.
  • Markers, paper, art supplies
  • Bean bag chairs
  • Child-size blankets, we love to use them to wrap children up in blanket cocoons during guided relaxation.
Contact Laurie Schlosser at laurieschlosser7@yahoo.com to get drop off location.

story:
What's our story?

The uOttawa Quidditch Club was created in January 2011 by Clare Hutchinson and Tegan Bridge, and have recently celebrated our 5th birthday. In past years we have been finalists for the Canada cup, won said cup, attended World Cups, and have competed in numerous tournaments. Last year, some of our players won the first Quidditch Canada national championship. This year our club consists of our main team - the Gee Gees (consisting of mostly veterans of our club) - who are currently #1 in Canada - and our development team: Ottawa Maple Rush (consisting of equally talented new/and returning players). Our Gee Gees have won all their games so far but one, and Maple Rush is coming off their first win. At regionals, both teams are looking to continue their winning streaks. With your help you can help us achieve our goal; and. besides, who wouldn't want to help these smiling faces: 

Photo credit to Vanessa Kraus, our fantastic photographer. 

What do we need and why do we need it?

On this page, we are asking for $2000. This will help cover transportation fees and hotel rooms for 2 nights so that our players can focus their energies on becoming better athletes.

This year's perks include: sexy calendar postcards, signed team photos, buttons, and more! SEXY CALENDAR NAMES: Erin McCrady, Alex Illing, Tiffany Croteau, Gabriel Weekes, and Allison Rich. 

The Impact

We know we aren't the only teams travelling to regionals, but we sure show sportsmanship and great athleticism - plus, we have been called the sweetest. In the past, you've helped us successfully reach our goal allowing us to attend events in Florida, Myrtle Beach, and Vancouver. You have shown great generosity over the years which has been much appreciated and continues to be inspiring. We now call upon this generosity again, so we may put all of our hard work (our players practice and train at least 3 times a week, and have some of the greatest determination to improve and win) to the test against our opponents. Our players look forward to representing you and our club at regionals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Go out into the world and proclaim your love and support for the uOttawa Quidditch club!
  • Share this page on your social media pages!
Thank you so much for all your support!/Merci!

story:
If this is your first visit to the GrowGolf campaign site, please consider visiting the following sections:

  • Perks
  • The GrowGolf Story
  • The Team
  • Time Line
  • How the Money is Spent
  • Q & A's

 

Overview

Introducing the world’s first ever truly “SmartGolfBall” that delivers on the promise of “No More Lost Balls”!

The purpose of this campaign is to attract enough seed money to complete the prototype development of GrowGolf's SmartGolfBall, which is the first of several products to be released under its patented DigitalCaddie invention

Your support of this development is the first step in the evolution of the DigitalCaddie.  When all the components of golf are fully implemented, Digital Caddie will enable recreational golfer’s access to the same information routinely available to tour golfers through their Caddy, Ball Spotters* and golf course Marshalls; resulting in a faster, easier to learn and more fun filled game.

 

The GrowGolf Story

Hello, my name is Julius.  Like many of you, learning to play golf was frustrating.  Even more frustrating is the time wasted searching for lost golf balls or experiencing “slow pace of play” because a foursome ahead is searching for lost golf balls.

As an inventor and engineer I thought that we could bring the Internet of Things (IoT*) to the golf industry and solve several problems.  Julius and Carla, two ex-IBM employees who own intellectual property rights for an invention called DigitalCaddie, founded GrowGolf LLC, a startup company to make the invention idea a product reality.  DigitalCaddie’s first featured product planned for release, the SmartGolfBall with associated app will solve the lost ball issue!

 

The short video below describes how GrowGolf's SmartGolfBall will work!

 

Let's take a closer look at the SmartGolfBall.  The SmartGolfBall is a new kind of golf ball; one that connects wirelessly with your smartphone and has a design objective to lead you to within one foot of your golf ball, no matter where it has landed.  

The genius behind The SmartGolfBall is a small microchip that communicates with GPS satellites to relay its location back to your smart phone … the results … “No More Lost Balls!”

 

Our Mission and a Peek into the Future

Our long-term goal, once the DigitalCaddie is fully implemented is to provide the recreational golfer with the same information that a professional golfer routinely has available through his or her Caddy and other support structure.

When all the featured products are released and fully implemented as golf's first IoT* and used by recreational golfers, the DigitalCaddie can reduce the average time for a foursome to play 18 holes to under 3.5 hours.

In addition to using this amazing technology to quickly locate your ball, you will:

  1. play faster and enjoy more time playing, and less time searching;
  2. consult your DigitalCaddie for suggestions on what club to use;
  3. augment your golf lessons with immediate feedback from your DigitalTrainer to make golf easier to learn and more fun to practice!
  4. obtain instant guidance from the built in DigitalMarshall on what rule to use; and yes …
  5. receive putt line suggestions from your DigitalCaddie just like the Pros; and more…

This technology has been proven to work, and we’re working diligently to bring it to you.  

 

Size Matters!

The challenge GrowGolf faces today is that our microchip prototype, the brain of the SmartGolfBall which we call the Intelligent Sub-Core (ISC) is the size of a golf ball and it needs to be the size of a pearl – your financial support is needed.

Our development team needs your help in bringing the SmartGolfBall to market.  There are plenty of perks to select from on this crowdfunding site.  So please make a donation and choose one … it’s our way of saying thanks for your generous support!  

Your donation, regardless of size, will help bring this new IoT* technology to the game of golf.  

Here are three (3) ways You can help:
 
  1. Make a Donation!  Your donation is important  to us and will go a long way to bring this new technology to the golf industry!
  2.  Tell your friends, golfing buddies and any business associates whom you think may be interested in helping to support this worthy cause.
  3. Provide guidance and support to us at GrowGolf.  As a small entrepreneurial start-up business we could use the immense talent "out there".  We welcome you comments, ideas and suggestions!
 

Thanks for your support and … Let’s GrowGolf together!

Best Regards,
Julius,
GrowGolf, Managing Director

_______________________________________________________

A word about Perks

Colors and Sizes

Note that some Perks have options such as color and size associated with them.  For such Perks, once the campaign has ended, we will send you a survey and request that you return it with your color and size preferences at your earliest convenience.  

__________
 

See Pictures of Applicable Current Perks Below

(Note: only pictures are shown here; for details of Perk Offerings see the official list of Perks and Donations in the top-right-most column.) 

 

#3: Golf Cap with GrowGolf Logo            #5: Golf Shirt with GrowGolf Logo

 

                                                    

**********
#4: T - Shirt with GrowGolf Logo on Front and "Let's GrowGolf Together" on Back

 

 

                                   

 

 

**********
Set of four, 9 oz. or 15 oz. Stemless wine Glasses with GrowGolf Logo
#6                                                 #8
                                  

**********

#7: Set of four, 11 oz.  Ceramic Coffee Mugs with GrowGolf Logo

                               

__________
 

Future Perks

Once GrowGolf: 1) receives enough funding to complete the development of the prototype SmartGolfBall; and 2) an adequate quantity of prototype SmartGolfBalls are scheduled for testing; the following additional Perks will be offered if sufficient interest exists, as our way of saying thanks for your generous support and donations.
  •     Invitation to "Beta Test" Prototypes of the first SmartGolfBalls;
  •     Offer of Two (2) DigitalCaddie Lessons;
  •     Opportunity to Play in: First Ever All SmartGolfBall Tournament(s);
 
The data gathered from your participation in these "future" Perk events will help the GrowGolf team: a) resolve any remaining issues with the SmartGolfBall which are uncovered by such Perk events; b) improve the process of using DigitalCaddie to play, practice and learn golf; and c) perfect the software and its interface to the SmartGolfBall.
 
Thus your participation will help smooth the way to the mass production of the First Ever Truly SmartGolfBall!

______________________________________________

 

Challenges and Risks

The practical application of the Internet of Things (IoT*) to the Golf Industry involves both unique challenges and risk.  To minimize the risk GrowGolf has already developed an initial prototype of the Intelligent Sub Core (ISC*; i.e. brains of the SmartGolfBall) and associated software; however the prototype ISC is too large to fit in the core of a golf ball.  The next two steps in the process are: 1) shrink the ISC to about the size of a pearl; and 2) embed the pearl size prototype ISC in the core of a traditional golf ball resulting in the first prototype SmartGolfBall.

In the coming months we will use much of the acquired funding on the tasks in the initial stages of our Timeline (Phase II) described in more detail below, to complete the development of the ISC* (reduced footprint) and its DigitalCaddie software which in turn will enable us to complete the development of the prototype SmartGolfBall.

Phase II shows a challenging set of tasks remaining but we are confident that we can meet the timeline deadlines.  However, unexpected delays can occur due to manufacturing issues, component shortages, contract issues and other unforeseen challenges.  Please be patient.

As soon as GrowGolf can schedule production of the prototype SmartGolfBall in sufficient quantities for testing, GrowGolf will publish the availability of dates for the Future Perks described provided there is adequate interest in each perk.

Note that GrowGolf reserves the right to add, change or remove Perks without advance notice and for any reason.  Some of the reasons may relate to consumer demand, consumer interest and/or may be logistical in nature.

______________________________________________

 

                                The Team

 

_____________________________________________________________________

                                                          

Timeline and Roadmap

________________________________________________  
 

Completed Tasks (Phase I)

________________________________________________  
 
Planned Future Tasks Using Campaign Funds (Phase II)
 
 
 
________________________________________________
 

 

How the Money is Spent

       

_______________________________________________

The "Next Steps" in the SmartGolfBall Development are:

  • step #1: shrink the Intelligent Sub-Core (i.e. ISC* brains of the SmartGolfBall) to the size of a pearl to fit in the core of the SmartGolfBall without affecting its dynamics.
  • step #2: produce the 1st operational SmartGolfBall Prototype with ISC* inside and applicable software;
  • step #3: ramp-up production of the SmartGolfBall Prototype in sufficient quantities for extensive testing. 

The following graphic illustrates the relationship between executing the above steps (Targeted Development) and achieving specific stretch goals (Available Funding):

 

_______________________________________________                                                                                                     Q&A's

Technology

Q:  What is the technology behind the SmartGolfBall? 

A:  The ball incorporates micro electronic circuitry that uses GPS and several communication technologies to track the ball’s exact position at all times and relays that information to the golfer.  

 

Q:  How does the technology affect how the SmartGolfBall feels? 

A:  It does not at all. You can’t tell by looking at it or feeling it that the ball has our technology embedded.

 

Q:  How does the SmartGolfBall play when hit with different clubs? 

A:   It depends on how you hit your clubs. But seriously, we designed it so that there is no effect on how the ball plays.  The only impact is that the golfer will play faster rounds (no more searching for lost balls!). Aside from that, there is no effect on the way a golfer plays.

      

Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall last as long as a regular ball?

A:  Yes.  It will last as long as any other ball in your bag of similar construction.

      

Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall fly as far?

A:   Yes. Distance or other performance characteristics will not be affected.

 

Q:   Will the SmartGolfBall feel the same around the greens?

A:   Yes, putting will be the same. 

      

Q:   Is the SmartGolfBall part of a system or architecture for all components of golf?

A:   Yes, when fully implemented, all of the components of golf will be networked together and collective is one embodiment of the golf information systems architecture (gisA) that provides useful golf information to the golfer; similar to what a professional golfer routinely gets from his Caddy, Spotters, Marshalls and other support structure. The SmartGolfBall is just one of the components.

      

Q:  Is GrowGolf’s DigitalCaddie invention protected with Intellectual Property?

A:  Yes.  GrowGolf has patent rights for the core technologies of the invention as well as pending patent applications. GrowGolf has plans in place to continue to enhance its patent portfolio with additional patent applications.

       

Q:  Will putting be the same?

A:  Yes, putting will be the same.

      

Q:   How is the SmartGolfBall different from other balls?

 

A:  It is sensor enhanced such that its position and other performance characteristics are seamlessly communicated to the golfer via an app on a smartphone.

      

Q:  What happens when it rains?

A:    Nothing, golf is an outdoor sport (unless they blow the horn when there is a risk of lightning). But seriously, the SmartGolfBall’s performance is not affected by rain.

      

Q:  If I wear a pacemaker can I use the SmartGolfBall?

A:   Yes since the product will meet standard consumer product safety requirements; so if you can safely operate a TV, radio or smartphone you are probably OK; however as with any serious health issue, before engaging in a sport one should check with their doctor.

      

Q:  Can Google Glass be used with the SmartGolfBall?

A:   Our architecture will allow for developers to create apps for the Google Glass. 

      

Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall be used in tournament play?

A:  Initially it will not be used in professional tournaments because the ball will not be on the USGA’s approved ball list.  For all other tournament play, if local club and/or tournament rules approve it, then either the ball could be used in tournament play if the app is turned off/disabled or if local rules approve its outright use.  The design point is that all aspects of the ball will conform to USGA rules and we will diligently seek its placement on the approved USGA ball list. 

      

Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall be used in recreational play?

A:  Yes.  In general local golf club rules do not require a ball to be on the USGA approved ball list before it can be used for recreational play.  The SmartGolfBall is designed to adhere to all USGA standards for placement on the approved ball list.  GrowGolf will submit its ball to the USGA's testing procedures and diligently pursue its placement on the approved ball list. 

      

Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall be USGA approved?

A:  As with any newly announced ball, Initially it will not be on the USGA approved ball list [for professional tournaments] because the ball must pass a series of rigid USGA lab tests to be placed on the list; however the design point for the ball is that it will adhere to all aspects of the USGA ball standards and we will diligently seek its placement on the approved USGA ball list. 

      

Q:  How long will the SmartGolfBall last?

A:  It will last as long as any other ball in your bag of similar construction.

      

Q:  Are there batteries?

A:  Yes, there is a rechargeable battery in the ball. It is quickly/easily recharged similar to the way your electric toothbrush is charged when sitting in its holder.

      

Q:  How does the SmartGolfBall impact the way a golfer normally plays?

A:  we designed it so that there is no effect on how the ball plays.

       

Q:  Can I check the SmartGolfBall’s Battery to see if it is functional?

A:  Yes, using your smartphone.

 

Q:  What will happen when the SmartGolfBall’s battery power runs out?

A:  Your Smartphone will “beep” before you tee-off to warn you that you are at about 20% power, at which point the golfer should start to monitor the ball's charge to ensure that he/she has enough power left to finish any hole started!  If the ball loses power altogether and becomes inoperable then the golfer has the option of following USGA rule 5-3: unfit for play rule, which allows the golfer to substitute a new SmartGolfBall without penalty.

      

Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall’s battery be recharged?

A:  Yes.

      

Q:  what is the life span of a the SmartGolfBall's battery (meaning how long before the batter cannot retain charge)?

A:  

      

Q:  What certifications will the SmartGolfBall have?

A:  The design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it will be FCC, UL and CE certified.

      

Q:  Will the ISC continue to operate when the SmartGolfBall goes in the water?

A:   Yes; but the strength of the signal will depend on how deep the water is. 

      

Q:  Will the dynamics of the SmartGolfBall be affected by the new technology?

A:  No.

      

Q:  What are the SmartGolfBall specs?

A:  With regard to it's specs, the design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it will conform to all physical requirements for placement on the USGA's approved golf ball list for professional tournaments. Essentially those requirements are:

  1. General: the material and construction of the ball must not be contrary to the purpose and intent of the Rules.
  2.  Weight: the ball must not weigh more than 1.620 ounces (45.93 gm).
  3. Size: the ball must have a diameter of not less than 1.680 inches (42.67 mm). 
  4. Spherical Symmetry: the ball is designed and manufactured to behave symmetrically.
  5. Initial Velocity: the speed of the ball off the clubface cannot be greater than 250 ft. per sec.  when struck under predefined lab conditions; i.e. ( fixed force at fixed launch angle, etc.).
  6. Overall Distance Standard: the distance the ball travels under predefined lab conditions cannot be greater than 317 yards.

      

Q:  Which Smartphones will be supported?  Operating systems supported?

A:  Plans are to initially make it available on the two major types of Smartphones (Androids and iPhones with applicable operating systems).  We will have more detail when we get close to releasing the SmartGolfBall.

      

Q:  How long will it take to fully charge a SmartGolfBall

A:  As with any battery operated device, the time it takes to fully charge the device will depend on the state of its charge when placed in the charger.  The design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it will sit in the ball holder/charging tray when not in use.  The ball holder/charging tray will hold about a dozen balls and will trickle charge the SmartGolfBalls in the tray; so that whenever a ball is needed it will likely be fully charged.  

The design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it should be fully charged about 12 hours if it was completely discharged at the start; however that will have to be verified when the first prototypes are tested.  The ball holder/charging tray can also be plugged-in for charging the SmartGolfBalls overnight.

      

Q:  What is the Warranty on the SmartGolfBall?

A:  Future Perks #10 (Beta Test first SmartGolfBall), #11 (Lessons on DigitalCaddie) and #12 (SmartGolfBall Tournament for 4) use prototype SmartGolfBalls and by the very nature of being prototypes the balls may not be perfect so a standard warranty is not applicable.  Additionally the above referenced Future Perks are an important part of the process of testing the basic features of the SmartGolfBall and in the execution of the Perks, it is expected that some issues may be uncovered which will in turn lead to an improved product.  However it is our intent to provide prototype balls that will be adequate to perform meaningful tests of the basic features of the SmartGolfBall. 

Once production SmartGolfBalls are made available for purchase, a standard ball warranty will come with the product which essentially will be that GrowGolf will warranty the product to be free of defects in material and workmanship for one year from the date of original retail purchase, except the following:

 

  • Damage caused by accident, misuse, abuse, disassembly, unauthorized modification or neglect.
  • Damage resulting from the performance of repairs by someone not authorized by our company

  • Damage resulting from failure to follow instructions contained in your instruction manual. 

        

Q:  If a SmartGolfBall loses its charge after the tee-off but before holing out on a given hole, what effect will such an “unfit for play” ball have on the golfer's score?

A:   No effect and no penalty to substitute a working SmartGolfBall!  USGA rule 5-3: unfit for play rule applies; which allows substitution of "unfit for play" balls for a working one.

    ____________

 

Features and Benefits

Q:  What is one of the key problems facing golf today?

A:  Pace of play! And the SmartGolfBall will help improve the pace of play.

      

Q:  What is the major cause for the slow pace of play problem?

A:  Several studies have been done, and most experts agree that pace of play is mostly impacted by lost balls (i.e., time wasted looking for lost balls).     

      

Q:  How will the SmartGolfBall help to grow golf?

A:   By improving pace of play, encouraging more people to play (faster rounds). Also with increased course throughput allowing course owners to book more tee times each day (more revenue). Once the architecture is fully 

implemented across all golf components (gisA), this system will help new golfers by being a “DigitalCaddie and DigitalTrainer”.

      

Q:  Why should I buy the SmartGolfBall rather than my usual brand name ball?

A:  We believe that the technology in the ball will not have a noticeable impact on the dynamics of brand name balls in which it is embedded; therefore our goal is to encourage its placement in all brand name balls. Thereby eliminating your dilemma.  However until the use of the embedded technology becomes widespread, if you purchase our balls which do have embedded technology you can improve your pace of play and gain other valuable information about your golf game.

      

Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall be used with existing golf equipment?

A:  Yes.

      

Q:  Does the SmartGolfBall make it easier to play golf at night courses?

A:  Yes because the DigitalCaddie will lead you to the ball, even in night golf course flood lighting.

      

Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall work with GPS based range finders?

A:  Our architecture (gisA) will allow for developers to create apps to interface GPS range finders with the SmartGolfBall.

      

Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall work with Smartphone range finder apps?

A:  Our architecture (gisA) will allow for developers to create apps to interface Smartphone range finder apps with the SmartGolfBall.     

  ____________

 

Logistics

Q:  When will you have a working prototype of the SmartGolfBall? 

A:  Please visit the above Timeline and Roadmap section of this website for information on the SmartGolfBall's development time frame.

      

Q:  When will the prototype SmartGolfBall be available for testing?

A:  Please visit the above Timeline and Roadmap section of this website for information on the SmartGolfBall's development time frame.

      

Q:  When will the first production of the SmartGolfBall be available with the basic self-locating feature and associated app?

A:  The first production SmartGolfBalls will be available after the ball's prototype is: a) available and fully tested; and b) applicable issues with the prototype are satisfactorily resolved.  Please visit the above Timeline and Roadmap section of this website for information on the SmartGolfBall's development time frame.

      

Q:  I usually play with a specific type of ball from a specific manufacturer, when will I be able to find my favorite ball with the SmartGolfBall technology in it?

A:  This question should be directed to the manufacturer of your preferred ball; however GrowGolf will diligently pursue all major ball manufacturers to encourage them to embed our DigitalCaddie Technology in at least a subset of their popular product lines.

  ____________

 

 

Perks

Q:  Can I be a SmartGolfBall beta tester? 

A:  No; currently there is no designated Perk for a beta tester.  However as noted under the Future Perks section of this website, such a perk may be made available if there is sufficient demand and when adequate quantities of prototype balls are earmarked for testing. Should such a Perk become available it will be posted on the website. 

      

Q:  I’m having trouble making a contribution. What should I do? 

A:  Email support@indiegogo.com.  

      

Q:  Can I support anonymously?

A:  Yes, you can! During the checkout process you can adjust how your name and contribution amount is displayed publicly on a campaign page's Funders tab. 

     ____________

Payment

 

Q:   What payment options do I have? 

A:   You can pay via credit card or PayPal. Select a perk and you'll see the available payment methods at checkout.

     

Q:   Can I get a refund? 

A:   Please refer to Indiegogo’s refund policy by:

·         Logging into your Indiegogo account;

·         Finding the confirmation email you received when you made your contribution;

·         Follow the instructions given.

      

Q:   Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or value added tax (VAT)?

A:   You will be responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT that may be applied to your order.  Please check your country's import duties at the time of your perk selection.  It is 0% in the US and varies internationally.

       ____________

 

Shipping

Q:  How will my Perks be shipped?

A:  Amplifier, our third party logistics company, works with all of the major carriers, including  FedEx, UPS, DHL and USPS, and will determine the optimal way to get your GrowGolf Perks to you as soon as possible.

      

Q:  How much is shipping?

A:  Shipping rates vary depending on the size of your order and where it is being sent. 

Outside the US, you will be responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT that may be applied to your order. Please check your country's import duties at the time of your perk selection. It is 0% in the US and varies internationally.  


Q:  When will my Perk ship?

A:  Our mission here at GrowGolf is to ship your order as soon as possible! As long as there are no hiccups along the way, we plan to begin shipping within two weeks after the end of the crowdfunding campaign. If for any reason there are delays, we will inform you via: a) updates on the crowdfunding website; and/or b) emails to the address provided by you.

      

Q:  Will you ship outside the US?

A:  Yes; however specifics as to which countries will be made available at a later date.

     

                                   End of Q&A's

______________________________________________________________
 

                     Glossary of Terms*

Ball Spotters (officially called a Forecaddie in the USGA "Rules of Golf"):  

The USGA “Rules of Golf” states in part that "a Forecaddie is one who is employed by the Committee to indicate to players the position of balls during play"

      ****
DigitalCaddie is a virtual assistant to the golfer and is designed to provide the same information to the recreational golfer during the golf round that is routinely provided to the tour golfer by his "live" Caddy, ball Spotters, course Marshalls and other support structure during tournament play.  Note that the DigitalCaddie is incorporated in an app on his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****
DigitalMarshall is a virtual assistant to the golfer and provides the same information to the recreational golfer during the golf round that is routinely provided to the tour golfer by course Marshalls during tournament play.  Note that the DigitalMarshall is incorporated in an app on his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****
DigitalTrainer is a virtual assistant to the golfer whose purpose is to augment the golf practice and/or training of a recreational golfer in a typical practice or training environment; e.g. at a golf range.  A School (e.g. golf instructor) could also use the DigitalTrainer to augment its training program.  Note that the DigitalTrainer is incorporated in an app on his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****
Golf Information Systems Architecture (gisA) is a set of rules and methods that describe the functionality, design and implementation of the inter-communications (i.e. networking) between the components of golf (golf ball, club, footwear, bag, glove, smartphone or other smart device, etc.) for the purpose of collecting, sharing, analyzing and providing golf data as actionable information to the recreational golfer via his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****
Internet of Things (IoT) refers to the network of physical devices (specifically as it relates to golf components such as golf balls, clubs, footwear, glove, bag, etc. together with smartphones and other smart devices) embedded with electronics, software, sensors, actuators, and network connectivity that enable these objects to collect and exchange data.
      ****
SmartGolfBall (also SmartBall) means a golf ball which embodies a computer on a chip or computing intelligence integrated into any part of the ball. The resultant SmartGolfBall can be networked with other components of golf (i.e. Smart Golf Club, footwear, glove, bag, etc.) for the purpose of collecting, sharing and analyzing and providing golf data as actionable information to the recreational golfer via his/her smartphone or other smart device..  
      ****

USGA (means United States Golf Association) is the United States' national association of golf courses, clubs and facilities and the governing body of golf for the U.S. and Mexico. Together with The R&A (the governing body for Europe), the USGA produces and interprets the Rules of Golf.

      ****

_______________________________________________    

Notes:

*    Check the definition of these terms in the Glossary of Terms above.

**  Check the Challenges and Risk section above.
story_txt:
If this is your first visit to the GrowGolf campaign site, please consider visiting the following sections:
Perks
The GrowGolf Story
The Team
Time Line
How the Money is Spent
Q & A's
 OverviewIntroducing the world’s first ever truly “SmartGolfBall” that delivers on the promise of “No More Lost Balls”!The purpose of this campaign is to attract enough seed money to complete the prototype development of GrowGolf's SmartGolfBall, which is the first of several products to be released under its patented DigitalCaddie inventionYour support of this development is the first step in the evolution of the DigitalCaddie.  When all the components of golf are fully implemented, Digital Caddie will enable recreational golfer’s access to the same information routinely available to tour golfers through their Caddy, Ball Spotters* and golf course Marshalls; resulting in a faster, easier to learn and more fun filled game. The GrowGolf StoryHello, my name is Julius.  Like many of you, learning to play golf was frustrating.  Even more frustrating is the time wasted searching for lost golf balls or experiencing “slow pace of play” because a foursome ahead is searching for lost golf balls.As an inventor and engineer I thought that we could bring the Internet of Things (IoT*) to the golf industry and solve several problems.  Julius and Carla, two ex-IBM employees who own intellectual property rights for an invention called DigitalCaddie, founded GrowGolf LLC, a startup company to make the invention idea a product reality.  DigitalCaddie’s first featured product planned for release, the SmartGolfBall with associated app will solve the lost ball issue!
 
The short video below describes how GrowGolf's SmartGolfBall will work!

 
Let's take a closer look at the SmartGolfBall.  The SmartGolfBall is a new kind of golf ball; one that connects wirelessly with your smartphone and has a design objective to lead you to within one foot of your golf ball, no matter where it has landed.  
The genius behind The SmartGolfBall is a small microchip that communicates with GPS satellites to relay its location back to your smart phone … the results … “No More Lost Balls!” Our Mission and a Peek into the FutureOur long-term goal, once the DigitalCaddie is fully implemented is to provide the recreational golfer with the same information that a professional golfer routinely has available through his or her Caddy and other support structure.When all the featured products are released and fully implemented as golf's first IoT* and used by recreational golfers, the DigitalCaddie can reduce the average time for a foursome to play 18 holes to under 3.5 hours.In addition to using this amazing technology to quickly locate your ball, you will:
play faster and enjoy more time playing, and less time searching;
consult your DigitalCaddie for suggestions on what club to use; 
augment your golf lessons with immediate feedback from your DigitalTrainer to make golf easier to learn and more fun to practice!
obtain instant guidance from the built in DigitalMarshall on what rule to use; and yes … 
receive putt line suggestions from your DigitalCaddie just like the Pros; and more…
This technology has been proven to work, and we’re working diligently to bring it to you.   Size Matters!The challenge GrowGolf faces today is that our microchip prototype, the brain of the SmartGolfBall which we call the Intelligent Sub-Core (ISC) is the size of a golf ball and it needs to be the size of a pearl – your financial support is needed. Our development team needs your help in bringing the SmartGolfBall to market.  There are plenty of perks to select from on this crowdfunding site.  So please make a donation and choose one … it’s our way of saying thanks for your generous support!  Your donation, regardless of size, will help bring this new IoT* technology to the game of golf.  Here are three (3) ways You can help: 

Make a Donation!  Your donation is important  to us and will go a long way to bring this new technology to the golf industry!
 Tell your friends, golfing buddies and any business associates whom you think may be interested in helping to support this worthy cause.
Provide guidance and support to us at GrowGolf.  As a small entrepreneurial start-up business we could use the immense talent "out there".  We welcome you comments, ideas and suggestions!
 Thanks for your support and … Let’s GrowGolf together!Best Regards,Julius,GrowGolf, Managing Director_______________________________________________________
A word about Perks
Colors and Sizes
Note that some Perks have options such as color and size associated with them.  For such Perks, once the campaign has ended, we will send you a survey and request that you return it with your color and size preferences at your earliest convenience.  
__________ See Pictures of Applicable Current Perks Below(Note: only pictures are shown here; for details of Perk Offerings see the official list of Perks and Donations in the top-right-most column.)  #3: Golf Cap with GrowGolf Logo            #5: Golf Shirt with GrowGolf Logo                                                     **********#4: T - Shirt with GrowGolf Logo on Front and "Let's GrowGolf Together" on Back                                       **********Set of four, 9 oz. or 15 oz. Stemless wine Glasses with GrowGolf Logo#6                                                 #8                                  

**********
#7: Set of four, 11 oz.  Ceramic Coffee Mugs with GrowGolf Logo
                               
__________
 
Future Perks
Once GrowGolf: 1) receives enough funding to complete the development of the prototype SmartGolfBall; and 2) an adequate quantity of prototype SmartGolfBalls are scheduled for testing; the following additional Perks will be offered if sufficient interest exists, as our way of saying thanks for your generous support and donations.

    Invitation to "Beta Test" Prototypes of the first SmartGolfBalls;
    Offer of Two (2) DigitalCaddie Lessons;
    Opportunity to Play in: First Ever All SmartGolfBall Tournament(s);

 The data gathered from your participation in these "future" Perk events will help the GrowGolf team: a) resolve any remaining issues with the SmartGolfBall which are uncovered by such Perk events; b) improve the process of using DigitalCaddie to play, practice and learn golf; and c) perfect the software and its interface to the SmartGolfBall. Thus your participation will help smooth the way to the mass production of the First Ever Truly SmartGolfBall!
______________________________________________
 
Challenges and Risks
The practical application of the Internet of Things (IoT*) to the Golf Industry involves both unique challenges and risk.  To minimize the risk GrowGolf has already developed an initial prototype of the Intelligent Sub Core (ISC*; i.e. brains of the SmartGolfBall) and associated software; however the prototype ISC is too large to fit in the core of a golf ball.  The next two steps in the process are: 1) shrink the ISC to about the size of a pearl; and 2) embed the pearl size prototype ISC in the core of a traditional golf ball resulting in the first prototype SmartGolfBall.
In the coming months we will use much of the acquired funding on the tasks in the initial stages of our Timeline (Phase II) described in more detail below, to complete the development of the ISC* (reduced footprint) and its DigitalCaddie software which in turn will enable us to complete the development of the prototype SmartGolfBall.
Phase II shows a challenging set of tasks remaining but we are confident that we can meet the timeline deadlines.  However, unexpected delays can occur due to manufacturing issues, component shortages, contract issues and other unforeseen challenges.  Please be patient.
As soon as GrowGolf can schedule production of the prototype SmartGolfBall in sufficient quantities for testing, GrowGolf will publish the availability of dates for the Future Perks described provided there is adequate interest in each perk.
Note that GrowGolf reserves the right to add, change or remove Perks without advance notice and for any reason.  Some of the reasons may relate to consumer demand, consumer interest and/or may be logistical in nature.
______________________________________________
 
                                The Team

 

_____________________________________________________________________
                                                          

Timeline and Roadmap

The "Next Steps" in the SmartGolfBall Development are:


step #1: shrink the Intelligent Sub-Core (i.e. ISC* brains of the SmartGolfBall) to the size of a pearl to fit in the core of the SmartGolfBall without affecting its dynamics.

step #2: produce the 1st operational SmartGolfBall Prototype with ISC* inside and applicable software;

step #3: ramp-up production of the SmartGolfBall Prototype in sufficient quantities for extensive testing.

_______________________________________________                                                                                                     Q&A's
Technology
Q:  What is the technology behind the SmartGolfBall? 
A:  The ball incorporates micro electronic circuitry that uses GPS and several communication technologies to track the ball’s exact position at all times and relays that information to the golfer.  
 
Q:  How does the technology affect how the SmartGolfBall feels?  
A:  It does not at all. You can’t tell by looking at it or feeling it that the ball has our technology embedded.
 
Q:  How does the SmartGolfBall play when hit with different clubs? 
A:   It depends on how you hit your clubs. But seriously, we designed it so that there is no effect on how the ball plays.  The only impact is that the golfer will play faster rounds (no more searching for lost balls!). Aside from that, there is no effect on the way a golfer plays.
      
Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall last as long as a regular ball?
A:  Yes.  It will last as long as any other ball in your bag of similar construction.       Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall fly as far?
A:   Yes. Distance or other performance characteristics will not be affected.
 
Q:   Will the SmartGolfBall feel the same around the greens?
A:   Yes, putting will be the same. 
      
Q:   Is the SmartGolfBall part of a system or architecture for all components of golf?
A:   Yes, when fully implemented, all of the components of golf will be networked together and collective is one embodiment of the golf information systems architecture (gisA) that provides useful golf information to the golfer; similar to what a professional golfer routinely gets from his Caddy, Spotters, Marshalls and other support structure. The SmartGolfBall is just one of the components.
      
Q:  Is GrowGolf’s DigitalCaddie invention protected with Intellectual Property?
A:  Yes.  GrowGolf has patent rights for the core technologies of the invention as well as pending patent applications. GrowGolf has plans in place to continue to enhance its patent portfolio with additional patent applications.
       
Q:  Will putting be the same?
A:  Yes, putting will be the same.      Q:   How is the SmartGolfBall different from other balls?
 
A:  It is sensor enhanced such that its position and other performance characteristics are seamlessly communicated to the golfer via an app on a smartphone.
      
Q:  What happens when it rains?
A:    Nothing, golf is an outdoor sport (unless they blow the horn when there is a risk of lightning). But seriously, the SmartGolfBall’s performance is not affected by rain.
      
Q:  If I wear a pacemaker can I use the SmartGolfBall?
A:   Yes since the product will meet standard consumer product safety requirements; so if you can safely operate a TV, radio or smartphone you are probably OK; however as with any serious health issue, before engaging in a sport one should check with their doctor.
      
Q:  Can Google Glass be used with the SmartGolfBall?
A:   Our architecture will allow for developers to create apps for the Google Glass. 
      
Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall be used in tournament play?
A:  Initially it will not be used in professional tournaments because the ball will not be on the USGA’s approved ball list.  For all other tournament play, if local club and/or tournament rules approve it, then either the ball could be used in tournament play if the app is turned off/disabled or if local rules approve its outright use.  The design point is that all aspects of the ball will conform to USGA rules and we will diligently seek its placement on the approved USGA ball list. 
      
Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall be used in recreational play?
A:  Yes.  In general local golf club rules do not require a ball to be on the USGA approved ball list before it can be used for recreational play.  The SmartGolfBall is designed to adhere to all USGA standards for placement on the approved ball list.  GrowGolf will submit its ball to the USGA's testing procedures and diligently pursue its placement on the approved ball list. 
      
Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall be USGA approved?
A:  As with any newly announced ball, Initially it will not be on the USGA approved ball list [for professional tournaments] because the ball must pass a series of rigid USGA lab tests to be placed on the list; however the design point for the ball is that it will adhere to all aspects of the USGA ball standards and we will diligently seek its placement on the approved USGA ball list. 
      
Q:  How long will the SmartGolfBall last?
A:  It will last as long as any other ball in your bag of similar construction.
      
Q:  Are there batteries?
A:  Yes, there is a rechargeable battery in the ball. It is quickly/easily recharged similar to the way your electric toothbrush is charged when sitting in its holder.
      
Q:  How does the SmartGolfBall impact the way a golfer normally plays?
A:  we designed it so that there is no effect on how the ball plays.
       
Q:  Can I check the SmartGolfBall’s Battery to see if it is functional?
A:  Yes, using your smartphone.
 
Q:  What will happen when the SmartGolfBall’s battery power runs out?
A:  Your Smartphone will “beep” before you tee-off to warn you that you are at about 20% power, at which point the golfer should start to monitor the ball's charge to ensure that he/she has enough power left to finish any hole started!  If the ball loses power altogether and becomes inoperable then the golfer has the option of following USGA rule 5-3: unfit for play rule, which allows the golfer to substitute a new SmartGolfBall without penalty.
      
Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall’s battery be recharged?
A:  Yes.
      
Q:  what is the life span of a the SmartGolfBall's battery (meaning how long before the batter cannot retain charge)?
A:  
      
Q:  What certifications will the SmartGolfBall have?
A:  The design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it will be FCC, UL and CE certified.
      
Q:  Will the ISC continue to operate when the SmartGolfBall goes in the water?
A:   Yes; but the strength of the signal will depend on how deep the water is. 
      
Q:  Will the dynamics of the SmartGolfBall be affected by the new technology?
A:  No.
      
Q:  What are the SmartGolfBall specs?
A:  With regard to it's specs, the design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it will conform to all physical requirements for placement on the USGA's approved golf ball list for professional tournaments. Essentially those requirements are:


General: the material and construction of the ball must not be contrary to the purpose and intent of the Rules.
 Weight: the ball must not weigh more than 1.620 ounces (45.93 gm).

Size: the ball must have a diameter of not less than 1.680 inches (42.67 mm). 

Spherical Symmetry: the ball is designed and manufactured to behave symmetrically.

Initial Velocity: the speed of the ball off the clubface cannot be greater than 250 ft. per sec.  when struck under predefined lab conditions; i.e. ( fixed force at fixed launch angle, etc.).

Overall Distance Standard: the distance the ball travels under predefined lab conditions cannot be greater than 317 yards.

      
Q:  Which Smartphones will be supported?  Operating systems supported?
A:  Plans are to initially make it available on the two major types of Smartphones (Androids and iPhones with applicable operating systems).  We will have more detail when we get close to releasing the SmartGolfBall.
      
Q:  How long will it take to fully charge a SmartGolfBall
A:  As with any battery operated device, the time it takes to fully charge the device will depend on the state of its charge when placed in the charger.  The design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it will sit in the ball holder/charging tray when not in use.  The ball holder/charging tray will hold about a dozen balls and will trickle charge the SmartGolfBalls in the tray; so that whenever a ball is needed it will likely be fully charged.  
The design point for the SmartGolfBall is that it should be fully charged about 12 hours if it was completely discharged at the start; however that will have to be verified when the first prototypes are tested.  The ball holder/charging tray can also be plugged-in for charging the SmartGolfBalls overnight.
      
Q:  What is the Warranty on the SmartGolfBall?
A:  Future Perks #10 (Beta Test first SmartGolfBall), #11 (Lessons on DigitalCaddie) and #12 (SmartGolfBall Tournament for 4) use prototype SmartGolfBalls and by the very nature of being prototypes the balls may not be perfect so a standard warranty is not applicable.  Additionally the above referenced Future Perks are an important part of the process of testing the basic features of the SmartGolfBall and in the execution of the Perks, it is expected that some issues may be uncovered which will in turn lead to an improved product.  However it is our intent to provide prototype balls that will be adequate to perform meaningful tests of the basic features of the SmartGolfBall. 
Once production SmartGolfBalls are made available for purchase, a standard ball warranty will come with the product which essentially will be that GrowGolf will warranty the product to be free of defects in material and workmanship for one year from the date of original retail purchase, except the following:
 

Damage caused by accident, misuse, abuse, disassembly, unauthorized modification or neglect.
Damage resulting from the performance of repairs by someone not authorized by our company
Damage resulting from failure to follow instructions contained in your instruction manual. 
        Q:  If a SmartGolfBall loses its charge after the tee-off but before holing out on a given hole, what effect will such an “unfit for play” ball have on the golfer's score?
A:   No effect and no penalty to substitute a working SmartGolfBall!  USGA rule 5-3: unfit for play rule applies; which allows substitution of "unfit for play" balls for a working one.
    ____________
 
Features and Benefits

Q:  What is one of the key problems facing golf today?
A:  Pace of play! And the SmartGolfBall will help improve the pace of play.
      
Q:  What is the major cause for the slow pace of play problem?
A:  Several studies have been done, and most experts agree that pace of play is mostly impacted by lost balls (i.e., time wasted looking for lost balls).     
      
Q:  How will the SmartGolfBall help to grow golf?A:   By improving pace of play, encouraging more people to play (faster rounds). Also with increased course throughput allowing course owners to book more tee times each day (more revenue). Once the architecture is fully implemented across all golf components (gisA), this system will help new golfers by being a “DigitalCaddie and DigitalTrainer”.
      
Q:  Why should I buy the SmartGolfBall rather than my usual brand name ball?
A:  We believe that the technology in the ball will not have a noticeable impact on the dynamics of brand name balls in which it is embedded; therefore our goal is to encourage its placement in all brand name balls. Thereby eliminating your dilemma.  However until the use of the embedded technology becomes widespread, if you purchase our balls which do have embedded technology you can improve your pace of play and gain other valuable information about your golf game.
      

Q:  Can the SmartGolfBall be used with existing golf equipment?
A:  Yes.
      
Q:  Does the SmartGolfBall make it easier to play golf at night courses?
A:  Yes because the DigitalCaddie will lead you to the ball, even in night golf course flood lighting.
      
Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall work with GPS based range finders?
A:  Our architecture (gisA) will allow for developers to create apps to interface GPS range finders with the SmartGolfBall.
      
Q:  Will the SmartGolfBall work with Smartphone range finder apps?
A:  Our architecture (gisA) will allow for developers to create apps to interface Smartphone range finder apps with the SmartGolfBall.     
  ____________ Logistics

Q:  When will you have a working prototype of the SmartGolfBall? 
A:  Please visit the above Timeline and Roadmap section of this website for information on the SmartGolfBall's development time frame.
      
Q:  When will the prototype SmartGolfBall be available for testing?
A:  Please visit the above Timeline and Roadmap section of this website for information on the SmartGolfBall's development time frame.
      
Q:  When will the first production of the SmartGolfBall be available with the basic self-locating feature and associated app?
A:  The first production SmartGolfBalls will be available after the ball's prototype is: a) available and fully tested; and b) applicable issues with the prototype are satisfactorily resolved.  Please visit the above Timeline and Roadmap section of this website for information on the SmartGolfBall's development time frame.
      
Q:  I usually play with a specific type of ball from a specific manufacturer, when will I be able to find my favorite ball with the SmartGolfBall technology in it?
A:  This question should be directed to the manufacturer of your preferred ball; however GrowGolf will diligently pursue all major ball manufacturers to encourage them to embed our DigitalCaddie Technology in at least a subset of their popular product lines.
  ____________  
Perks
Q:  Can I be a SmartGolfBall beta tester? 
A:  No; currently there is no designated Perk for a beta tester.  However as noted under the Future Perks section of this website, such a perk may be made available if there is sufficient demand and when adequate quantities of prototype balls are earmarked for testing. Should such a Perk become available it will be posted on the website. 
      
Q:  I’m having trouble making a contribution. What should I do? 
A:  Email support@indiegogo.com.  
      
Q:  Can I support anonymously?
A:  Yes, you can! During the checkout process you can adjust how your name and contribution amount is displayed publicly on a campaign page's Funders tab. 
     ____________
Payment
 
Q:   What payment options do I have?  
A:   You can pay via credit card or PayPal. Select a perk and you'll see the available payment methods at checkout.
     
Q:   Can I get a refund? 
A:   Please refer to Indiegogo’s refund policy by:
·         Logging into your Indiegogo account;
·         Finding the confirmation email you received when you made your contribution;
·         Follow the instructions given.
      
Q:   Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or value added tax (VAT)?
A:   You will be responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT that may be applied to your order.  Please check your country's import duties at the time of your perk selection.  It is 0% in the US and varies internationally.
       ____________ Shipping

Q:  How will my Perks be shipped?
A:  Amplifier, our third party logistics company, works with all of the major carriers, including  FedEx, UPS, DHL and USPS, and will determine the optimal way to get your GrowGolf Perks to you as soon as possible.
      
Q:  How much is shipping?
A:  Shipping rates vary depending on the size of your order and where it is being sent. 
Outside the US, you will be responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT that may be applied to your order. Please check your country's import duties at the time of your perk selection. It is 0% in the US and varies internationally.  
Q:  When will my Perk ship?
A:  Our mission here at GrowGolf is to ship your order as soon as possible! As long as there are no hiccups along the way, we plan to begin shipping within two weeks after the end of the crowdfunding campaign. If for any reason there are delays, we will inform you via: a) updates on the crowdfunding website; and/or b) emails to the address provided by you.      Q:  Will you ship outside the US?
A:  Yes; however specifics as to which countries will be made available at a later date.
     
                                   End of Q&A's

______________________________________________________________
                      Glossary of Terms*

Ball Spotters (officially called a Forecaddie in the USGA "Rules of Golf"):  The USGA “Rules of Golf” states in part that "a Forecaddie is one who is employed by the Committee to indicate to players the position of balls during play"

      ****

DigitalCaddie is a virtual assistant to the golfer and is designed to provide the same information to the recreational golfer during the golf round that is routinely provided to the tour golfer by his "live" Caddy, ball Spotters, course Marshalls and other support structure during tournament play.  Note that the DigitalCaddie is incorporated in an app on his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****

DigitalMarshall is a virtual assistant to the golfer and provides the same information to the recreational golfer during the golf round that is routinely provided to the tour golfer by course Marshalls during tournament play.  Note that the DigitalMarshall is incorporated in an app on his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****

DigitalTrainer is a virtual assistant to the golfer whose purpose is to augment the golf practice and/or training of a recreational golfer in a typical practice or training environment; e.g. at a golf range.  A School (e.g. golf instructor) could also use the DigitalTrainer to augment its training program.  Note that the DigitalTrainer is incorporated in an app on his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****

Golf Information Systems Architecture (gisA) is a set of rules and methods that describe the functionality, design and implementation of the inter-communications (i.e. networking) between the components of golf (golf ball, club, footwear, bag, glove, smartphone or other smart device, etc.) for the purpose of collecting, sharing, analyzing and providing golf data as actionable information to the recreational golfer via his/her smartphone or other smart device.
      ****

Internet of Things (IoT) refers to the network of physical devices (specifically as it relates to golf components such as golf balls, clubs, footwear, glove, bag, etc. together with smartphones and other smart devices) embedded with electronics, software, sensors, actuators, and network connectivity that enable these objects to collect and exchange data.
      ****

SmartGolfBall (also SmartBall) means a golf ball which embodies a computer on a chip or computing intelligence integrated into any part of the ball. The resultant SmartGolfBall can be networked with other components of golf (i.e. Smart Golf Club, footwear, glove, bag, etc.) for the purpose of collecting, sharing and analyzing and providing golf data as actionable information to the recreational golfer via his/her smartphone or other smart device..  

      ****
USGA (means United States Golf Association) is the United States' national association of golf courses, clubs and facilities and the governing body of golf for the U.S. and Mexico. Together with The R&A (the governing body for Europe), the USGA produces and interprets the Rules of Golf.
      ****
_______________________________________________    
Notes:
*    Check the definition of these terms in the Glossary of Terms above.
**  Check the Challenges and Risk section above.

story:
Remove the controller from the equation and interact with technology and the digital space directly. Current technology is inflexible, forcing you to utilize archaic keyboards and controllers to fully realize their capabilities. Now, you can remove that degree of separation between you and your tech to experience your content without delays or barriers.

 

Update: We have teamed up with heavy metal guitarist and composer, Jason Becker, who suffers from ALS for almost 30 years to develop technologies so that other people with physical limitations can live more meaningful, fulfilling lives and have more interaction with other people:

 

The first FREE compatible app of FlexR: RehabFit with its embedded exercise programs is crafted by licensed health professions based upon current clinical evidence and experience.

The difference between FlexR and other movement sensing devices such as the Wii Fit or Xbox Kinect is that FlexR detects muscle contraction/relaxation and strength.

Play smartphone games via your muscle! The first FREE app, RehabFit makes exercising extremely easy and fun. RehabFit delivers workouts designed specifically towards your physique and your goals allowing you to achieve a more balanced physique.

FlexR is able to detect even the slightest muscle activity. Enter a completely new dimension of tech and human interaction. 

 

Unlike gesture control devices like Myo, FlexR is applicable to ALL surface muscles!

Many muscle and joint pains such as neck pain, shoulder pain, low back pain, knee pain are induced by an imbalance or weakness of certain muscle groups. The best long term solution to address these issues is to strengthen weak muscles, relax tight muscles, and improve precise muscle control in day-to-day movement.

You'll have fun exercising with RehabFit knowing that you're actually working out your key muscles.

 

 

 

 

 

  

 

FlexR's API is an open-source platform dedicated to one thing: the intersection of technology and the human body. It allows you to write and develop your own apps, giving you the tools to make an entirely new generation of programs.

 

Port your favorite games, discover new ways to use the hardware, install your own home-brew software -- your ideas and creativity excite us and we want your help to develop the FlexR into a full-spectrum platform.

The applications are endless the potential for new and innovating games and programs is virtually unlimited.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Bluetooth transmission: Low Energy Medical Grade Electromyographic Sensor iOS and Android device compatible Eco-friendly material

Battery life: 10 - 20 hrs. Noise signal from heart beat filtered. Applicable to any surface muscles in neck, shoulders, upper extremities, chest, back, trunk, abdominals, hip, groin, pelvic floor, lower extremities and feet etc. 

Quality assured electronics: No risk for electricity leakage

 

 

 

 

 

As a practicing physical therapist, Ricky Ge has seen numerous patients suffer from neck, shoulder, and back pain. Ricky decided to develop a way for the general population to get fit and help them avoid injuries in a fun and interactive way. Using rehabilitation science, sports medicine, neuroscience and biofeedback theory, Ricky created the FlexR platform and its first application - RehabFit. 

The technology behind FlexR has been used for a while by health and wellness professionals, but hasn’t been accessible to the masses. The machines they use are big, bulky, expensive, and require hours of training to use.

We’ve taken that technology and developed a platform that is portable, affordable, easy to use, and beautifully designed.

 

 

 

 

                                                                                                                                        

 

  • Special thanks to Jennifer Rawlins, PT, DPT, pelvic floor specialist in Bay Area.
  • Special thanks to BreakThrough Physical Therapy where I filmed the video. 
  • Special thanks to those who showed up in the video. 
  • Video directed by Michael Zelig, StartMotion Media

story:
On Sunday May 5th, Nick and Kevin were assaulted in broad daylight for merely walking hand in hand. Nick has a broken nose and Kevin's arm is broken. Kevin's job is transcribing which requires the use of both hands. Nick is a designer and his glasses were taken as evidence. They both have medical bills to pay as well as personal items that need to be replaced. Lets help restore their faith in humanity by helping them out!

 

This is the latest news article related to the attack:

Police have released new video of eight men they're looking to question in connection to a possible bias attack near Madison Square Garden Sunday evening that left two men with a broken nose and a bruised hand. 

The victims were walking arm-in-arm past a McDonald's near Madison Square Garden when a group of men in their 20s allegedly began yelling anti-gay comments, then pushed the victims to the ground and began punching one of them in the face, breaking his nose, authorities said.

The victims, ages 22 and 28, were treated and released from Bellevue Hospital after the 7 p.m. attack on Eighth Avenue.

The older man had a broken nose and the 22-year-old man had a bruised right hand.

The video released Wednesday was taken by a bystander who witnessed the attack. Most of the men captured in the video were wearing Knicks jerseys after Sunday's game. 

Anyone with information about the attack is asked to call Crime Stoppers at (800)-577-TIPS.  

http://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/Anti-Gay-Attack-Knicks-Game-Madison-Square-Garden-Surveillance-Video-206690111.html
