story:
If you live on the shore line more likely than not you have seen the ever smiling face of Kim (Renchy) Hodge. Diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis over 20 years ago, she has been a shining example to all of us on positive attitude and community spirit. Kim is a tireless volunteer for the MS Society and also works with the Guilford Agricultural Society and Fair comity. She does more for her town than most able body citizens.
Her only son Andrew recently enlisted in the marine corps. He is now in Parris Island South Carolina at basic training and will be graduating August 31, 2012. Kim should see her son march with his platoon but because of the overwhelming expenses of travel due to her disability she simply cannot afford the trip. She requires constant care of an aid and special travel accommodation that add up to approximately $4,000 just for a 3 night stay.
A pasta supper will be sponsored by the Guilford VFW to help in rising the founds to give Kim this gift of a lifetime. Please help support not only this pillar of our community but a young man who has given the next eight years of his life to his country and all of us. Kim and her son deserve to be together on this special day.
Pasta Supper Sponsored by VFW of Guilford

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=JPG3BRTAHL8VL&lc=US&item_name=Kim+Hodge&currency_code=USD&bn=PP-DonationsBF%3Abtn_donateCC_LG.gif%3ANonHosted

story:
Six year old Aidan Wright suffered an anoxic brain injury from an accidental drowning in February 2008, just a few days before his 2nd birthday.

As a result, Aidan is completely non-verbal and non-ambulatory, has cortical blindness, and is fed via g-tube. He also requires total care from his parents and nursing staff at home.  
 
Aidan is lucky enough to have most of his medical expenses covered; however, insurance does not pay for a variety of therapies and equipment that would be beneficial for Aidan's long-term progress and care.
 
Aidan’s dad, Russell, works full-time. His mom, Erin, stays home to care for Aidan and his two younger siblings while also operating a small craft business to help contribute to the family’s income.
 
Despite their hard work it is usually only enough to cover their immediate bills and needs with nothing left over to put towards the expensive therapies and equipment they so desperately want to provide for their son.

We are asking for donations to help this family provide their son with the best care and opportunity to make progress in his recovery from this terrible accident. 

Funds raised from this event will go towards various therapies and equipment to help aid in Aidan’s continued progress. Some of these include:
  • hyperbaric oxygen therapy
  • stem cell therapy (umbilical)
  • adaptive equipment and technology
  • visual stimulation equipment
Aidan is an amazing little boy and a true fighter. He’s not the same little boy he once was, but he has a definite strong personality and light about him. He is an inspiration to his parents, family, and many who know him.

The family has a blog (http://www.prayforaidan.com) and Facebook page (http://www.facebook.com/PrayForAidan) where they try to raise Drowning and Water Safety Awareness to prevent other children and families from having to experience what they have gone through and live with every single day.  

Any amount you can contribute would be a huge help, and we ask that you please share this by passing it along to your family and friends, and please always remember to “keep kids safe near water”.

story:
This is the second fight for her life because of cancer.

My mother is the most amazing person I know. She may be amazing but she is weak.

I am trying to raise money so that I can say to her, "Mum, we are going back to Cornwall together".

We aren't the type of family who go out together but we are there for eachother when needed. My mum needs this, I know it.

We used to go to Looe, Cornwall every year growing up, the whole family. My mum would talk about it all year until we left! She is a sun lover. Living in Wales. So you can guess, not happy here.

Obviously, times like they are, we went less often and for less time until finally we just didn't go. We save every year but then things keep happening and we never get to go.

She used to light up talking about Cornwall but now it's just sadness. I don't want mum to think that she will never go again. 

I just need some help.

Even if you can't donate send an email to beth@barelynerdy.com. Send lovely thoughts and sillyiness. I need her to smile again.
story_txt:
This is the second fight for her life because of cancer.
My mother is the most amazing person I know. She may be amazing but she is weak.
I am trying to raise money so that I can say to her, "Mum, we are going back to Cornwall together".
We aren't the type of family who go out together but we are there for eachother when needed. My mum needs this, I know it.
We used to go to Looe, Cornwall every year growing up, the whole family. My mum would talk about it all year until we left! She is a sun lover. Living in Wales. So you can guess, not happy here.
Obviously, times like they are, we went less often and for less time until finally we just didn't go. We save every year but then things keep happening and we never get to go.
She used to light up talking about Cornwall but now it's just sadness. I don't want mum to think that she will never go again. 
I just need some help.
Even if you can't donate send an email to beth@barelynerdy.com. Send lovely thoughts and sillyiness. I need her to smile again.

story:
Why SHAPED?

Women and men have been plagued with numbers measuring their attractiveness as long as numbers have existed. The size of clothing, the weight of the body, height, bust, waist, thigh gap, ect. The truth is these numbers are generalities that work for some and make the rest of us feel unattractive. The SHAPED app will analyze the one true measure of physical beauty, the body's shape. 100 lbs or 300 lbs, there is an attractive shape. 

How it Works

SHAPED uses patent pending technology to scan the body. First the user enters some general data to fine tune the scanning process; a height, sex,and body type is all that's needed. Then the app gets right down to business, just take a picture through the app and let it analyze the shape of your body. Wearing as little clothing as is comfortable and tight fitting clothes improves the accuracy of the scan. Once the app has analyzed the user's shape it will report back by highlighting areas of the picture that fall outside the desired body shape. By using targeted exercises and nutrition the user can shape their body to its full potential!

Where are we now?

 

You can see above that we have a working prototype that we now use in conjunction with a laptop and a basic digital camera or webcam. It can capture an image, it detects the outline of a body, and it does a lot of math attempting to analyze the body shape. Sometimes this prototype gets it right and sometimes it doesn't.

We have spent a lot of time discussing the challenges of capturing a user's body and analyzing it. What happens if the user's arm covers one side of their body? What's the best mathematical model for each body type? The conclusion is that our prototype needs an image processing expert and a smartphone developer to be successful.

Why Indiegogo?

Developing apps is getting easier every day. There are a lot of people developing Tetris clones and fun games of the sort. SHAPED is not your ordinary software, it’s a complex tool. The analysis of the user’s body is very mathematically intensive. Capturing a picture of the user, normalizing it for orientation and size, and presenting the results to the user will require some strong image analysis and manipulation skills. With your support we will hire a specialized app developer and image processing guru.

Our Vision!

SHAPED will be a fantastic app with just its base scanning function. We are hoping the world sees the potential and helps us shape this app to its fullest. With enough money we can bring the SHAPED app to Android as well. Below are some future goals we can achieve when we pass the funding levels required.

GOAL 1 - $30,000

LOCKED

Basic body scanning functions:

    User enters sex, height, age, and body shape/genetics (banana, apple, pear, hourglass). The app scans the body and gives back an image that is shaded to highlight the problem areas.

GOAL 2 - $70,000

LOCKED

Android support and additional app features:

    The user can press on problem areas and view HD Videos (Female or male) with their specific body type working that muscle group, customized nutritional advice, and data can be saved and monitored to track progress or failure. 

    This level of funding will also allow us to bring the app to the Android platform. This is a larger challenge that you might expect due to the diversity of Android devices. There are several different operating system versions and even more different types of cameras with different resolutions. If we reach this goal we will make it happen for our user's!

GOAL 3 - $150,000 

LOCKED

Clothes Scanner and Body Morph: 

    From the very beginning we wanted the app to scan user's clothes like it does for their bodies. We all want to know if our clothes fit right, or if those jeans are enhancing the butt in all the wrong ways... This is the hardest challenge of all, though. There are many different types of fashion and a lot of research needs to be done to mathematically model them in software for the analysis. Get us to the $150k mark and that's just half of what we can do.

   The other half of this goal is the body morph. This will give the user the chance to see a digital rendering of their body in better or worse shape. Want to know what the payoff will be for exercising right? The body morph will show you how you look in prime shape to help motivate your workouts. You can also have a bit of fun seeing how you'd look after a death-by-chocolate binge... Hilarious now, but not if it really happens.

Rewards

We've put together some rewards that we think will help you on your journey to becoming SHAPED!

 

Risks and challenges

Software development isn't an easy process to manage. Many developers have strong egos, and the rate of work is very unpredictable. Fortunately for SHAPED, one of our founders has many years experience developing hardware and software for companies like Hewlett-Packard. We understand the challenges and here's our plan to keep them in check:

What if the developer we select doesn't meet our needs?     It's hard to know if a developer really has the skills they claim until they start working. We will do an extensive interview with candidates asking them for lots of sample work and explanations of that work until we are satisfied that they meet our needs. If the person we choose doesn't meet our expectations, then we will restart the interviews all over again. We are committed to SHAPED and will invest as much time and money as it takes to deliver.

What if we can't get the app into the AppStore?      There are lots of stories out there about apps being censored for silly reasons, but the truth is that Apple has clear rules for what you can and can't do. Part of our developer selection will be compliance with those rules and demonstration of apps that have made it into the app store. If the worst happens and we get thrown out, we will adjust our app to get it back in the store.

We want to hear what's on your mind and how you think SHAPED could be better. Please feel free to contact us with any suggestions or comments.                               

                            "Beauty is the Shape, not the weight."

story:
It has always been just my mom and I. When I was little, I remember asking my mom "Can I have a little brother or sister?", but I guess, in a sense, I liked having her all to myself. Now, though, it would definitely help having a sibling to share this situation with.

My name is Heather. I am the only child of Charlette who, up to about one month ago, was the healthiest person I know. I am talking serious health nut: exercise 5 times a week, eating select food items, taking vitamins, and, even, passing on her health tips to friends and family! Who knew that after a mammogram 5 weeks ago, she’d find out she had a cancerous lump. After the biopsy results came back, she was told that she had Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma, 3.5 cm in diameter. Stage 2 Breast Cancer. After much research, consultation and prayer, she decided to have a double mastectomy with reconstructive plastic surgery following up with chemotherapy and hormonal therapy. Recovery time = up to 4 months. My world seemed to slowly fall apart day by day.

Being so far away from my mom (about 650 miles) puts me in a very vulnerable place. I want so much to be with her during this time (and I will for the surgery), but with having just begun graduate school, starting a new job, and moving to a new state - I struggle every day. I can only do so much for her, and it breaks my heart.

Since 2010, my mother has been affected by the deflated economy. She has been unemployed intermittently and has struggled finding full-time employment regardless of her over 12 years of paralegal experience. Unemployed and being diagnosed with cancer is a bit much to handle. The old adage “when it rains, it pours” started to ring true.

Just like anyone, my mom has bills and with the unemployment benefits at its end, rent, car insurance, groceries, utilities, etc., all still need to be paid. I am all she has. But, hopefully she has you too. I want my mom to spend her recovery time actually recovering, not worrying where to get an extra 5 bucks to keep the lights on. My goal is to help cover her monthly expenses for the entire time she is recovering; nothing more, nothing less.

I need your help:

  1. Monetary donations are more than helpful. Prayers are appreciated as well.
  2. I want this to spread, though, like a wild fire. You can do that by   passing on the link to this campaign on any social media network (Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, etc.) that you use to your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors, the mailman, whomever! See above. OR Email, “Snail” mail, and word of mouth are awesome as well. Anything to get the word out.

 

I know there are many people whom struggle every day with different diseases; however, she is all I have, and I want to do my best by her as she has done for me all these years.  

We can’t change the past, but we can change the future. Pay it forward. Thank you in advance to everyone for your time, love, and support - what it means to me is indescribable.

If you'd like to connect with me feel free to email me at heatherchavonne@gmail.com

Thanks,

Heather.

story:
Update: We will be using HTML 5 to deploy our app so that it can be available for many devices as well as on the web. 

Hello From Mammalfish!

We’re a 15-year digital agency focused on education and fun for families. Based in Brooklyn, NY, we’re also huge supporters of our community, specifically local schools and social action issues.

But, let’s face it, the Healthcare Industry and specifically the Health Insurance Industry, is an extremely difficult world to navigate, especially for families of all types not to mention those with fewer means. So, we’d like to build a FREE APP, available in both English and Spanish, providing critical information about changing healthcare legislation; and, particularly, The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, also known as The Affordable Care Act. For both lower income and those families hovering around the middle class, many life changing options will become available starting in 2014! But, how will any of us know how to take advantage of them? This app will help.

Your contribution helps us build a mobile app that anyone can use with any basic smartphone. Simply by answering a few basic questions, you can gain access to your rights to healthcare, according to the new Affordable Care Act. This app can save you countless dollars in health care costs, adding significantly to your quality of life and the lives of millions of others.

What We Need & What You Get

While costs for mobile apps are more affordable these days, making a great app that works for most smartphones, tackling such a huge endeavor like the Affordable Care Act requires investment. As a small business with big dreams, we need your support.

We plan on dedicating 75% of our fundraising resources to the development of the app itself. Based on the work and research we’ve completed to date, we believe this is the right budget to build the best possible app solving the most difficult problems for families.

Our free app will be a very friendly, practical user experience guiding users to information as quickly and smoothly as possible.  Previously uninsured?  Here are your options.  Pre-existing conditions?  Here are your benefits.  Young families?   Yours.  Small business person struggling to afford healthcare?  Your benefits…and so on.

Further, given the enormous size and complexity of the Affordable Care Act, we plan to commit 15% to research helping the average citizen cut through the intricacies of the bill with our app. Our experts will break down the bill into various scenarios crafted to help everyone with easy to comprehend language. The remaining funds, approximately 10%, will be allocated to maintenance and support of the app after it launches.

In terms of perks, we want to give credit where credit is due.  Our team would love to share the credit for building a free tool for millions of insured and uninsured Americans who struggle to understand the best way to cover themselves and their families.  In this way, we all change our lives for the better – together.

Should we fall short of our goal, we will still complete the project and likely start to peel away at the features of the app we would very much like to include as seen in the graphic below.

 The Impact

Mammalfish is a pioneer in mobile, web and educational technologies. We work as a fearless, caring, dedicated team of professionals who have won as many awards for our work with clients, like CBS, HIT Entertainment, Sesame Street, Pearson Education (to name a few) as we have for our community involvement.  We conduct a tremendous amount of pro bono community work for such non-profit entities as Common, Enterprise Community Partners, Cristo Rey New York and Brooklyn High Schools, Northside Town Hall Community and Cultural Center and Reading Reform Foundation.

We feel very passionately about making sure those individuals who need this new Health Care Act the most, get the information they need in order to take advantage of it – in both English and in Spanish languages.

The Affordable Care Act can change the lives of millions and this app will be one way to make sure it does just that!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, we understand. These are shaky economic times, which is one of the reasons an app such as ours can make such a difference.

We would love any support you can offer, even if it’s simply sharing our story and our mission with your favorite social media websites or emailing someone who you think would find our work important.

We appreciate any little bit of help you can offer and we want to extend our heartfelt gratitude to you for your time and attention.

All our best from the Fishtank, The Mammals.

story:
Note: Check the "Updates" tag for video updates!

Me!

- "Dysautonomia" first became a part of my vocabulary in 2008 when I first got sick. That was senior year of high school. Secondary issues have been vast and troublesome and we're still chasing down an exact primary disorder. (My website is http://www.flutedcupsandampersands.com/ and there's a tab at the top that has a reeeeeeeeeeeally long version of my disease's story. But this campaign is about more than that.)

- Living in Alabama, I haven't always been near people who had the right information or other patients in similar situations. Joining online communities has helped me exponentially. I've come to have several relationships with people in similar (and not so similar) situations to my own. The internet helps bridge the gap between patients who might not otherwise know each other.

- I'm 23. I'm a senior in college and I do note differences between how I view things and how a lot of other e-patients view things. I have a unique perspective at times and I do think that I can contribute to the online health world. I believe that patients should take an active role in their health whenever possible and I believe that healthcare is moving towards a more technological based system. Participatory medicine is important to me.

- I intend to follow in the footsteps of e-patients who have made an impact in the medical community and have helped better the entire system for everyone. Attending this symposium is a huge step towards that. There are reasons why I chose this conference over others. I'm extremely active on Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, through my blog, and through various forums. I try to connect with people whenever possible and this is a chance for me to do that - in person!


If you have any questions at all - please feel free to ask. I'm not going to feel insulted. Almost nothing is off limits. Like...don't ask me what I'm wearing. That's weird, man. If I say "our" anywhere on this campaign, I'm generally talking about my best friend Taylor and myself. She's helping me with this whole thing and is pretty cool.

------------------------------------------------------
What's In It For You?

- Look to the right! All those perks. Perk perk perk. Those could be allllll yours for the small price of...whatever the listed price is for that incentive!

- Don't see anything you want? You don't have to cash in on any of the incentives. You can simply invest. HOWEVER, we are more than willing to work with you to get you what you want, especially if you don't live nearby and want a more long distance friendly perk. There ARE perks listed for people who don't live near Northern Alabama, but there are less than the local perks. As long as it's not gross and creepy, we're game for negotiation. We understand that not everyone needs a tutor or wants to go to an amazing RayTay event with entertainment provided. If you're investing your time to spreading the word or investing your money to help this cause? You are a rockstar and you deserve our consideration and attention.

- Remember: Any of the incentives can be given away as gifts. Have a friend who has a million children but you want her/him to go out to the bar with you one night? Give her/him the gift of a babysitter. (And yes - for things like babysitting and tutoring, credibility and whatnot will all be approved by you beforehand.)

- Was the video interesting at all? Because if this is successful, we plan to give video updates on the whole process that will be mostly like the silly parts of the main pitch video.

------------------------------------------------------------------

The Total Cost: $3,200
I will be transparent and consistent with information regarding how the money is used and I'm willing to answer any questions regarding pecuniary matters. (The final costs after making the video ended up being $200 more than when we first created the video. Sorry for the mix-up!)

- Airfare (roundtrip for 2): $712
- Hotel (2, with AAA discount): $400
- Symposium Ticket (1): $950
- Bus to/from airport (2): $100
- To/from civic center: FREE!
- Postage for perks/food/taxes/extra/safety/if I get hurt or in medical trouble: $450. I can see this being the money that is most questionable, so feel free to contact me via any of the links provided if you'd like to talk about it. :)
- IndieGoGo's various fees + other random fees: a couple hundred more than planned. $340 (It was originally $140.)
(Roughly $3,132 which is how we ended up with $3,200 total)

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

Here's the good news - money isn't the only way to invest! That's one of the things that I love about crowdfunding. Sharing is just as important of an aspect as investing. So please share, share, share. Spreading the word would mean the world to me.

I'm a senior in college and I do note differences between how I view things and how a lot of other e-patients view things. I have a unique perspective at times and I do think that I can contribute to the online health world. I believe that patients should take an active role in their health whenever possible and I believe that healthcare is moving towards a more technological based system. Participatory medicine is important to me.
- I intend to follow in the footsteps of e-patients who have made an impact in the medical community and have helped better the entire system for everyone. Attending this symposium is a huge step towards that. There are reasons why I chose this conference over others. I'm extremely active on Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, through my blog, and through various forums. I try to connect with people whenever possible and this is a chance for me to do that - in person!
If you have any questions at all - please feel free to ask. I'm not going to feel insulted. Almost nothing is off limits. Like...don't ask me what I'm wearing. That's weird, man. If I say "our" anywhere on this campaign, I'm generally talking about my best friend Taylor and myself. She's helping me with this whole thing and is pretty cool.


------------------------------------------------------What's In It For You?
- Look to the right! All those perks. Perk perk perk. Those could be allllll yours for the small price of...whatever the listed price is for that incentive!
- Don't see anything you want? You don't have to cash in on any of the incentives. You can simply invest. HOWEVER, we are more than willing to work with you to get you what you want, especially if you don't live nearby and want a more long distance friendly perk. There ARE perks listed for people who don't live near Northern Alabama, but there are less than the local perks. As long as it's not gross and creepy, we're game for negotiation. We understand that not everyone needs a tutor or wants to go to an amazing RayTay event with entertainment provided. If you're investing your time to spreading the word or investing your money to help this cause? You are a rockstar and you deserve our consideration and attention.
- Remember: Any of the incentives can be given away as gifts. Have a friend who has a million children but you want her/him to go out to the bar with you one night? Give her/him the gift of a babysitter. (And yes - for things like babysitting and tutoring, credibility and whatnot will all be approved by you beforehand.)
- Was the video interesting at all? Because if this is successful, we plan to give video updates on the whole process that will be mostly like the silly parts of the main pitch video.------------------------------------------------------------------
The Total Cost: $3,200I will be transparent and consistent with information regarding how the money is used and I'm willing to answer any questions regarding pecuniary matters. (The final costs after making the video ended up being $200 more than when we first created the video. Sorry for the mix-up!)
- Airfare (roundtrip for 2): $712- Hotel (2, with AAA discount): $400- Symposium Ticket (1): $950- Bus to/from airport (2): $100- To/from civic center: FREE!- Postage for perks/food/taxes/extra/safety/if I get hurt or in medical trouble: $450. I can see this being the money that is most questionable, so feel free to contact me via any of the links provided if you'd like to talk about it. :)- IndieGoGo's various fees + other random fees: a couple hundred more than planned. $340 (It was originally $140.)(Roughly $3,132 which is how we ended up with $3,200 total)-------------------------------------------------------------------


Other Ways You Can Help
Here's the good news - money isn't the only way to invest! That's one of the things that I love about crowdfunding. Sharing is just as important of an aspect as investing. So please share, share, share. Spreading the word would mean the world to me.

story:
Short Summary

Howrah South Point (HSP) is an Indian organisation looking after kids in serious poverty. Many of these kids have also been born with congenital talipes equinovarus (CTEV) or clubfeet. As part of trying to provide these kids a better future, HSP has invited a team to provide operations to kids who would otherwise not have this option. Over 2 weeks, the kids will be given the chance to walk normally, opening up a new future for them. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to provide as many funds as possible to support this trip and provide funds for the ongoing treatment of these children. Funds will be used to purchase the medicines, plaster, dressings and other medical equipment that will be used to look after the kids. And if there's any funds left over, we'll donate all of that to Howrah South Point to help support the ongoing care of these kids (and the other kids they look after). 

What does your money provide:

$10 would be enough to provide the necessary plasters for one of the kids.

$20 would be enough to provide anaesthesia for one of the operations. 

 

So, if you contribute even a small amount, you will be part of changing the life of one of these kids (with accompanying warm inner glow guaranteed).

 

And naturally, there's the opportunity to share in some of the perks to commemmorate your contribution.

$25 or more - this gives you a place on our website honour roll.

$50 or more - as well as the above, we'll send a photo from the trip, giving you a permanent memento of the smile you were a part of.

 $100 or more - as well as both of these, we'll send on something handmade from Howrah South Point. 

 

 

The Impact

These kids face some big hurdles in their lives, coming from a background where $2 a might be a day's pay. Hampered by the shape of their lower limbs, their mobility will always be limited. It can be harder to get an education, and then hard to find work. An operation can change that future.

 

This is the third time this team has been invited back. Over the last 2 trips, we've helped more than 60 kids walk into a different future. We've seen the smiles on their faces when they come back to visit, and heard their stories from school and the sporting fields. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute with money, but if you feel moved to share this page with anyone you know (or just click on the Indiegogo sharing buttons), you'll have done your bit too.

story:
My Trip to the Clinic:

Hi, 

My name is Eliana, and I have been sick for the better part of a decade. 

I was so excited to go to college, but after one year at the University of Iowa, I had to take medical leave. Now I am too weak to see my friends, cook my meals, or walk for any lengthy period of time. I'm certainly too weak to study.

I am trying to raise money for treatment at the Lawlis & Peavy PsychoNeuroPlasticity Center in Dallas.

I am trying to raise money for treatment at the Lawlis & Peavy PsychoNeuroPlasticity Center in Dallas.

story:
Short Summary

The Amazon Health Initiative is a project to deliver basic health care and medication to people of the remote Peruvian Amazon.  The goal is to eventually fund a local clinic staffed by local physicians and nurses for sustainable health care delivery.  

My name is Erin Curtis, MD.  I am originally from Kansas and I am board-certified in Internal Medicine.  I have traveled all over the world practicing medicine in different environments and health care systems.  I traveled to the Peruvian Amazon to volunteer in a remote health clinic.  I immediately fell in love with the people.  Although they have none of our modern conveniences including running water, kitchens, bathrooms, cars, electricity, or cell phones, they are some of the happiest people on earth.  They have an incredible sense of community, a beautiful culture, and welcoming hearts.  Their economy is entirely subsistence in some areas.  Many people of the Amazon do not have access to basic health care.  

I intend to start small by bringing much needed medication, clothing, and basic health care to the people in the more remote areas of the Amazon by boat.  Eventually, I would like to build a self-sufficient clinic to serve the local people. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need money for basic medication including antibiotics, anti-parasite medication, and vitamins because many children have basic nutrients lacking in their diets.  We also need money to fuel the boats, and a salary for the people who will help us as they will have to miss out on their regular jobs to help me.  Many of the children could also benefit from basic supplies such as clothing and learning supplies for school. For this project I will need about $2,000.  Anything raised over this amount will go to funding the clinic.  

In exchange for helping me I will send you a small handmade gift form Peru!

The Impact

Many of the communities of the Peruvian Amazon are impoverished and lack basic human needs.  Your contribution will help create sustainable health care projects for their communities.  Many of these people, especially children, die from diseases that are entirely preventable and treatable such a diarrhea and pneumonia as a result of malnutrition.  Parasites are a universal problem and interfere with child development and ability to learn in school.  Many of the children also lack micronutrients such as calcium and iron leading to numerable health problems.  Malaria, Dengue fever, and Leptospirosis are common to the area. All of these health problems are easily treatable and preventable if they are allowed access to healthcare and medication. 

My long-term plan is to fund the clinic by providing rotations in tropical medicine for medical students and residents.  The clinic will be staffed by local physicians. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate money, I also need medication or clothing.  Even expired medication, especially antibiotics would really help.  Clothing that is small (because the people of the Amazon are not large people) as well as children's clothing would be helpful as well.  Vitamins, especially children's chewable would help fight infectious disease and malnutrition. 

Please use my sharing tools to get the word out.

story:
Brian Henderson Needs a Little Help

Our dad, Brian Henderson, is a wonderful father and all around good guy. He's unfortunately been hospitalized for several weeks due to heart failure and related ailments to other organs. As a result he recently went through a variety of procedures including a quadruple bypass. He's still in the hospital with no discharge date set, but he is on the road to recovery which is great news. 

Meeting his needs

Dad has been unable to work for several weeks, and will be unable to work for several weeks once discharged from the hospital. On top of normal living expenses, he will also have a plethora of medical bills greeting him once he gets home. Our hope is to raise at least enough money to get him through the time he will not be working, and maybe make a small dent in his medical bills.

    What This Would Mean to Him

    For any of you that know our dad you know he would NEVER ask for help, which is why us 5 Henderson sons are setting this up for him. We also know it would be such a relief, and in ultimate aid in his recovery, if some of the financial burden was lifted. 

    For those that can't help financially, we appreciate all support for our dad. He's already received many notes, flowers, calls, and well wishes from people in our lives. It's been a wonderful lift for his spirits, and we say "Keep 'em coming!"

story:
Boxes? Why donate to Boxes?

Orphan Grain Train boxes have sent 2500+ donated shunts to Kyrgyzstan to prevent hydrocephalus in children. Each shunt saves a life! Our Boxes have provided cleaning and building supplies to communities devastated by Hurricane Sandy. The Boxes have given sexually abused and ostracized women in Cameroon a sewing machine to help them earn a living for their families and our Boxes gave shoes to children in Haiti after the earthquake to prevent them from getting infections in their feet.

To many, a box is just a box. But to Orphan Grain Train, a Box can change a life. The Boxes are messengers of Hope.

What Do We Do?

Our mission is elegantly simple: we enable people who have more than they need to share with those in need. We collect unwanted and discarded items, pack them in boxes, and ship them to impoverished areas. We take “trash” and turn it into treasure.

For the destitute, there are two primary categories of donations:

  • Resources to improve the health care and quality of life; e.g., shunts, prosthetics, warm boots, hospital equipment
  • Materials which promote the ability to escape the dependency that poverty induces; e.g., sewing machines, teaching supplies

Along with donations that fit in a box we also accept large hospital equipment. We have shipped donated baby monitors, birthing beds, heart monitors, and hundreds of hospital beds, wheel chairs and many other large items. Our shipments have helped equip several new hospitals in developing countries.

The Maryland Branch of Orphan Grain Train gather donations and store them until a sufficient number of these materials are accumulated. Then a 40-foot container arrives at the warehouse, where it is loaded and then shipped.

Why Are We Asking For Help?

The Maryland Branch of Orphan Grain Train has lost access to our donated warehouse space. We must have access to a warehouse so we can accept donations, sort, pack, and store them and load them into large shipping containers. A typical shipping container that we fill for every shipment holds about as much as you can fit into an average 2-car garage if you filled it from floor to ceiling with no space to spare.

Because our branch of the Orphan Grain Train operates entirely with volunteers our only costs are for the storage and shipping of donated materials. Your donation will help us store a Box containing a sewing machine, which will provide women the skills to make a living; a Box of warm boots for students to attend school; a Box of shunts for children with hydrocephalus; a Box of medical equipment that can serve an impoverished community...  You get the picture!

Who Are We?

The Maryland Branch of Orphan Grain Train is a registered 501c(3) and an all-volunteer organization. Check out our organization's rating on Charity Navigators – we made their top ten list!  And visit our website  for further information about our organization.

story:
To keep up with a more informative timeline for what's going on regarding construction and my immediate environment (bottom of the page will be the most recent info):

Part 1: http://jadegordon.tumblr.com/post/91507233537/blah-blah-blah-usual-poor-and-disabled

Part 2: http://jadegordon.tumblr.com/post/96161462322/p...

The background:

Between disability, unemployment, and no family to help, I'm OUT of options. The last couple of years have been tough, and getting tougher still. I spent almost all of 2013 being sick, and injured, and I'm not in a good place physically. With each passing month bills only get higher while I have less and less ways to do anything for it. I'm full of panic and dread, and don't know what else to do. Nothing is sustainable anymore, moving HAS to happen, and a big move at that. I need to move from Seattle to Portland (Beaverton or Vancouver WA for affordability & quicker access to OHSU for my medical care). Seattle is all so expensive now there is nowhere that we could live within our means, and moving around in the city would waste money, I need a BIG move to somewhere sustainable (and also more accessible for my mobility). There also won't be bus service to my current neighborhood come fall, and it may be similar in other areas of town as well. Nothing, nothing about Seattle is feasible for my *living* anymore. 
Hurdles:

No income, No savings, No co-signers, Nothing left to sell (no cars, no property, no stocks, no jewelry, etc.), Partner self-employed with income at or below poverty level, little to no city services available to us for moving, I will probably need to hire movers or rent a truck and pay friends since I cannot pack or move myself (Moving 2 miles 2 years ago cost more than 5k, and moving to another state could be 10k or more - more recent estimates are less, but it is ~2.5tons according to our last move, I think, and we might save some money if we use pods). So basically, I need to raise even more so I can try to offer a very large deposit of several months rent or more to try to convince anyone to rent to us. We have a good history, no evictions or unpaid rent, and we have possibly two managers who can speak to our good tenant behaviors, but money talks loudest!

Accelerating the issue is that during renovations to the building I live in, we were served an illegal eviction notice and the city forced them to rescind it, but after the 90 day freeze that was put on the owners here, I imagine they will try again. So I have maybe 90 days to come up with enough funding to move. I may have less if construction horrors continue to happen (please read the link above re: flooding, safety issues, etc.). Currently the 90 day hold on eviction issuance ends in early November (extended because they broke rules again).

The constant extra pressures:

Figure out rent for however much longer we're here (Because of the illegal eviction notice we are currently frozen at ~1200, but they are chomping at the bit to raise it to 1700). The sooner I get a large enough sum to move, the less of what I raise gets sucked away to keep paying bills here. Pay the outstanding utilities (also because other than just being overdue to a point where they may be able to legally evict us, it may prevent us from renting somewhere else if we have outstanding utilities): Electric is currently paid, Cable is about 80 and W/S/G is down to about 400, maybe less if they either find the credit that's missing (but if it isn't missing, there might be fraud, then we're still at ~400). (If cable and electric don't stay on, neither of us can do what we do to earn money, they will not shut off the water but it will keep accruing fees every month.).

Below are some photos I've been taking to document the situation.

The worst of the rain damage came from their protection leaving a pipe to drain directly into our apartment.


The sliding door has been like this from the start of construction, they're had it in and out, and right now it's in, but the door itself is loose...

And we're apparently expected to live with the blinds like this until they're done (All the construction was supposed to be 3 weeks, but as I write this we're ending the 8th week...)

Another week when they left for a weekend without setting up rain protection, I put tarps out and fixed it myself, but come Monday they took the tarps and used them for themselves. Without asking.

Because everything is still unfinished and the weather protection is dubious, I can't put the carpet back, I need to be able to see and quickly clean up and incoming leaks.

Already the neighbors drugs are overwhelming my allergies - to a point where I had to see a doctor about my eyes - and when they repainted the hallways they removed the seals on the doors. We have to do this most days in order to NOT be forced to inhale drugs.

The new windows have been like this for weeks now.

Before they did the windows, this was the notice we were given. But then on the morning of the 8th...

This happened while I was in bed - they ripped the window out with the AC in and running, right above my head.

And they left this fire hazard out there for about 4 hot summer days. That's at least 100lbs. of windows leaning up against the not-yet-re-installed door that's loose in it's frame.

Bright and early one morning, oops, they shoved the AC inward while I was in bed...


Today, we're on our own dealing with the rain again because they left things like this.

And here's a thing I discovered last night (9-15-14). In the stairwell on our floor, someone punched holes in the wall (again, downstairs used to look like that, too), and that is human doo doo, from the smell of it. There's no pipes or wires, there's no furniture or whatever, that's somebody who has a grudge.

And finally, the longer it takes to fundraise, the less money I can assemble because we have to keep paying bills out of what's raised and... there's always something and...

Anything you can do, donate here, donate via PayPal, support my Patreon, commission me for art, buy something from me, whatever I can do I have to do it.

continue to happen (please read the link above re: flooding, safety 
issues, etc.). Currently the 90 day hold on eviction issuance ends in early November (extended because they broke rules again).The constant extra pressures: Figure
 out rent for however much longer we're here (Because of the illegal eviction notice we are currently frozen at ~1200, but they are chomping at the bit to raise it to 1700). The sooner I get a large 
enough sum to move, the less of what I raise gets sucked away to keep 
paying bills here. Pay the outstanding utilities (also because 
other than just being overdue to a point where they may be able to legally evict us, it may prevent us from renting somewhere 
else if we have outstanding utilities): Electric is currently paid, 
Cable is about 80 and W/S/G is down to about 400, maybe less if they either find the credit that's missing (but if it isn't missing, there might be fraud, then we're still at ~400). (If cable and electric don't stay on, neither of us can do 
what we do to earn money, they will not shut off the water but it will 
keep accruing fees every month.).Below are some photos I've been taking to document the situation.The worst of the rain damage came from their protection leaving a pipe to drain directly into our apartment.
The sliding door has been like this from the start of construction, they're had it in and out, and right now it's in, but the door itself is loose...And we're apparently expected to live with the blinds like this until they're done (All the construction was supposed to be 3 weeks, but as I write this we're ending the 8th week...)Another week when they left for a weekend without setting up rain protection, I put tarps out and fixed it myself, but come Monday they took the tarps and used them for themselves. Without asking. Because everything is still unfinished and the weather protection is dubious, I can't put the carpet back, I need to be able to see and quickly clean up and incoming leaks.Already the neighbors drugs are overwhelming my allergies - to a point where I had to see a doctor about my eyes - and when they repainted the hallways they removed the seals on the doors. We have to do this most days in order to NOT be forced to inhale drugs.The new windows have been like this for weeks now.Before they did the windows, this was the notice we were given. But then on the morning of the 8th...This happened while I was in bed - they ripped the window out with the AC in and running, right above my head.And they left this fire hazard out there for about 4 hot summer days. That's at least 100lbs. of windows leaning up against the not-yet-re-installed door that's loose in it's frame.Bright and early one morning, oops, they shoved the AC inward while I was in bed...Today, we're on our own dealing with the rain again because they left things like this.And here's a thing I discovered last night (9-15-14). In the stairwell on our floor, someone punched holes in the wall (again, downstairs used to look like that, too), and that is human doo doo, from the smell of it. There's no pipes or wires, there's no furniture or whatever, that's somebody who has a grudge.And finally, the longer it takes to fundraise, 
the less money I can assemble because we have to keep paying bills 
out of what's raised and... there's always something and... Anything you can do, donate here, donate via PayPal, support my Patreon, commission me for art, buy something from me, whatever I can do I have to do it.

story:
The Ultimate Bottle

I present to you the Ultimate Bottle. A new generation of water bottle that can hold three different liquids so you can carry all your favorite drinks without the hassle of carrying multiple containers. The bottle is specifically tailored towards athletes looking to raise their game. Today sports are dominated by superior nutrition, hydration and health.  The Ultimate Bottle allows you to receive the energy you need, the hydration you need and the recovery you need. Each compartment has a 500ml capacity, giving the entire bottle the ability to hold a massive 1.5 liters of fluids. The bottle is made out of high quality polycarbonate plastic which is dishwasher safe and FDA approved.  The possibilities for the bottle are endless: use it for drinks, sports and even snacks- the possibilities are endless!

3D CAD Model of the Bottle in the colors we would like to produce it in. The bottle base will be clear.

Specifications:

• Plastic material: Polycarbonate.

• Rubber material: Silicone Rubber.

• Fluid Capacity: 3 x 500ml- 1.5 liters.

• Diameter: 4.5”.

• Height: 6”.

Uses:

Sports supplements: Water + energy drink + protein shake/energy gel.

Variety of juices or water to share with others.

A necessity for all serious athletes! Get that edge over your opponent in an increasingly competitive world.

Note: The 3D print did not come out perfect and therefore the lid does not screw down completely on the prototype. This is a mechanical error and will not be present in the production standard product.

When does it come in handy?:

• Sports & exercise.

• Hiking.

• Camping.

• At home.

• At work or school.

• Trip or excursion.

• Holiday.

• So many more….

The plastic parts for the bottle will be injected molded. The cost per part is low, but the initial tooling price for the molds is extremely expensive.  Your help will help fund the 3 molds needed for the bottle and then pay for the plastics used in production.  

Story Behind It: I play a lot of sports and am interested in nutrition. I play tennis everyday and take a train there. I would ideally bring water, a gatorade and protein drink, but find it difficult to bring three bottles in my full bag on public transport. This is why I created the Ultimate Bottle. You can carry three drinks on the go without sacrificing excess size. I first came up with sketches and dimensions, then got a 3D CAD model. I now have two prototypes and the bottle is ready for production.

Thanks for your support! Please share this project with your friends and try to help us reach our goal! Even the smallest contribution will help!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Let's make it happen!

We are a group of people who love to work out, so we´re always looking for little things that can help us with that; that´s why we came up with Otomi. Otomi is a brand of sport-related natural products that will help you in your exercise routines.


OTOMI´S WORKOUT RECOVERY WAX


Our rub recovery treatment is a non-sticky wax that athletes can apply to their body which will protect their muscles after workouts to help avoid injuries. Today, over 85% of people who practice sports don´t follow any procedure to protect their body after working out; those who do, struggle to find products than can help them. With this product we want to change that.

Putting beneficial things into your body is wise; Otomi Workout Recovery Wax is one of those things. Once you have finished your exercise routine, apply the non-greasy wax to your body to prevent muscle soreness, cramps, and reduce muscle fatigue thus enhancing your natural recovery process. Apply the wax after every workout and start taking care of yourself in a better way, with better results.

If you have already experienced muscle pain somewhere in your body, applying our wax will help you reduce the pain in a matter of minutes. After that, the ingredients will start working to reduce inflammation and nourish your muscles. The wax is easily absorbed into your body and it will not leave any sticky residue or feel greasy. You will be amazed as you feel it working on your muscles and in no time at all you will be ready for more intense workouts leading to a healthier and stronger you.

Many of our clients also apply the recovery wax before exercise or during hardworking sessions to protect their muscles. What we hear from them is that they feel better during their sessions, especially if they are working out with some muscular or joint pain.


HOW DOES IT WORK?


Nature is full of beneficial substances for your body. We made Otomi Workout Recovery Wax from only natural herbal oil extracts; it doesn´t have any mineral oil extracts. For us, it is important that our products are natural; as a matter of fact, you can eat the wax and nothing bad will happen to you. We don´t use any petroleum-based ingredients.

We only use high-quality ingredients. The beeswax comes from bee farmers, and almost every plant that we use comes from small communities in Mexico. The cold-pressed oils in our products are subtracted from these plants.

We use ginger,mint, honey, beeswax, and grape and avocado seeds among other ingredients in our formula, all of them natural. These ingredients will nourish and relax the body parts you worked out. We also use some natural anesthetic plant extracts that will help reduce the natural pain you feel after an intense workout.

Through your skin, your body takes away what you don´t need. And through the same skin, you can also take in what you do need. Otomi Workout Recovery Wax will fulfill that role and nourish and protect your muscles naturally. Did we mention it smells great?








*We use 100% clarified beeswax to reduce risk of allergies. If you´re allergic to beeswax please discontinue the use of this product and contact your doctor for further information.This product was not tested in animals, we don´t use any GMO ingredients.

We need to raise money to expand the reach of our product and help more individuals. We already sell our wax to  CrossFit fans, runners and athletes locally, but we want to take our products to the next level. Your money is also going to pay for new packaging, as the FDA permits a production equipment upgrade. We support local farmers by buying many of our ingredients from them directly and we want to keep it that way.

If we have success with this founding and get the total amount of money, we´re going to launch the latest product we are working on.

OTOMI´S ENHANCED PATCH



This product is a hydrogel activated essential oil patch that releases an aroma by peeling it from the package.  These patches help your body to improve performance during physical activity or recovery while resting at home. Their ingredients are a blend of natural and pure oils from plants that will improve and assist you before, during and after your workout routine. Let your body take advantage of Mother Nature.

We did not invent aromatherapy. We wanted to improve it for ease of use to improve workout sessions.

We already developed our first two formulas, endurance and recovery and relaxation. These blends are specially designed to use them before or after a workout; you just need to peel the patch off, stick it to your clothes and enjoy the smell of the essential oils working on you.

Whatever kind of exercise you do (e.g., running, lifting, yoga, CrossFit), you can help your body with our products in an easy and natural way. We´re certain that you´ll love what our products can do for you and you will start enjoying your exercise routines even more.

These are our factory samples of the hydrogel patches; we already developed our formulas and a medical facility in Iowa is going to manufacture them.

These are our factory samples of the hydrogel patches; we already developed our formulas and a medical facility in Iowa is going to manufacture them.


                                                      www.Katecho.com

We need your help to become a natural product that sports enthusiasts can rely on to enhance their exercise experience. We want you to enjoy your workout even more. We want to share the feeling we all get when we start to liberate endorphins and push our limits. A lot of people have tried our product; joggers, triathletes, cyclists and, most important, regular people who like to exercise are all falling in love with Otomi.

We came up with this idea a couple of years ago and we got great results. Now we want to share it. We named the brand as Otomi because we wanted to honor the indigenous group in Mexico who follows the tradition of curing with the power of plants, specifically with some of the plants that our wax is made off.

We hope that you like our project and what our products will offer. Your contribution will help us to bring our wonderful products to light. We hope that once you get and use your first Otomi tin, you will continue to utilize our product in your workout routines after feeling sensational results.


Other Ways You Can Help



I If you like us but can´t contribute with money, please make some noise for us on your Twitter or Facebook accounts. Send us a screenshot of your promotional message or let us know that you have helped spread the word about our products (We will take your word for it!) and you will be entered into a raffle where you can win a premium pack of our product once we produce the first batch.


In Spanish

Esperamos que puedas sumarte a nuestro proyecto, queremos que Otomi llegue a muchos deportistas que estamos seguros desean productos naturales, de calidad y que son el complemento perfecto para sus rutinas de ejercicio, súmate a nosotros e invita a tus amigos.

story:
Our Story

My name is Paul Germo. I have a larger than average family. I care about them, I care about their health and I really care about creating healthy products that they can safely use. They are the motivation behind all that I do. 

For a number of years I have been developing natural personal care products for client companies. The problem with most of these corporations is that they are huge and impersonal, and they often include harmful ingredients in their formulas. 

                                                

Knowing that most deodorants are not good for you to use, my team has worked to develop a deodorant that not only eliminates odors, but is actually beneficial to use. And FINALLY, we've cracked the code!

We have created a natural deodorant that actually works and is long lasting. 

Many people who love to use natural and organic products, have told us that they have been unable to find a natural deodorant that really works. Many of the deodorants they have tried over promise and under deliver. 

                                        

                                                                   

Skin meets Nature's™ totally natural deodorant is different. First of all, it works and is long lasting. Secondly, unlike most deodorants it is CHEMICAL FREE!

The formula has been mastered. We have some fanatically loyal customers. The problem is that we need funds to produce this product in larger quantities to keep up with demand. 

A second problem we face is that there are Billion dollar companies who currently manufacture and sell deodorant on a massive level. 

   

These corporations have power. Power to steal a formula like ours and make it their own. They are GOLIATH and we are David. They can easily crush us.

With adequate funding, we will be able to properly guard and protect our intellectual property. We will be able to patent our formula. 

                                                                                          With your help Skin Meets Nature™ will become a thriving business, able to produce enough product to keep you smelling sweet. We will be able to keep the giants off of our door step and out of our kitchen. We will be protected.

                         

Please take a moment to contribute financially, call friends, share on social sites, LIKE us on facebook, order product, ENJOY smelling good!!


How your funds will help us HELP YOU:

We need to raise a minimum of: 

  • $15,000 USD in order to successfully launch this product and business. 
  • $30,000 would get us up and running at a quicker pace. 
  • $75,000 would help us acquire more equipment, which would enable us to sell in more stores.
  • $100,000 would provide local jobs, and we would be able to build relationships with indigenous farmers around the world and ensure that we are Sourcing genuine Fair Trade ingredients.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

If for ANY reason you just can't contribute, it doesn't mean YOU can't help:

  • YOU CAN, get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • There are plenty of Indiegogo share tools PLEASE use them now!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello! My name is Anna and on January 11th, 2015, I will be running my first full marathon in Disney World, Orlando, Florida. While I take on this challenge, a number of brave children will being facing far more difficult and life-altering challenges 16 miles away at the Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children.

This is same hospital mentioned in the posted video by my courageous and inspiring cousin and warrior, Karli Leonard.

Now, I challenge you: to donate. 



Donate whatever you can. No amount is too small to help this hospital continue to provide care, cure and research for these children and their families.

"It’s been more than two decades since Arnold Palmer Hospital first opened its doors. This achievement is possible thanks to the generosity of those who embraced a vision to provide the best medical care to children. Financial support from the community continues to be vital as we strive to meet the needs of children in Central Florida. Arnold Palmer Hospital is a community-owned, not-for-profit hospital that invests all revenue above operating expenses into improving patient care through projects that improve our facilities, upgrade our technology and enhance our staff through training. However, the financial demands are great and traditional sources of support are limited. There has never been a more crucial moment for a philanthropic investment in the life of a child.

A generous gift from you can:

  • Provide leading-edge patient care
  • Purchase life-saving equipment
  • Fund critical expansion efforts"
- See more at: http://www.getinvolvedorlandohealth.com/arnoldpalmerhospital/about-us/#sthash.R6hdjU56.dpuf



You can donate right here on my page                                                                              (ALL money from this 60-day Sept- Nov campaign and the future Nov-January campaign will be donated straight to the hospital regardless of actual donations compared to the donation goal.)

OR

Donate here!



Running has helped improve my life and saved me in many ways. Now, I want to use my passion for running to help raise money to improve the lives of children whose fights, strength and courage far surpass a mere 26.2 miles.

So: 
  • if you want to show you think I can actually run a marathon...
  • if you think cancer sucks... 

PLEASE DONATE or SPREAD THE WORD about my campaign for Arnold Palmer Hospital for Children and for Karli Leonard.

story:
I have recently returned to Brighton to hatch an idea: to deliver freshly juiced wheatgrass and vegetable juice to people’s doorsteps via my bike.

I juice for myself each morning, and am often left wondering at how much more efficient it would be to do it for more people. Many of us do not have the time to make fresh juice in the morning and then clean up after ourselves! And buying a good quality juicer is not cheap.

Therefore it makes sense for one person, or a small team to take the time to do the juicing for many others.

As a bonus I love few things more than riding my bike about town, so this is the perfect excuse to get a good ride in each morning up and down the hills of Brighton, come rain or shine.

I need to raise funds to buy the supplies needed to get the wheatgrass growing and build myself a top quality website that can handle people’s orders for juice.

Most importantly I need the time to put the business together. I want to spend the next 2 months working solidly on building the service every working day. I am aiming get my living costs covered for this period so that I can pour all of my attention and energy into building the service.

Since I began juicing regularly earlier this year, I have found that nothing else comes close to the health effects that juicing brings for me. I want to share that with others!

story:
The BHUMI MAT will improve any practitioners' alignment and posture consistency thanks to specific, low profile visual cues. Additionally, due to cork's amazing natural properties, it will provide you the essential grounding energy (so important!) in our busy daily lives. 

 

 
 

               

 

                                                  ········································

LATY is a brand that creates mindfully designed and timeless products that will last a lifetime without compromising beauty or functionality. The BHUMI MAT will improve any practitioners' alignment and posture consistency thanks to specific, low profile visual cues. Additionally, due to cork's amazing natural properties, it will provide you the essential grounding energy (so important!) in our busy daily lives.

                                                  ········································

We asked advanced yoga instructors what they thought the number one issue was in yoga, they overwhelmingly responded.. alignment! Even in advanced classes where the flow goes fast, instructors notice how challenging consistent and correct alignment can be. That is why LATY collaborated with highly advanced yoga teachers to create designs based on accurate posture and alignment. The result is the BHUMI MAT in three timeless, subtle and attractive designs where key posture reference points are provided. 

                                                  ········································

                                                  ········································

 

                                                  ········································

                 

                                                  ········································

 

 

                                                  ········································

               

 

 

                                                  ········································

                                                  ········································

Hello lovely You,

You are AWESOME! WOW! You've come all the way here! Thank you so much for your interest and support! We've been working super hard to get this amazing cork yoga mat out for you! 

Enjoy your journey of yoga, of life, of love and light!

Yetta

Founder of LATY!

story:
Too much sitting is one of the biggest health crises of our time. Studies show that more than 65 million Americans suffer from back pain. But with longer work hours and more people working from home, most of us are sitting more than ever.

 

The Leband Electric Sit-Stand Desk gives you the freedom to get off your chair and onto your feet, while still getting plenty done. It features a quiet but powerful electric motor, and X-Type slide track technology that can adjust to any height you need. So you can make use of any spot in the house to get more done, comfortably. 

With one-touch electric lifting, you’ll never have to struggle with levers or lift your desk into place. And once you find the sweet spot for your workflow, the Leband will memorize your height settings for the next time you come back. Your sofa. Your kitchen table. The desk in your office. With the Leband’s light and portable design, any surface can become your new workspace. Where you can do what you do best while avoiding neck and back pain from too much awkward sitting.

Work is tough. But creating a great workspace should be easy. The Leband is light, portable, and easy to move, so you can place it on any surface, in any room. From your desk, to the coffee table, to the kitchen counter, it lets you turn any room into an ideal workspace for every family member. 


Already have a standing desk? Compared with the traditional standing desk, the Leband is a desk converter featuring a lightweight compact design without taking up extra floor space. You have the freedom to work where you feel most comfortable, and customize to any height you need.

Think better on your feet? The Leband Electric Sit-Stand Desk can be adjusted to fit any height. Whether you’re standing up firing off emails at your desk. Or polishing your masterpiece at a coffee table. So you can spend less time looking for the sweet spot, and more time in the zone getting your best work done.

Get busy doing great work. Not busy lifting. Bulky, gas powered standing desks are a hassle to lift and can feel outdated. The Leband is electric powered, so it does all the lifting for you. Just press the button, and let it rise to the exact height you need. This desk works almost as hard as you. Almost. 

No more heavy lifting or gas-powered levers to get your desk into place. With one-touch lifting, the Leband does the work for you. 

A low phone battery can quickly kill your workflow. That’s why the Leband features a wireless device charging surface. Just place your phone on the Leband desk, and let it charge while you work. No need for cords and plugs. Did somebody say convenience?

If you’re like us, you probably count on several devices to get the job done. The Leband features a built in USB port for convenient device charging at any time. So you can keep going when it matters most.

Most standing desks are so massive, they take over your entire workspace. The Leband is compact enough to fit anywhere, but wide enough to hold your work essentials. From your laptop and mouse, to your pens, and of course your favorite coffee mug. Everything is right there in arms reach.

Finding the right place to be productive at home can be tough. The Leband Electric Standing desk gets you there with one touch. Once you find the perfect height setting for your workflow, the Leband will memorize it for the next time you come back. So you spend less time fiddling with settings, and more time in the sweet spot doing what you do best.

Sometimes our home offices have visitors. The Leband’s Child Lock function keeps your children and your workplace safe at all times. After three minutes of inactivity, a red light will flash and the Leband will lock into place. So you don’t have to worry about it rising or lowering with children around. Or curious hands getting into your confidential files.

Got a heavy workload? With a 33lbs weight capacity, the Leband is stable and sturdy enough to hold it all. Whether it’s your monitor, a stack of books, or 14 laptops piled on top of each other. Yep… we tried that, too.

Life is unpredictable. That’s why the Leband’s surface is built strong to take the bumps. It features a scratch resistant surface in case of unexpected visitors… even the furry kind. And we also made it super-easy to clean. So sip that coffee and get into the zone, without stressing about the little things. 

Nothing ruins your mood like a tangle of cords. With our integrated cable management system, cord tangles are never a problem. No more sifting through a thousand USB cables to find the right one. Everything is tidy, organized, and right where it should be.

It’s no secret kids love to explore. That’s why the Leband features rounded corners to keep little ones protected. They’re safer than the sharp corners used on most desks, meaning you don’t need to worry about little ones bumping into it while exploring. Our silicone table foot pads also protect your table-tops and other furniture from scratches. So you can relocate the Leband without worrying about scuffing up the table. 

Sometimes long hours of sitting are unavoidable. The Leband lumbar back support keeps your back healthy for the long haul. It features a dual torsion spring design to give you the firmness you need. While still being soft enough that you can relax. And one-key lift makes it a breeze to adjust no matter your height or weight. 

If you take care of your neck and back, they’ll take care of you. The Leband massage sticker helps keep your neck and back muscles loose, relaxed, and ready to go the distance. So you can keep performing at your best, day after day. With 5 different massage modes and 10 unique massage strengths, you can treat your muscles to the care they need. You work hard all day. Your neck and back deserve the best. 

Leband, a leading brand under Xiaomi ecosystem, belongs to OGAWA Group, which is Asia's largest massage equipment company as well as the world’s largest massage appliance production base. We are a team specializing in ergonomic products for over 20 years, and the first listed company in the industry in China. OGAWA group own 8 brands globally including Leband, MEDISANA, FUJI, FUJIMEDIC, and COZZIA. 

With full industry chain capacity of R&D and manufacturing, we stand behind our products and services in confidence with more than 2 million happy users in over 60 countries.

Cooperated with multiple leading partners, we are aimed to be one of the influential brands around the world. We are committed to redefining a scientific and healthy work-life manner and always ready to help you find out the perfect ergonomic product. 

We are proud to develop and launch a series of core creations, such as healthy office series, health physiotherapy series, eye massager series and so on.

We've entered mass production, and guarantee shipping in November.  For orders in US, UK, EU, CA, HK & TW, we will ship the units to local warehouses first, then send out individual packages to backers from local warehouses. Customers in these countries and regions will get tracking number after the units arrive local warehouses. For orders in other countries, you will get the tracking number as soon as we send the package from the factory. Please note that the exact delivery time will vary depending on your shipping address and the local logistics.

We've entered mass production stage as Indiegogo verification. We will finish the first batch of 600 units in the end of October, and start doubling the production capacity from November. We guarantee shipping in November.
