You should also know that I am also enrolled in graduate school - my major is Design Strategy and Innovation.   I start this part time at the beginning of 2015.   Juggling this with the business launch could be a balancing act, but I am not a stranger to being in school and working full time, so I am up for the task.  If homework begins to interfere, I will take off a few semesters while things get going, because this is my priority, although I long for the skills I will learn at the Master's level at the University!  I would like this business venture to be my full time job.  Believe me, I plan to work overtime and weekends to get it done right.  I also will not launch until it is the proper time.

  Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't afford to contribute, if you could please share my campaign with others, that would be amazing!  I really appreciate any little thing that anyone can do to help me.  I would sincerely appreciate your support!
Also, if you can help by sharing my story, please use the Indiegogo share tools and share me on Facebook!

story:
My Story

My name is Melissa Klein. I am 21 years old and I was diagnosed with Mitochondrial Neurogastrointestinal Encephalopathy (MNGIE) in December 2012. MNGIE is an autosomal recessive disorder that has no known cure. It affects the digestive and nervous system, including symptoms such as:

  • hearing loss
  • peripheral neuropathy, leukoencephalopathy (white matter)
  • ptosis
  • dysmotility
  • dysphagia (trouble swallowing)
  • nausea, vomiting
  • diarrhea, bloating, abdominal pain
  • intestinal blockage
  • fatigue
  • malabsorption
  • extreme weight loss
  • muscle weakness, reduced muscle mass

I have developed all of these symptoms, and my quality of life is slowly getting worse. They say MNGIE patients usually pass on in their mid-30's, but I have been told that I won't make it that far.

I have been to NYC to see Dr. Michio Hirano, back in January, to see if he could help me with his clinical trial. However, because I also suffer from diverticulitis, I was considered high risk and ineligible and could not participate. Hirano informed me that there was being more research done in London, and it would more than likely reach the states in a few years, but after contacting Dr. Bax, I feel like this is my last chance, and I need to have this treatment done as soon as I can!

What We Need & What You Get

Research is being done and clinical trials are being held, however funding is scarce. The treatment I am working towards is called erythrocyte encapsulated thymidine phosphorylase (EE-TP) and is designed to "fix the molecular defect behind MNGIE by replacing thymidine phosphorylase, the deficient enzyme, by encapsulating it within the patient's own erythocytes in vitro, and then returning these to the patient."

This treatment is being given compassionately, meaning the patients must provide funding themselves in order to pay for it. Two patients (that I am aware of) have received this treatment, and have both experienced amazing results. The cost of EE-TP would be about $6,100 a month, and this campaign is meant for one month and the travel costs for my husband and I.

When you donate, not only are you doing me a huge favor, but you are saving my life. I don't have much, but I would love to say thanks by providing a few perks that are all unique and very personal. If I could pay each and every one of you back, I would do that and more.

All custom perks will be discussed via email, since that's the easiest way to contact me.

Please email me at melissa.klein3@gmail.com

The Impact

If I were to reach my goal, I would be able to travel to London with my husband, meet Dr. Bridget Bax, and be able to undergo the EE-TP treatment that could slow down the progression of my disease and prolong my lifespan.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know my goal is high, and I know that with today's economy, not everyone can donate to a cause like mine. And even though every dollar helps, it would also help me immensely if you spread the word! Some ways you could help me by only spending a minute or two of your time are:

  • Share Share Share! Share my cause with everyone you know! Use indiegogo's share buttons!
  • Help me spread awareness!! MNGIE is a very rare mitochondrial disease. Educate yourself and your friends and family, and get as involved in as many events as you can.
  • Visit my blog and Facebook page for more information. Share those pages, too!
story_txt:
My Story
My name is Melissa Klein. I am 21 years old and I was diagnosed with Mitochondrial Neurogastrointestinal Encephalopathy (MNGIE) in December 2012. MNGIE is an autosomal recessive disorder that has no known cure. It affects the digestive and nervous system, including symptoms such as:


hearing loss
peripheral neuropathy, leukoencephalopathy (white matter)
ptosis
dysmotility
dysphagia (trouble swallowing)
nausea, vomiting
diarrhea, bloating, abdominal pain
intestinal blockage
fatigue
malabsorption
extreme weight loss
muscle weakness, reduced muscle mass

I have developed all of these symptoms, and my quality of life is slowly getting worse. They say MNGIE patients usually pass on in their mid-30's, but I have been told that I won't make it that far.
I have been to NYC to see Dr. Michio Hirano, back in January, to see if he could help me with his clinical trial. However, because I also suffer from diverticulitis, I was considered high risk and ineligible and could not participate. Hirano informed me that there was being more research done in London, and it would more than likely reach the states in a few years, but after contacting Dr. Bax, I feel like this is my last chance, and I need to have this treatment done as soon as I can!



What We Need & What You Get
Research is being done and clinical trials are being held, however funding is scarce. The treatment I am working towards is called erythrocyte encapsulated thymidine phosphorylase (EE-TP) and is designed to "fix the molecular defect behind MNGIE by replacing thymidine phosphorylase, the deficient enzyme, by encapsulating it within the patient's own erythocytes in vitro, and then returning these to the patient."
This treatment is being given compassionately, meaning the patients must provide funding themselves in order to pay for it. Two patients (that I am aware of) have received this treatment, and have both experienced amazing results. The cost of EE-TP would be about $6,100 a month, and this campaign is meant for one month and the travel costs for my husband and I.
When you donate, not only are you doing me a huge favor, but you are saving my life. I don't have much, but I would love to say thanks by providing a few perks that are all unique and very personal. If I could pay each and every one of you back, I would do that and more.

All custom perks will be discussed via email, since that's the easiest way to contact me.
Please email me at melissa.klein3@gmail.com


The Impact
If I were to reach my goal, I would be able to travel to London with my husband, meet Dr. Bridget Bax, and be able to undergo the EE-TP treatment that could slow down the progression of my disease and prolong my lifespan.


Other Ways You Can Help
I know my goal is high, and I know that with today's economy, not everyone can donate to a cause like mine. And even though every dollar helps, it would also help me immensely if you spread the word! Some ways you could help me by only spending a minute or two of your time are:


Share Share Share! Share my cause with everyone you know! Use indiegogo's share buttons!
Help me spread awareness!! MNGIE is a very rare mitochondrial disease. Educate yourself and your friends and family, and get as involved in as many events as you can.
Visit my blog and Facebook page for more information. Share those pages, too!

story:
Get Fit for Life!

I have helped my clients achieve life-changing results through concise, efficient workouts using two moderately-sized dumbbells and minimal rest. My philosophy is that fitness is a lifelong pursuit, measured not in weeks or months but in years and decades.The core principle behind my approach is that it is sustainable and can be utilized for a lifetime.

STAB Fitness (Strength Training Agility Builder) www.stabfitness.com is focused on lifelong fitness.  We have a growing online library of full-body circuit training videos that require minimal equipment, minimal space, and no more than 25 minutes per workout. The program is modeled after what I have used successfully for years in my personal training practice. These workouts can be done anywhere: in your home, in a hotel room, or in the gym. STAB Fitness is your personal trainer, available worldwide 24 hours a day / 365 days a year.

Getting and staying fit is not just about exercise.  STAB Kitchen has a growing repository of healthy, easy recipes--breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks--to help clear away any obstacles to a healthy diet.

Add to all this STABlog, my personal advice column.  In STABlog I share my ideas about overall fitness, how to lose weight, and how to get and stay on track.  My weekly STABlog posts help keep you motivated and working towards your fitness goals.

We have built STAB Fitness from the ground up with minimal investment to make the STAB approach available to everyone at minimal cost: only $10/month or $100/year. The site currently has 24 workouts across three levels of difficulty.

The funds raised in this campaign will be used to expand our marketing efforts to reach a worldwide audience.  Additionally, we plan to improve the online experience of STAB Fitness users through improved video quality and expanded site features. 

Where Your Contribution Goes

About two-thirds of the funds we raise through our Indiegogo campaign will be used for marketing.  The other third will be used to improve the overall user experience.

Marketing  STAB Fitness' marketing efforts will be focused on driving more users to our site.  In addition to expanding our Search Engine Optimization efforts, we will primarily employ online tools such as Google adwords, Facebook ads, Twitter, and targeted email campaigns. We will also develop a press kit and issue press releases. We will reinvest the increased revenue we realize by continuing these efforts and also by acquiring PR support to help us expand into additional media channels including infomercials, radio spots, and television segments.

User Experience  Initial new features on our to-do list include adding a progress tracking capability and a search function to the site. Our plan is to engage our user community's input and feedback to identify and implement additional new features and improvements to the site.

What You Get for Contributing

We are offering six perks for contributors to our Indiegogo campaign. Each perk certificate will be delivered via email within 24 hours of confirmation of funds receipt.
  • Condor - A three-year premium STAB Fitness membership ($300 value) giving you access to all of our workouts and all of our healthy recipes.  
  • Hawk - A two-year premium STAB Fitness membership ($200 value) giving you access to all of our workouts and all of our healthy recipes.  
  • Falcon - A one-year premium STAB Fitness membership ($100 value) giving you access to all of our workouts and all of our healthy recipes.  
  • Raven - A six-month premium STAB Fitness membership ($60 value) giving you access to all of our workouts and all of our healthy recipes. 
  • Owl - A one-month premium STAB Fitness membership ($10 value) giving you access to all of our workouts and all of our healthy recipes.  

The Impact

Everyone aspires to a live a healthier life.  Almost no one can achieve this goal by themselves. STAB Fitness' mission is to provide the affordable tools to anyone with internet access that is looking for some help getting and staying healthy...for the long haul.

Again, it is not our goal to give you six-pack abs (although you may get them in the process). Our goal is to building strength, stamina and general good health to be vibrant through all phases of your life, from your thirties through your eighties.  Our workouts will challenge your full body...including your heart.  Our healthy recipes will help you maintain a healthy weight through healthy eating.  Our weekly blog posts will motivate you to stay on-track.

Please take five minutes to check out our site at www.stabfitness.com and you will see that we have already built a powerful platform.  With your help we will take it to the next level.

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you already have your fitness regimen under control or now is simply not a good time for you to make a contribution.  Here are some other ways you can help us:

  • Tell your friends about our campaign.  Simply send them this link: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/we-re-not-selling-six-pack-abs/x/5094759 or have them go to www.indiegogo.com and search for "stabfitness". 
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools below to inform your Facebook friends and Twitter followers about the campaign.

story: The Qi2Healing Project is a web site driven effort to create a single global source for the healing arts.  For the purposes of this site we are including a wide array of talented professionals to create profiles and submit videos and articles.  From the public standpoint, they will be able to search for the type of help they need by name, modality or location. A vast video library will be completed to upload a wide variety of subject matter. We are making a home for both the Healers and those seeking help around the world.

story: Hi, I am Frederic Paul Smith,            ever since I was a child I always wondered how many Americans or any one that I ask would give me one dollar ?and here thirty years later we have the internet so I thought what the hell I will find out just how many people would just give me one dollar, after all the Clintons went on public display saying that they where living in poverty now that Bills presidency was over! what! they did not tell every one was that they had fifty million dollars in their account and that was what they called poverty! Well that tells me where all the greedy people would flock to, my god how much money do you need to live on?? well lucky enough the famous people came and bailed the Clintons out of their poverty and put them back into the hundreds of millions instead of their measly fifty million. it is really kinda funny because if you stop and thank about this just how much money do you need when you die? Shit I am happy to live from day to day and have friends like you and family that cares for me and worries about me and not my money, I grew up with the need of guilty needs of cash but it was never really a big thing to me, material things in life is just that! material, you can not take it with you, and it really don't make you happy, life its self can make you a happy person and the things you see and do makes it a happy life, The GOVERNMENT says they have been fighting poverty for fifty years but what they don't say is that the money we all have given and all the money they have taken from us, was used for every thing but the true reason they took it! we as Americans give over 1 BILLION dollars a month to the government through taxes and other taxes , now forgive me but did we not come here to get away from some one taking more then their share? Well any way I was just wondering how many Americans or anyone that reads this would give me a Dollar? we as Americans can help out thousands if not millions of family s and people that are living in poverty and a lot of family s don't need millions of dollars to get out of poverty they just need a boost ! so what do you say America can I have just one dollar? we lose or through away one dollar every day, so I was wanting you to give it to me and I will promise to put it to good use, thank you for reading this, have a beautiful day every  day, and god bless all my friends and family. and please follow me on you tube , ," Fred Smith, 603 Robin Ln Apt B7 , Livingston Mt. 59047 ."  Thank you.

story:
On what should have been a fun and joyful day, Rachelle Friedman Chapman was playfully pushed into a pool,by one of her friends. Since that day she has been a quadriplegic and has gone through therapy and is trying to retain the life she once had. She did an IAMA on reddit and I am setting this up to help her and her husband with some of their needs and wants.  She expressed that she would like an iPad and some exercise equipment.  Let's help a great person out.  http://rachellefriedman.com/

http://www.facebook.com/rachelleandchris?fref=ts

https://twitter.com/FollowRachelle

story:
Our Story

Our dear friend Calixto desperately needs back surgery he can't afford. For those of you who know Calixto, you know how selfless, warm, and generous he is. Most of you know that he has been having trouble with his back for several years, but has continued to work through intense pain.  He has been to different doctors in Santa Cruz and was told he needed surgery.  It is my understanding that he was put on the list for surgery three years ago and he is still waiting.  Unfortunately he is out of time and it takes forever to get care if you are only able to use the public (caja) system. 

 
Calixto has been taken by ambulance to the hospital on four occasions. He returns to La Buena Vida and continues to work and attempts things he shouldn't for residents and guests.  His work ethic and his desire to do his job is so strong.  He has continued to do his normal daily duties but he is in pain.  He's worried about his job....one that he wants to do, but frustratingly can't without injuring himself further or living with a lot of pain.   
 
His good friend Barbara took it upon herself to get an appointment with a private doctor in San Jose and accompanied Calixto for the initial appointment so she could know first hand the extent of his problem. He had an MRI and the neurosurgeon determined that he had a problem with a hernia between L4 and L5.
 
Calixto seldom is gone on his day off and doesn't take his vacation because he would rather work.  Renters come in and they all love him.  He takes good care of their needs and earns their respect.  Some of them have already voluntarily made generous offers of money to help.  I don't think I have to tell you how valuable he is to La Buena Vida and what a unique individual he is.   


The Impact

The doctor said he is in good health and his prognosis is very very good, but it is very serious and without surgery it will only get worse and could lead to paralysis or permanent nerve damage. The doctor can do microsurgery to perfectly correct his problem. Calixto will be up and walking the next day and back to work within two weeks doing his normal light every day duties. For the most part he will be back at in within two weeks. Going private the doctor can schedule the surgery for next Friday, February, Feb 24th.  Barbara is here through March 2nd and can look out for him. 


What We Need & What You Get

The surgery cost including everything will be $8,500 to $9,000.  That's the hospital cost, the surgeon, anesthesiologist, nurses, etc.  Plus hotel costs at $36 per night (includes breakfast and taxes) and some other meals and taxis.  In exchange for your generosity we can offer local portrait shoots, but if anyone has any products or services they could donate as incentives, that would be great!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please please please pass this along to anyone who knows and loves Calixto and might be able to help. And if anyone has any perks they would like to donate to contributors, please let me know and I can add them here.

story:
Live Light! Cookbook & Lifestyle Guide- Recipes to feed your body, mind & soul. [Gluten Free Dairy Free Soy Free & Vegetarian] is my upcoming cookbook and lifestyle guide. Live Light stands for Living Light and being "Free" of gluten ,dairy and soy while also being vegetarian and eating clean, healthy, light foods. I have already started by altering and creating recipes to suit this lifestyle. 

My current cookbook/ebook/Kindle book "Simply Gluten Dairy Free Baking: Plus, How to eliminate both from your diet in 3 easy steps." has been a complete hit (as well as the soy free edition) and I am looking to expand on it and create a cookbook featuring recipes that qualify under all categories: Appetizers, Snacks, Entrees, Desserts and Non-Alcoholic Beverages. (Not just desserts.)

Note: Not only will they be free of gluten, dairy, soy and meat- they will also be healthy, nutritious and good for you too. There will also be low sugar, low sodium options, and all will be preferably low glycemic. Some will even be free of nuts and/or eggs. And the book will feature a guide on how to eliminate them from your diet, similar to the one in my baking cookbook.

There will also be a full healthy living lifestyle guide.

My philosophy is that you should never be deprived of the foods you love, simply because you have an allergy, sensitivity or specified or preferred way of life. You should be able to enjoy everything you love. And you should be able to eat healthy, light foods that are good for your body, mind & soul.

The funding will allow me to:

1. Cover the costs of ingredients to create these recipes (they are very expensive, because GF/DF/SF food is significantly more expensive than there conventional counterparts)

If each recipe costs me roughly $20 to make (and it only takes me one time to make it successfully) then I will need a minimum of over $6,000. Keep in mind it took me 8 loaves of bread before I made the successful loaf. It cost me roughly $80+ to make the bread recipe.

2. Cover the cost of the time it will take me to make this- over the next year. (Probably less than 1 year)

3. Allow me the ability to hire someone to edit, proof read and also create cover art for the cookbook. - As a photographer, I do all of the photography for the cookbook, which saves costs.

 4. It will also cover the costs of self-publishing to get you your copies of the book. And it will cover the cost of getting the book successfully published by a publisher.

5. It will also help me turn all of this Gluten Dairy Free Vegetarian goodness into a website featuring many of these delicious recipes and more. (Something else I might have to hire someone for.)

Why did I choose flexible funding?

I chose flexible funding so I can use the funds that come in to make recipes and even if I don't meet my goal, I will still be able to use the funds donated to create as much as I can with what I raised. Plus, I will still be able to send you the copies of your books that you get.

How many recipes am I hoping to make?

Good question! My goal is 300 or more- (that is why it is going to take so long.) But I know I will finish it because I already completed 2 books already and one of them is the cookbook I mentioned above. The other is a book called "The Little Book of Manifesting" (Learn how to create the life you want and deserve.)- Which is also currently a big hit.

Follow the new blog!! http://livelightbook.blogspot.com Support us today and let's make this happen!!

Like us on Facebook! http://www.facebook.com/pages/Live-Light-Cookbook-Lifestyle-Guide/437841436245307

Follow us on Twitter! http://twitter.com/livelightbook

(Not just desserts.)
Note: Not only will they be free of gluten, dairy, soy and meat- they will also be healthy, nutritious and good for you too. There will also be low sugar, low sodium options, and all will be preferably low glycemic. Some will even be free of nuts and/or eggs. And the book will feature a guide on how to eliminate them from your diet, similar to the one in my baking cookbook.
There will also be a full healthy living lifestyle guide.
My philosophy is that you should never be deprived of the foods you love, simply because you have an allergy, sensitivity or specified or preferred way of life. You should be able to enjoy everything you love. And you should be able to eat healthy, light foods that are good for your body, mind & soul.
The funding will allow me to:
1. Cover the costs of ingredients to create these recipes (they are very expensive, because GF/DF/SF food is significantly more expensive than there conventional counterparts)
If each recipe costs me roughly $20 to make (and it only takes me one time to make it successfully) then I will need a minimum of over $6,000. Keep in mind it took me 8 loaves of bread before I made the successful loaf. It cost me roughly $80+ to make the bread recipe.
2. Cover the cost of the time it will take me to make this- over the next year. (Probably less than 1 year)
3. Allow me the ability to hire someone to edit, proof read and also create cover art for the cookbook. - As a photographer, I do all of the photography for the cookbook, which saves costs.
 4. It will also cover the costs of self-publishing to get you your copies of the book. And it will cover the cost of getting the book successfully published by a publisher.
5. It will also help me turn all of this Gluten Dairy Free Vegetarian goodness into a website featuring many of these delicious recipes and more. (Something else I might have to hire someone for.)
Why did I choose flexible funding?
I chose flexible funding so I can use the funds that come in to make recipes and even if I don't meet my goal, I will still be able to use the funds donated to create as much as I can with what I raised. Plus, I will still be able to send you the copies of your books that you get.
How many recipes am I hoping to make?
Good question! My goal is 300 or more- (that is why it is going to take so long.) But I know I will finish it because I already completed 2 books already and one of them is the cookbook I mentioned above. The other is a book called "The Little Book of Manifesting" (Learn how to create the life you want and deserve.)- Which is also currently a big hit.
Follow the new blog!! http://livelightbook.blogspot.com Support us today and let's make this happen!!
Like us on Facebook! http://www.facebook.com/pages/Live-Light-Cookbook-Lifestyle-Guide/437841436245307
Follow us on Twitter! http://twitter.com/livelightbook

story:
Short Summary

By helping Socrates we'll be able to help him focus on his health and leave all his other worries on the side,He went in the hospital for a hernia operation and things turned for the worst because of his lungs being weak , he had to be put on a respirator.

 

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Hello my name is Emily and Socrates is my father I love him with all my heart,he spends his time trying to make his family comfortable ,we didn't grow up with money and we also never asked for help or handouts.

This mission is important for me cause this will relieve the stress he has on himself just to make sure everything is well in his home. 

He's been a good dad to me and my 2 brothers and 1 sister and if I was able to help him I would so I'am asking for help from stranger that care to help someone that deserves it.

story:
Dear Friends,

My name is Daniela Anderson. I spent 4 months at the Naini Leprosy Hospital in India, volunteering and learning about infectious disease as part of a Watson fellowship. I blogged throughout about my experience there, see: http://tracingleprosy.wordpress.com/2012/12/30/sumit/

Sumit is the little 8-yr old who came to the hospital in critical condition, but got better with medicine, music, and art. In the 4 months I spent with Sumit in the hospital, he became one of the most important people in the world to me. He was discharged shortly before I left India. Sadly his disease has now relapsed and he was recently readmitted. He could not stay for the course of his treatment because he can’t pay the medical bills, so he returned to his village.

It is critical that he gets the medical attention he needs. I am asking for your support to help meet Sumit's needed care. His daily hospital costs are only about 500 rupees ($10) a day, and he stays one month at a time, about 6X a year. We are targeting $3,500 US, since this should cover him for the next several years. Of course, more money will ensure care for even more years! If you would like to help Sumit, please donate now so we can reach our target. Every donation no matter how big or small will help us reach Sumit in an enduring way.

Sumit, as you can see in pictures from earlier posts, is a very special person in my life. I want him to have a chance and this is a real way to give him that chance.

Thank you very much,

Daniela

story:
Lucas is an identical twin born 1/4/2012. My sweet boy was born with torticollis and despite starting physical therapy as soon I could and re-positioning, he developed positional head deformity.
 
His medical "staff" have from the get-go wanted him to be placed in a cranial band (helmet). After FINALLY getting an approval from insurance to pay for the actual band, I have found myself in a new dilemma. The financials to pay for transportation. 
 
My own health has made me unable to work outside of the home and we know will be transporting another child to school every other week 800 MILES until we can find a way to move. No matter which location we live, Lucas' appointments will be every two weeks and an hour one way. The average time in a helmet is 4 to 5 months, with the time adding on as he gets older and bones fuse together :(  
 
This has been a very emotional time and situation and with many telling me this needs done NOW, I am desperate to find a way to pay to get him to and from. I have been told that long term, if this is not treated, it can cause issues with eye sight and potential disability long term.

story:
NOTE REGARDING DELIVERY DATES!
We set the deliver by date to June to make sure we don't over promise and under deliver. This is a worst case scenario and you should receive your grispter much sooner than that. We should get orders shipped by the end of March 2013.

We created The Gripster so you have more ways to train!

After seeing the various ways that rock climbers train to get stronger we decided that there was room for development, so we created The Gripster.

The Gripster has been in development now for over two years. We have created many different versions and done a lot research and testing. Many knowledgeable and experienced climbers have provided feedback about our shapes and we have adjusted them accordingly. Now that we have some great shapes locked down we are ready to share them with all the climbers out there who are psyched to find new ways to train.

  • The Gripster was designed by Mike White who currently resides in Berkeley CA.
  • The Gripster started out as a passion project, but after much encouragement from various climbers who loved it, we decided to share it with the climbing community at large.
  • The contributions from this campaign will go towards our first production scale order, without this capital we would never be able to share The Gripster at a reasonable price.

We are really excited to be here on IndieGoGo and any contribution you can provide to get this project off the ground will be deeply appreciated.

We Need capital for our first order, you get The Gripster

The fabrication of equipment like this is extremely time consuming and labour intensive:

  • We need to create many silicon molds to be able to deliver a quality product in sufficient time and quantities.
  • Each mold is made from a master shape that has been CNC Routed and hand finished.
  • If we don't reach our desired goal we will still be able to fulfil the orders we do get.

A Project of Passion

Mike White started developing The Gripster over two years ago. He has spent a lot of his free time on this project and poured a large amount of his own personal savings into its development. If we can get The Gripster off the ground with this IndieGoGo project it will make all his hard work worthwhile, and he will also be really really happy!

  • The Grispster is a great training tool and there are endless possibilities and variations of how it can be used for training.
  • The Gripster is suitable to training at home, in the gym or while traveling.
  • A home spun maker project, The Gripster was developed at TechShop SF using CNC Routers, Laser cutters and many of the wood shop tools.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you're not able to contribute at the moment, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • If you know any climbers then share our project with them on Facebook or Twitter, Its easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Gripster, The Chunkster and The Globester come in five colors. Please note, due to variations in different batches of resin, temperature and humidity levels its not always possible to get an exact color match on each product. Keep in mind that each of our products are hand made. We will always do everything we can to get the colors right but please be aware that due to these variables some batches may come out with variations in tone.

Check out the T-Shirts currently availible on thegripster.com

Got Grip T-Shirt

No Beta Symbol
T-Shirt

Get a Grip T-Shirt

Thanks for checking out our campaign and thank you for your contributions!

story:
STEM CELL 100 IS STILL AVAILABLE AND CAN BE PURCHASED AT www.StemCell100.com

 

Let's fund research that could cure millions of chronic pain, disability and diseases of aging

Many people believe stem cell therapy has great promise, but will not be available for 15 or 20 years. The reality is that adult stem cell therapy has already been utilized in a number of countries and in FDA trials with some success as a treatment for heart failure, multiple sclerosis, spinal injury, arthritis, joint problems and other conditions. Unfortunately the current treatment does not work for everyone and sometimes only to a small degree. Much of the difficulty is that each of us only has a limited number of stem cells that can be used and the greater their age the less effective they are. At Centagen we have a new approach to expand your own stem cells up to a million times without aging. We believe this will greatly increase the success rate as well as improve results for those who have received only minimal benefits. This might even be a real beginning at reversing the aging process since it supplies the body with a large number of ones own rejuvenated stem cells to rebuild organs and tissues that have been damaged by aging, injury or disease. Even better this type of adult stem cell therapy could be available fairly soon.

Maximum Life Foundation

Since 1999, Maximum Life Foundation has been dedicated to eradicating aging-related diseases, and the aging process itself.

As we age, we see every reason to be completely independent, energetic and youthful with MORE time with family and friends and MORE time to achieve each of our goals and dreams.  Our mission is to make “100 years old the New 50.”

We see no upper limits to wellness at any age, and critical technologies are related to adult stem cells.  We see these as some of the quicker paths to continually improving our bodies and minds.  While embryonic stem cells have attracted most of the investment funding, adult stem cell research can give faster and safer results and does not raise ethical issues. Adult stem cell therapies have the potential to cure many age related conditions and rejuvenate our bodies.

Won’t you be part of this pioneering effort that could dramatically extend the youthful portions of our lives and the lives of our families?  Supporting these technologies now could keep our generation from being left behind in this race for cures. Our Research Fund provides financing for adult stem cell research and development projects. These critical technologies have a hard time attracting investment dollars because they will most likely not show short-term profits.

Some of the benefits of adult stem cell therapy are available now

Although the focus of Centagen is clinical therapeutics with amplified stem cells, we applied some of  our technology to create an effective nutraceutical supplement that promotes adult stem cells.  Stem Cell 100TM combines ten pharmaceutical-grade natural vegetarian extracts that promote regenerative stem cells in the body.  Stem Cell 100TM acts by stimulating biological processes needed to promote healthy stem cells, while inhibiting the degenerative inflammatory reactions that limit stem cell function. Along with our clinical therapeutics, we are developing additional supplements that promote our own stem cells and have a positive benefit on other mechanisms of aging. Stem Cell 100 does not contain any stem cells. It is made with pharmaceutical grade plant extracts that have been used for thousands of years.

SIGNALS was formulated to send your skin the same rejuvenating "signals" as young adult stem cells to lessen the effects of aging on your skin. Laboratory tests prove ongoing users look 10, 15, even 20 years younger. The 3-step Skin Care System includes Signals Exfoliant, Signals Day Lotion and Signals Night Cream. From a former Miss America to successful business leaders of today, people around the world are benefiting from the breakthrough stem cell technology of SIGNALS. It does not contain stem cells.

 


If you contribute $150 all the perks you will receive have a retail value of approximately $300.

If you can't contribute, you can still help!

Get the word out and help make some noise about Centagen Adult Stem Cell Rejuvenation. Share this campaign with your friends, family, and followers! You can also help by leaving a comment which is done by clicking on the "Comments" tab near the top of this page, clicking the Facebook "Like" button located below the video above and clicking the "Tweet" button. 

Centagen Laboratories

Centagen is a biotechnology company that is developing medical therapies that utilize a patient's own adult stem cells. The company has a new technology to expand adult stem cells in vitro (in the lab) up to 1 million times, then rejuvenate them and inject the stem cells back into the person from which they came. This will help repair and rejuvenate organs and tissues damaged by aging, disease and injury.

Each of us has a limited supply of the kind of stem cells needed to rebuild, repair, and rejuvenate any part of our body. As we age, the supply of these cells become smaller while their healing power diminishes. By providing a practically unlimited supply of one's own rejuvenated stem cells, we believe it will be possible to keep people young and healthy for over a century. There is also great hope for those with various health conditions related to aging, disease or injury to recover and live life to the fullest.

Adult stem cells can be extracted from your blood, fat, or skin and then multiplied a million fold in rejuvenating tissue culture.  Our technology requires no genetic engineering of the stem cells, so the procedure is much safer than the current procedures requiring genetic tampering. Only your own adult stem cells would be used, so there are no ethical issues common with embryonic stem cell use or side effects due to tissue rejection by your immune system.

Everyone has adult stem cells that are capable of repairing nearly all tissues in the body. Unfortunately, these adult stem cells typically decline in number or function as we age and can be depleted by injuries or illnesses. The current use of adult stem cells is limited by the small number of such cells in the body and by the current difficulty of amplifying fully functional adult stem cells in cell culture.  Using our proprietary technology, we can multiply the rare adult stem cells in cell culture without aging them or degrading their function.  One innovation involves lengthening the telomeres while amplifying the stem cells.

It is difficult to obtain normal funding for this kind of research, as the current stem cell research is focused on embryonic stem (ES) cells or genetically induced Pluripotent Stem (iPS) cells.  The potential of ES and iPS cells are very exciting, but that potential is many years away from yielding safe and affordable treatments of diseases and medical conditions.  Research indicates that many of the same remarkable healing benefits can be achieved sooner and cheaper by safely utilizing your own adult stem cells. 

After sufficient research and clinical work on the safety and effectiveness of rejuvenated adult stem cells is obtained, the stem cells can be utilized by hospitals and clinics for a wide range of age-related disorders and medical conditions.  Adult stem cells have the potential to save billions of dollars by curing or greatly improving age related conditions that are now treated as chronic disorders needing continuous medical intervention.

story:
This fund is for Diane Cannon, recently diagnosed with late stage Lyme Disease.

 

Diane Cannon is a mother, a wife, a martial arts teacher, and a friend among other things.  A devout Catholic, she is a parishioner of St. Elizabeth’s Parish in Wilmington, Delaware and a Novice in the Lay Fraternity of St. Dominic.  She currently works as a cook and housekeeper for the Diocese of Wilmington. She also teaches martial arts and has taught over 1,000 people in her 25 year tenure. 

 

Strong, diligent, vibrant, and energetic, her health took an unfortunate turn for the worse in January 2012.  What started as general abdominal pain soon became chronic and debilitating.  Over the past 9 months, she has seen many doctors and medical specialists all of which were unable to diagnose the problem.  Nothing conclusive was discovered through countless CT, MRI, Ultrasounds, blood work, and bone scans.  With no assignable cause, nothing except basic pain management was administered while more theories were developed.  Unfortunately, the pain management was not very effective and she soon found it difficult to walk or perform basic tasks and eventually has become close to bed ridden.  In addition, the constant tests, trips to the ER, etc. have left her with some considerable medical bills.

 

Through the diligence of one dedicated physician, it was finally diagnosed as Lyme Disease.  However, the failure of a diagnosis in the previous 9 months (and any effective treatment) has enabled the disease to enter late stage.  The treatment for this will require her to be on disability while she heals, a benefit not included in her employment contract.  These treatments will also add to the significantly high costs of the previous medical tests.

 

This fund is being established to defray the accumulating medical bills and to assist with lost wages during her disability, both of which add considerable stress.  Your contributions will help make a difference in her life.  The projected need during her recovery is estimated at $16,000 among medical bills, medication, supplements to strengthen her immune system, and lost wages.

 

Any contribution is truly appreciated. 

 

Not everyone is able to help financially.  If you would like to help in another way, please let others know about this campaign.

She also teaches martial arts and has taught over 1,000 people in her 25 year tenure. 
 
Strong, diligent, vibrant, and energetic, her health took an unfortunate turn for the worse in January 2012.  What started as general abdominal pain soon became chronic and debilitating.  Over the past 9 months, she has seen many doctors and medical specialists all of which were unable to diagnose the problem.  Nothing conclusive was discovered through countless CT, MRI, Ultrasounds, blood work, and bone scans.  With no assignable cause, nothing except basic pain management was administered while more theories were developed.  Unfortunately, the pain management was not very effective and she soon found it difficult to walk or perform basic tasks and eventually has become close to bed ridden.  In addition, the constant tests, trips to the ER, etc. have left her with some considerable medical bills.
 
Through the diligence of one dedicated physician, it was finally diagnosed as Lyme Disease.  However, the failure of a diagnosis in the previous 9 months (and any effective treatment) has enabled the disease to enter late stage.  The treatment for this will require her to be on disability while she heals, a benefit not included in her employment contract.  These treatments will also add to the significantly high costs of the previous medical tests.
 
This fund is being established to defray the accumulating medical bills and to assist with lost wages during her disability, both of which add considerable stress.  Your contributions will help make a difference in her life.  The projected need during her recovery is estimated at $16,000 among medical bills, medication, supplements to strengthen her immune system, and lost wages.
 
Any contribution is truly appreciated. 
 
Not everyone is able to help financially.  If you would like to help in another way, please let others know about this campaign.

Story

Rich has been a great friend to so many people.  Help Rich get better.
